About BP
Our business is the exploration, production, refining, trading and distribution of energy. This is what we do, and we do it on a truly global scale. BP operates with business activities and customers in more than 80 countries across six continents. Every day, we serve millions of customers around the world. We are continually looking for talented, committed and ambitious people to help us shape the face of energy for the future.

Integrated Supply & Trading (IST) is BP's face to the traded markets for BP in oil, gas, power, chemicals and finance. IST's role is to enhance Group value through distinctive supply, commodity trading, risk management and information technology skills underpinned by a world class finance, control and compliance infrastructure. IST has a dynamic and highly skilled workforce, which creates value by combining analysis and commercial innovation with the material asset base of BP.

IST fosters a diverse and inclusive workplace for all employees. We are proud of our stance on fairness, equal opportunity and meritocracy, which focuses on all of our employees reaching their full potential.

IST Information Technology & Services (IT&S) is the progressive global IT arm of BP. The expertise IT&S provides is central to the operation and development of Integrated Supply & Trading (IST) - one of the world's largest energy trading businesses. Delivering innovative solutions for supply and commodity trading activity across IST's Global Gas and Oil Strategic Performance Units is at the heart of what IT&S does.

Our people and culture are diverse, reflecting the truly global nature of our business - in excess of 500 employees provide a presence in over 50 countries, with key hubs in London, Chicago, Houston, Calgary and Singapore. We support our people by offering an exciting variety of professions and provide excellent training opportunities to help them progress their careers.

description:
We’re looking for a Marketing Analyst to be the CSI to our strategic and marketing initiatives – particularly in extracting insights about our clients’ customers.

You could be inferring customer segments from demographic, psychographic, and transactional data; or building customer/prospect propensity models; or building lead scoring models that speed up prospect qualification (and get more ka-ching $$$); or… and the list goes on.

You’re responsible for defining the research question, how to do it and with what data. That includes look for the right data (be it from client, scraping it, or buying it from data brokers), wrangle the data into analytics-ready shape, and analyse it with the right algorithms and models (be it from tools, pre-trained models, or your own R/Python code).

Does it sound like you’ll be good at it?

Send us your CV. We’ll talk shop. Remember: Bring your analytics toolkit.

Responsibilities

Lead and participate in data strategy development for clients and new business
Identify analytic questions, data, and analytical experiments
Find and pre-process structured and unstructured data
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Generate visualisations and reports to present your findings
Add and maintain our strategic knowledge base
We expect you to…

Work well with technical specialists, account managers and strategy planners
Use the predictive models, data mining and segmentation techniques
Use analytics to make the jump from data to insights
Be strong in maths
Publish analytics findings as reports, blog posts/whitepapers
You are the sort of person who…

Always ask questions and demands evidence
Deals with ambiguity well. How? You tell u
Is intellectually restless and rigorous
Can explain hard, complex ideas to your grandmother
Requirements

Intelligence, self-awareness, analytical thinking
Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics degree. Graduate degree in Data Science preferred
2+ years of experience as a data analyst or similar capacity
Familiarity with Data Mining tools (such as SAS Miner, Orange, Rapid Miner) and Visualisation tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI), machine learning and data wrangling packages in R/Python, and machine learning/data algorithms
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analysing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)
Why join us?

Be part of a team of passionate digital specialists
Grow with annual training that is relevant to your profession and the industry
Be part of our yearly company trip where our 4 offices come together to have fun
Be rewarded with a competitive salary and performance based bonus
Be equipped with premium hardware and up-to-date software & tools in a great working environment

description:

Description

The primary focus of the role is to create and conceptualise models to drive insights from the diverse data sets in StarHub to deliver analytic solutions to support Finance Business Intelligence.The role requires analysis of large amounts of raw information to find patterns that will help improve decision making process for the company. You are expected to build data models to extract valuable business insights. In this role, you should be highly analytical with a knack for analysis, math and statistics. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for interpreting data. Passion for machine-learning and research would be a plus.
Responsibilities :
Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
Identify, evaluate and deploy new technologies and solutions to enhance the efficiency and speed of processing and analysing huge volumes of data
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
Combine models through ensemble modeling
Present information using data visualization techniques
Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges
Work with Finance and Business teams to conduct quantitative analysis, draw qualitative conclusions, and transform data sets into value-added information useful to the business
Qualifications

Bachelor/ Diploma in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Computer/ Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Information System and equivalent, preferably majoring in Info-Communication Technology
Experience in data mining and ability to work with large amounts of data (facts, figures, and number crunching) to discover patterns and trends
Analytical mind and business acumen with ability to look at the numbers, trends, and data and form conclusions based on findings
Transform business requirements into mathematical and statistical models for analysis and solutioning
Data Intuition : Ask the right questions – recognize what things are important and what things are not important
Problem-solving aptitude
Strong math skills (e.g. statistics, algebra)
Proven ability to handle multiple projects concurrently
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Knowledge of R, SQL, Python, SPSS Statistics, etc.; familiarity with VBA, Java or C++ is an asset.
Exposure to databases such as Netezza, SAP BW is a plus.
Experience using business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau) and data frameworks (e.g. Hadoop) would be an advantage.

An Operations Analyst is responsible for operational analysis supporting the hotel's continuing effort to deliver outstanding guest service and financial profitability. Y
ou will work directly with departmental managers. You will collect metric on the hotels's labour force; analyses and assesses this data; and recommends strategies to further the operational and financial goals of the business. Operation team will use this data to perform workforce scheduling with the intent of optimizing service and productivity levels within payroll budget constraints.


What will I be doing?


Planning Activities

Conducts research into labour management/auto scheduling systems suitable for the hotel and stays attuned of developments within workforce planning/management field.
Collaborates with external provider and internal stakeholders to maximise the functionality of the current HR/payroll system.
Conducts organisational studies to measure/evaluate workplace design and process flows to find means of simplification and improvement.
Leads activities around labour modelling and productivity innovation to create cost effective business processes.
works with departmental mangers to review job responsibilities and establish and maintain standard operating procedures and skill matrices.
Actively involved in the ongoing assessment of the hotel's organisational structure suitability to meet its mid to long term objectives.
Actively contributes to the manpower planning and payroll budget as part of the annual business plan and monthly rolling forecast.
Develops in conjunction with the department managers, strategies and methodologies through which these monthly targets and annual objectives are to be accomplished.
Operational Activities

Communicates with commercial and financial heads to find common ground in revenue projections and labour planning.
Evaluates and forecasts labour requirements using historical data/benchmarking analysis/financial expectations to ensure the hotel's ability to meet operational commitments.
Organises weekly meetings and liaises extensively with department/outlet managers on labour rosters.
Publishes and updates in advance weekly labour rosters in HR system for all operating departments.
Ensures rosters are prepared in accordance with Collective agreement, MOM regulations and hotel policies.
Adjust daily rosters to accommodate for changes in business levels and unforeseen absence to cater for optimal operational manning requirements.
Develops and implements rostering efficiencies including identifying and recommending solutions to technical and practical processes.
Monitors daily productivity and payroll costs; recognises and interprets anomalies, trend and risks; communicates recommendations accordingly.
Reports weekly labour scheduling metrics and comparatives between actual manning and that scheduled.
Develops and complete labour analytic dashboard and adhoc reports as required.
Support Activities

Provides direct support to department heads and managers as relates to labour management
Conducts periodic training on systems and tools related to labour management
Assists with the maintenance of employee records including leave, absenteeism, cross functional costing and other team member movements.
Assists with maintaining the integrity and accuracy of data within the HR/payroll system
Assists with the maintenance and upkeep of the HR/payroll system and its restricted access.
Fosters adherence to internal control and policy/procedural compliance
Acts as a conduit to escalate workplace management issues to Human Resources and executive managements.
Supports commercial and operational departments in areas of labour planning and costing for new product development and revenue opportunities.

What are we looking for?


An Operations Analyst, serving Hilton brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the qualifications, skills, attitude, behaviours and values that follow:

Tertiary qualifications in Hospitality or related field
3-5 year or more hotel or hospitality industry experience in sales, revenue management and front office
Strong administration and communication skills
Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office suite especially Excel.
Strong Analytical and detail-oriented aptitude; a high degree of accuracy is required.
Ability to manage time effectively, set priorities and meet deadlines
Fluent in English, both spoken and written.
What will it be like to work for Hilton?


Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its
global brands
. Our vision “to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality” unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!


EOE/AA/Disabled/Veterans

title: Operations Analyst

description:
The Company
Willis Towers Watson is a leading global advisory, broking and solutions company that helps clients around the world turn risk into a path for growth. With roots dating to 1828, Willis Towers Watson has 40,000 employees serving more than 140 countries. We design and deliver solutions that manage risk, optimize benefits, cultivate talent, and expand the power of capital to protect and strengthen institutions and individuals. Our unique perspective allows us to see the critical intersections between talent, assets and ideas – the dynamic formula that drives business performance. Together, we unlock potential. Learn more at willistowerswatson.com.

The Business

Human capital and benefits
High-performing institutions cultivate and grow talent, carefully balancing costs and rewards. From employee benefits to executive compensation, we take a rounded perspective, based on leading-edge thinking, data, analytics and software, unearthing new ways to motivate people, foster wellbeing and implement solutions that work.

The Role

As an Executive Compensation Analyst, you will be expected to work on a variety of client projects and to work within and across multiple teams. You will undergo training to learn our standards of research and data capture on individual modules and databases. The initial focus will be on analysing disclosure of recent public company filings, seeking to capture specific data points related to disclosed executive compensation design and governance issues.
Training will then focus on researching and analysing topical areas, such as director compensation, share utilization, severance, clawback, executive transition, and/or business transactions. Analysts will receive regulator feedback from other team members, and on the job opportunities with client work.

Performance Objectives:
Review and analyze compensation and corporate governance pertaining to top executives and non-employee directors.
Review data for accuracy and completeness and draw presentable conclusions from your analysis.
Work within a high speed and geographically disperse team environment.
Participate in the design and maintenance of custom Executive Compensation proprietary databases.
Participate in the design and implementation of Executive Compensation and Incentive programs for existing and new clients
Work directly with managers and executive leadership of large firms to evaluate and develop compensation and rewards strategies that facilitate achievement of business and human capital strategies.


The Requirements

An undergraduate degree is required
This is a job where you will be required to spend a lot of time reading business disclosure, however no prior knowledge in executive compensation is necessary.
Excellent reading comprehension and communication skills are a must, and advanced knowledge and proven use of data analysis, formulas and VBA.
Proactively takes initiative
Analytical; able to draw conclusions from data in a logical, systematic way
Conceptual; ability to go beyond the details and see the big picture
Results-driven; focused on achieving results that promote business success
Communicator; displays strong oral, written and public speaking skills
Organized; able to work and think in a methodical and orderly way
Committed to quality; continuously works to achieve the highest quality standards
Team player; Ability to work independently as well as in a team

title: Analyst, Valuation, Reporting and Analytics

description:
A LITTLE ABOUT US
From clunky apps to hidden fees, banking as we know it is broken. So we decided to build a company from the ground that would challenge the bigger players and reinvent how people interact with their money - for the better.

Traditional banks are slow and expensive. Realistically, you’re nothing but a number to them with dollar signs attached. So, one continent at a time, we plan on changing this.
This may sound a little salesy, but we’ve signed up more than 1.5m customers without spending a single penny on marketing. It’s simple really: if you solve an everyday problem, you don’t need to spend a gazillion dollars on fancy marketing campaigns.
OUR CULTURE
To put it bluntly - it’s about getting shit done and owning what you do. We don’t hide behind fancy job titles or set up bureaucratic processes. Instead we treat our people equally, fairly and give them a ton of freedom and autonomy to create something awesome.
We make mistakes, we learn from them and we back everything up with data and logic.
In two years, we’ve grown to over 350 people and we’re adding around 30 new additions each month. From engineers to marketers, we’re on the hunt for exceptional talent to help us scale our business and get Revolut in the hands of millions of people everywhere.
WHAT WE NEED

We're looking for an Implementation Analyst to join our Operations Team.
Revolut does Operations differently. We sit at the very core of Revolut and facilitate growth and automation across all parts of the company. The team is responsible for taking key strategic and operational decisions always based on data. In the past, the Operations team:

Launched the Revolut Card
Launched Premium Accounts
Built payments & banking infrastructure
Launched one of the first banking chatbots
Saved Millions of pounds for the business

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING ✍️


Help build and optimise processes to prepare the company for hyper growth
Execute and scale global operations
Product improvement: Proactively help execute new features to provide a seamless customer experience
Manage & maintain critical vendor relationships and track performance
Implement strategic supply chain partnerships.

WHAT SKILLS YOU’LL NEED


You have graduated with at least a 2:1 in a STEM degree from a top university and a willingness to get stuff done.
You have a solid track record of achievement - e.g. You have worked in a top tech company and/or startup, have quickly assumed responsibilities or have won competition awards (can be any of academic, professional, and/or sport)
You can break complex problems into smaller ones and enjoy working with data using Excel. Bonus points for; SQL, Python
You are curious in nature and interested in making an impact. You can demonstrate this through various projects you have been involved in
You can make a good business case and convince people to help you execute

Benefits:

You’ll get to work in one of the hottest and fastest growing tech startups in the world right now
We’ll arm you with all of the latest tech equipment
Competitive salary
Free Revolut Premium subscription
title: Operations Analyst

description:
Telenor Procurement Company (TPC),
established in 2017 and headquartered in Singapore, operates as a subsidiary of the Telenor Group. TPC will deliver Global Category Management as a service to the Telenor Business Units, taking full accountability for the end-to-end sourcing process and performance of global spend categories


Telenor Group is embarking on a digital transformation journey. TPC aims to be an enabler for this transformation, by becoming a center of expertise and a business partner, in the pursuit of efficient operations. The TPC seeks qualified procurement professionals that are excited and capable to work in the fast-paced Telecoms field.


Are you a young professional in the beginning of your career? Want a unique opportunity to develop skills in sourcing, analysis, strategy, negotiation and management within a high- skill environment?


About the Role


As a
Sourcing Analyst
you will be part of the ISIT Sourcing team and you will report to the Head of Infrastructure Category. You will work closely with both corporate in Telenor and all of the Business Units.


The team is establishing a centralized procurement function for infrastructure and applications. This requires not only a solid skillset within business and sourcing, but also the skills and abilities necessary to drive change within a large, complex and diverse organization.


The
Sourcing Analyst
will be supporting the team with analysis, planning and execution of global sourcing initiatives and operations. This will span everything from financial evaluation of the vendor portfolio and spend profiling of our own business - to actively participating in contract negotiations and demand management processes.


Who are we looking for?


The successful candidate in this role is believed to be a young professional eager to develop within Sourcing and Procurement. You should have an academic understanding of relevant business subjects and/or relevant technology subjects.


A large part of the work will be about
gathering
and
analyzing
large amounts of data and
presenting
them. Accordingly, the candidate should have a balance of strong analytical skills and excellent communication skills.


Because the team is working within a technology heavy domain, it is expected that the candidate has at the very least an interest in the subjects, if not a direct competence within them. These subjects include IT Infrastructure, Hardware, Digitization, Cloud, Enterprise Applications, Telecommunications and more.


Lastly, the candidate must be a good team player, have solid integrity and wishing to work within an absolute framework of ethics.


Your background and skills:

Excellent communication skills and fluency in written and spoken English.
A Master’s degree in Finance, Business or Engineering, supply chain or similar
Proficiency in MS Excel and PowerPoint
No more than 2 years working experience
Relevant Technology background can count as an advantage
A good balance of analytical and creative skills are expected
Structured and organized approach to work
You should be comfortable presenting material, leading meetings and holding an argument in a challenging environment

Why should you want to work for us?

An opportunity to establish and develop skills within sourcing, analysis, strategy, negotiation and management within a high- skill environment.
A unique opportunity to take part in the establishment of a procurement company
A job in a diverse international company, with 30,000+ colleagues and strong career opportunities for the right candidate
Great premises and a diverse work environment in the Guoco tower, Singapore

Other information:

For questions regarding the application process or technical issues contact Annette.kollenborg@telenor.com.
Please do not send your CV via email, your application should be registered by using the Apply Now button.
Candidates must hold a valid permit to work and live in Singapore
TPC Offices are located at 1 Wallich St #28-01, Guoco Tower, Singapore 078881
Application deadline: ASAP

Important note regarding this recruitment: We are not working with any vendors. If you are interested in this role, please submit your application to us directly through our portal. We do not have any recruitment agency working for us/presenting CVs to us.


About Telenor Group


Telenor Group is a leading telecommunications company with 178 million mobile subscribers and annual revenues of around USD 16 billion (2017). The Group has mobile operations in 12 markets across Europe and Asia, and fixed and broadcast operations in Scandinavia. We hold #1 or #2 positions in most of our markets. Majority ownership to all core assets enables strong governance and global scale benefits. Our 30,000 employees are committed to responsible business conduct. Connectivity has been Telenor's domain for more than 160 years, and we are driven by the ambition of empowering societies. Telenor is listed at Oslo Stock Exchange under the ticker TEL. For more information, see
www.telenor.com
title: Sourcing Analyst

description:
Company Overview
Style Theory is a Fashion-Technology company that is redefining Fashion Consumption. We believe that there is an inefficiency in the way we consume fashion in today's world and are on a mission to provide a smarter solution.


We are currently Southeast Asia's largest and fastest growing Fashion Rental startup. Our core product is Fashion Rental Subscription using a “Netflix-for-Fashion” model, the first and only of its kind in the region. Today, we are focused on building more products to improve Fashion Consumption and driving these solutions across the region.
Responsibilities and Duties
Analyze operational efficiency metrics to identify bottlenecks, refine processes and ensure a consistent, high-quality customer experience
Driving and supporting in a day to day internal operations for core activities such as vendor management and fleet management
Managing service partners to ensure the quality and timeliness of their services
Developing processes to perform data reconciliation for budgeting and cost allocation
Documenting process flows and creating procedure manuals for the functions performed
Contributing to improve processes, reduce risks, increase controls and/or increase customer satisfaction
Lead efforts in improvement and development of new and scalable processes to efficiently grow the business
Work across multiple different teams to ensure smooth operations and do whatever's needed to get things DONE!
Qualifications and Skills
Bachelor's Degree with strong academic records from top institutions
Strong analytical skills and data-driven; comfortable analyzing and making decision-based on numbers
1 year of working in a relevant fast-moving startup a plus
Proficient in using Microsoft Excel. Basic Microsoft office skills are required
Take ownership, with great organizational skills and well follow through on tasks
Enthusiastic, can-do attitude. Willing to be flexible and take on challenging tasks
Team-working skills. Have the ability to work cross-functionally and interact with internal and external partners
Fast learner and be comfortable working in a fast-changing startup environment
Excellent communication skills in English
title: Logistics Analyst

description:
The candidate will report to the Head of Actuarial Modelling and work closely with other actuarial associates and actuaries on the Life Health regional team. The mission of this position is to assist in the AXIS modelling project related to pricing, valuation, experience study, solvency and planning issues. This AXIS model is used for internal and external reporting, monitoring the performance of the company, its ability to meet future obligations, and for capital and investment planning. The level of assistance will be determined by the experience of the incumbent and the needs of the department. This role consists of the following responsibilities: Constructing product feature related tables in AXIS
Ensuring appropriate assumptions including mortalities, lapses, interest rates and expenses for specific life products
Ensuring accuracy of cash flows for Business Projection, pricing, valuation and Embedded Value
Maintaining and enhancing data control processes and systems used for financial reporting
Providing assistance for financial reporting and experience analysis issues in an effective manner within the department as well as to other departments such as Pricing, Marketing, Underwriting and Claims University Degree in Actuarial Science, Finance, Statistics, or Mathematics
Career associate or recent associate progressing towards attainment of fellowship with one of international actuarial organizations is desired
Strong Excel (incl. VBA), Access (incl. SQL) skills are required; AXIS skills are desired
Superior attention to detail and accuracy
Well-developed time management skills; ability to work independently while supporting the team work
Good communications skills (report writing and formal presentations) Munich Re is one of the world’s leading reinsurance companies with approximately 13,000 employees in over 50 locations around the globe. As an industry leader, we provide a unique opportunity to be part of a global success story. We offer our employees a diverse and challenging work environment which champions high performance, professional development, innovation and passion; and rewards top performers with a highly competitive total rewards package.
title: Actuarial Analyst (WL)

description:
IT Application Services -System Analyst (Payment) - (180000D4)
Description
The position requires problem recognition, troubleshooting, prioritization of steps, resolution, and implementing recommended solutions to meet the defined SLI. The role is required to provide production support for multiple payment applications. This includes investigation into complex application and/or interface issues, understanding the problem and identifying/recommending the appropriate action to resolve them. The candidate will also require co-ordination with both internal and external teams to understand the cause and help resolve the issue.
The candidate should be motivated to work in fast-paced, fast-growth environment where many changes take place routinely. The candidate will expect to work with a diverse team of system analysts, system engineers, database administrators and developers, for providing application architecture, reliability, data architecture, reporting fulfilment, and operational support.
Responsibilities:
Undertake Business-As-Usual responsibilities in supporting Remittance Systems, and/or SWIFT suite of applications (SWIFTAlliance Access, SWIFTAlliance Gateway)
Work with users and vendor on issues, follow up and resolution for Payment systems.
Work with cross functional teams to identify and resolve root cause of a problem.
Perform due diligence when taking over from project teams into BAU mode.
Manage the BAU Software Release cycles.
Participate in Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity exercises
Provide on-call support and afterhours/weekend support as needed, covering application support and application change deployment.
Perform system review and propose improvement and prevention measures on current systems.
Have a quality mind-set with prevention attitude to attain zero defects

Qualifications

At least 5 years of IT experience with knowledge of SWIFT systems
Technical hands-on knowledge in maintaining and manage changes on SWIFT suite of applications
Self-motivated and possess drive, and ability to work independently and a good team player
Must be technically competent to provide technical advice to the team and to be involved in minor software changes occasionally.
Experience in performing root cause analysis of production problems and provide quick service recovery if required.
Experience in managing Software Release cycle.
Essential to have a can do attitude to work under multi-tasking environment.
Strong understanding in banking and back-office operations related to Cash Management and Payment
Good Communication Skills.

Primary Location: Singapore
Job: Technology Solutions
Organization: Group Operations & Technology Division
Schedule: Permanent
: Full-time
Job Posting: Feb 26, 2018, 12:41:47 AM
title: IT Application Services -System Analyst (Payment)

description:
Your Responsibilities :

At GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) we are dedicated to improving the quality of human life by enabling people to do more, feel better, live longer. GSK is one of the world’s leading research based healthcare companies, with over 100,000 employees in 150 countries across our Pharmaceuticals, Vaccines and Consumer Healthcare business.


We are proud of the difference we make and in 2016, FORTUNE Magazine ranked GSK #1 on its list of companies that are changing the world. The 'Change the World' list recognises companies that have made significant progress in sustainable, scalable approaches to addressing societal problems as part of their company strategy. Put simply, our focus is on improving access and affordability of medicines, regardless of where people live or their ability to pay.


GSK has been present in Asia for over 50 years and our commitment to the region is strengthened by the establishment of our purpose-built headquarters for Asia. Situated in Singapore, GSK Asia House is a further step in our long-standing strategy to grow and diversify our company - emphasizing the globally balanced business we have built over the years. To better support Asia, we focus on developing talent to improve our ability to make the right decisions for healthcare professionals, patients and consumers across the region.


GSK Vaccines grew by 14% in 2016 and is one of the largest in the world. Every year we distribute nearly 1 billion doses to 170 countries, of which over 80% were supplied to developing countries. We produce 30 paediatric and adult vaccines, 11 of which are world first, to prevent a range of infectious diseases including; hepatitis, rotavirus and HPV infections, diphtheria, tetanus, whooping cough, measles, mumps, rubella, bacterial meningitis and influenza. Our Tuas site, one of only two GSK global vaccines manufacturing facilities worldwide, operates around-the-clock to manufacture the active ingredient used to make a GSK vaccine that protects children against pneumonia.


The Role

We are currently looking for one individual to join the Quality team as a QC Analyst (Associate), reporting to the QC Superintendent.


As the successful candidate, you will be part of the team performing testings and support related activities in the Chemistry team. The work schedule is fixed from Monday to Friday, 8am to 5pm.


Key responsibilities include:

• Performs routine and non-routine testings in the following areas with observation of GMP requirements:

o Chemical testings for raw materials, intermediates/products and utilities

o Chemical testings to support manufacturing processes/process validations

• Participates in laboratory investigations (when required) and assist in timely closure of investigations, CAPAs and deviations

• Performs equipment calibration, maintenance and validation as assigned

• Perform peer review for verification of task and data

• Assists in LSOPs writing

• Participates in method verification and method validation/transfer (when required)

• Identify and report problems in QC to supervisor in timely manner

• Practices 6S and ensures good housekeeping of laboratory, work area and equipment

• Ensures good inventory of QC materials (purchased and prepared materials/glassware) to support testings; ensures no over-surplus of inventory

• Ensures wastes are disposed appropriately and promptly


What We Can Offer You

GSK’s dedication to the wellbeing of our employees is reflected in the benefits we offer; including healthcare for yourself and dependents, performance related bonus, long term incentives and a host of other flexible offerings you can tailor to your own preferences. We also offer a range of employee health and wellbeing programs including our truly unique Partnership for Prevention program, a global commitment by GSK to provide all employees with up to 40 preventative healthcare services bringing to life our mission to: do more, feel better and live longer.


Application Process

At GSK we value diversity and treat all candidates equally. We aim to create an inclusive workplace where all employees feel engaged, supportive of one another, and know their work makes an important contribution.


If you would like to join us in innovating and inspiring changes in the industry, we urge you to apply.


Closing date for applications: 10 December 2017


*LI-GSK


Why You? 

Basic qualifications:

• Diploma in science discipline (Chemistry preferred)


Preferred qualifications:

Technical

• Good laboratory knowledge and hands-on experience in chemical testings

• Laboratory equipment qualification (advantage)

• Knowledge of cGLP & cGMP (advantage)


Business

• Effective report writing skills

• Good interpersonal skills

• Planning and organizing skills (for individual time management and work planning)

• Team player


Why GSK? :

At GSK, our mission is to improve the quality of human life by enabling people to do more, feel better and live longer. Our three world-leading businesses research and deliver innovative medicines, vaccines and consumer healthcare products. We need a talented and motivated workforce to deliver against our strategy. To achieve this, we strive to attract the best people and to create an environment that empowers and inspires.


Contact information:

You may apply for this position online by selecting the Apply now button.


Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies


GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.
title: QC Analyst (Chemistry)

description:
Your Responsibilities :

The 'Change the World' list recognises companies that have made significant progress in sustainable, scalable approaches to addressing societal problems as part of their company strategy. GSK has been present in Asia for over 50 years and our commitment to the region is strengthened by the establishment of our purpose-built headquarters for Asia. Situated in Singapore, GSK Asia House is a further step in our long-standing strategy to grow and diversify our company - emphasizing the globally balanced business we have built over the years. To better support Asia, we focus on developing talent to improve our ability to make the right decisions for healthcare professionals, patients and consumers across the region.


GSK Vaccines grew by 14% in 2016 and is one of the largest in the world. Every year we distribute nearly 1 billion doses to 170 countries, of which over 80% were supplied to developing countries. We produce 30 paediatric and adult vaccines, 11 of which are world first, to prevent a range of infectious diseases including; hepatitis, rotavirus and HPV infections, diphtheria, tetanus, whooping cough, measles, mumps, rubella, bacterial meningitis and influenza. Our Tuas site, one of only two GSK global vaccines manufacturing facilities worldwide, operates around-the-clock to manufacture the active ingredient used to make a GSK vaccine that protects children against pneumonia.


The Role

We are currently looking for two individuals to join the Quality team as a QC Analyst (Associate), reporting to the QC Superintendent. One will join the microbiology team and the other will join the biochemistry team.


As the successful candidate, you will be part of the team performing testings and support related activities in the Biological team. When you join, you will work from Monday to Friday (8am to 5pm) for a period of 3 to 4 months before commencing on shift work; Tuesday to Saturday (8am to 5pm) and Sunday to Thursday (8am to 5pm) alternatively (every 1 month).


Key responsibilities include:

• Performs routine and ad-hoc testings in the following areas with observation of GMP requirements:

- Biological testings for raw materials release – (All QA controlled materials). Biological testings refer to biochemistry and microbiological testings which includes ELISA, Endotoxin (kinetic and gel clot method), Sterility, etc.

- Biological testings for intermediates, products, and in-process rinse samples

- Testings for utilities (city water, purified water, water of injection, compressed gases, etc)

- Biological testings required for manufacturing process validations and confirmations

• Initiate and participates in laboratory investigations (OOS/deviations/atypical results/invalid results) and assist in timely closure of lab investigations and CAPA

• Performs equipment calibration, maintenance and validation

• Participate in method transfer/method verification of new samples/validation of new equipment

• Performs peer review for verification of task and data

• Assists in SOPs writing

• Identify and report problems in QC to supervisor in timely manner

• Practices 6S and ensures good housekeeping of laboratory, work area and equipment

• Ensures good inventory of QC materials (purchased and prepared materials/glassware) to support testings; ensures no over-surplus of inventory

• Ensures wastes are disposed appropriately and promptly

• Esures completion of daily assigned tasks and documentation following GDP


We have two vacancies. Due to the equipment that the role in the biochemistry team handles, it is preferred that you are at least 1.65m in height.


Also, you will need to be comfortable with working on shift (Tuesday to Saturday and Sunday to Thursday alternatively).


What We Can Offer You

GSK’s dedication to the wellbeing of our employees is reflected in the benefits we offer; including healthcare for yourself and dependents, performance related bonus, long term incentives and a host of other flexible offerings you can tailor to your own preferences. We also offer a range of employee health and wellbeing programs including our truly unique Partnership for Prevention program, a global commitment by GSK to provide all employees with up to 40 preventative healthcare services bringing to life our mission to: do more, feel better and live longer.


Application Process

At GSK we value diversity and treat all candidates equally. We aim to create an inclusive workplace where all employees feel engaged, supportive of one another, and know their work makes an important contribution.


If you would like to join us in innovating and inspiring changes in the industry, we urge you to apply.


Closing date for applications: November 22, 2017


*LI-GSK


Why You? 

Basic qualifications:

• Higher NITEC or Diploma in science discipline (Microbiology, Biology, Biotechnology, Life Science, Chemistry, Biochemistry etc)


Preferred qualifications:

Technical

• Good laboratory knowledge and hands-on experience in chemical testings

• Laboratory equipment qualification (advantage)

• Knowledge of cGLP & cGMP (advantage)


Business

• Effective report writing skills

• Good interpersonal skills

• Planning and organizing skills (for individual time management and work planning)

• Team player


Why GSK? :

At GSK, our mission is to improve the quality of human life by enabling people to do more, feel better and live longer. Our three world-leading businesses research and deliver innovative medicines, vaccines and consumer healthcare products. We need a talented and motivated workforce to deliver against our strategy. To achieve this, we strive to attract the best people and to create an environment that empowers and inspires.


Contact information:

You may apply for this position online by selecting the Apply now button.


Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies


GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

description:
APAC (Asia Pacific) HQ Control group manages the Sony Field Sales & Marketing Companies located in the region. The group's responsibilities include formulating business strategies and driving the execution and key performance indicator (KPI) tracking, regional governance and IS planning. Its Asia Pacific Regional Logistics team facilitates planning and control roles to optimize logistics operations efficiency and cost effectiveness across regional Supply Chain, including Governance of Logistics Partner management, Logistics Compliance and execution of KAIZEN activities. Its Demand and Supply Chain Management team acts as a centralized regional window responsible for building efficient demand and supply chain processes to support the business platforms. Its Marketing Communications function supports the region in the planning and execution of branding and product communication campaigns through the line.

Responsibilities:

Control Logistics cost
Set up Logistics Budgetary Cost
Analyse Logistics cost against Logistics operation data and Interpret results
Key Performance Indicators (KPI) Monitoring
Set up meaningful KPI
Work towards KPI target
Monitor progress against KPI. Review and analyse unfulfilled expected target factor
Planning & Project Management
Initiate continuous business process improvements
Logistics & Supply Chain Improvement activities and monitor the progress (PDCA)
Facilitate projects progress, conduct meeting to update project progress and status
Cost simulation for projects
Department SGA management
Review department performance and cost effectiveness
Establish effective controlling/reporting tools for the department
Administer and ensure internal procedures are in line with the company compliance, policy with optimum efficiency.
Work relations
Cross functions (Sales & Marketing, 3PL, Accounting department Warehouse, MY & SGP and HQ Logistics team)

Requirements:

Degree with at least 3 years and above of relevant experience in Supply Chain / Logistics/ Control / Planning Functions.
Knowledge of Shipping industry, Forwarding, Warehousing and Transportation will be added advantage
Proficient in Microsoft office application Skills.
Team player with positive attitude, effective communication and interpersonal skills
Possess logical thinking, good organizational and time management skills
Pro-active and results-oriented
title: Supply Chain Analyst

description:
Financial Reporting Analyst (Region Office)-044766
The Financial Reporting Analyst supports international regions and He/She generates managerial and statutory reports. He/She performs variance analysis, creates process improvements, and provides training and support to internal customers. The Financial Reporting Analyst reports to the supervisor.

Responsibilities
Provides Customer Support and Generates Reports
Generates weekly/monthly volume and revenue reports to provide management with financial results.

Generates and reviews monthly financial reports to ensure accuracy and correct variances.
Distributes financial reports to various departments to meet internal customer needs.

Financial Balance Scorecard (FBSC) Reporting
Involves in FBSC/IBSC report generation

Coordinating & collating element information for monthly reporting

Conducts Variance Analysis and System Audits
Analyzes financial reporting and data variances to identify problem root causes and implements corrective solutions.
Monitors the system to identify potential problems and eliminate recurring issues.
Audits the reporting system to ensure optimal usage and authorized user access.
Generates Ad Hoc Reports
Receives and prioritizes requests for new data reports to serve customer needs based on urgency and importance.
Collaborates with requestors to establish completion dates and ensure timely delivery.
Follows up with requestors on report specifications to ensure clear understanding of desired results.

Acts as Region coordinator to coordinate between corporate and fields
University degree holder in Finance & Accounting
Proficient in MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Analytical, strong in planning and organizing, attention to details
Good Communication and Interpersonal Skills
Good written & spoken English
Good team player
At least 2 years working experience
Job Finance & Accounting
Primary LocationSG-Singapore-Singapore (Region Office)
Schedule Full-time
title: Financial Reporting Analyst (Region Office)

description:
There’s never been a more exciting time to be at McCormick & Company, Asia Pacific. A respected global leader in flavor with more than 11,000 employees worldwide and facilities in 27 countries, McCormick produces, market and distribute spices, seasoning mixes, condiments and other flavourful products to the entire food industry. A relentless focus on growth, performance and people continues to drive strategy and success.

Our new Asia Pacific Headquarters and Technical Innovation Center in Biopolis, Singapore will support our ambitious plans for the region. With our strong footprint, winning brands and the power of our people - we're a region on the rise.

The Role

As the Finance Analyst, you will drive excellence in consolidation activities and analysis for decision support. You will lead and drive initiatives towards simplifying processes in reporting and quality reports. This role is based in Singapore and will require travel as required within the region.

Reporting to the Financial Controller, SEA, the role encompasses:

Shared statutory responsibility in completing closing activities (General Ledger, Fixed assets) of Singapore, Malaysia; oversight to Thailand
Drive efficiency in reporting standards and ensure compliance with SOX
Consolidate actual results of the business units; review and analyse performance against budget/forecast and prior year; drive KPI reporting, review CCI
Coordinate and support forecast, budget and IBP exercise; build assumptions with inputs to run budget/forecast exercise monthly, quarterly and at annual intervals.
Business partner across functions to provide commercial insights and actionable measures
Scenario modelling for decision making; perform pricing and costing analysis. Good understanding of cost structure and outlook on market prices that will influence cost in supporting sales requests
Lead/Participate in ad hoc projects – process improvement projects on reporting

The Person

3-6 Years Financial planning and analysis experience, with exposure to consolidation for the region and full set of accounts.
Finance and accounting graduates with Advanced Diploma covering >5 years of work experience, or Degree holder with >3 years of practical work experience may apply
Extremely Proficient in Microsoft office – Excel; comfortable with managing massive data to provide insightful information.
Strong knowledge and operational experience and use of financial systems: SAP, TM1, HFM
Analytical, independent and a problem solver
Adapt to changes positively and work well across functions and countries (Malaysia, Thailand, Indonesia)
How to Apply

If you’re have an appetite for challenge, come have a seat at our table. Apply at McCormick’s Career site via www.mccormick.com. Your application will be treated in strict confidence.
title: Financial Analyst

description:
Xilinx is the leading provider of All Programmable FPGAs, SoCs, MPSoCs and 3DICs. Xilinx's all-programmable devices are designed into tens of thousands of products that improve the quality of the everyday lives of billions of people worldwide. For over 30 years, Xilinx has been behind some of the greatest advancements in technology and science - from the industry's first fabless semiconductor model to the NASA Curiosity Mars Rover, to today's autonomous vehicles and hyperscale data centers. Xilinx uniquely enables applications that are both software-defined, yet hardware optimized - enabling smart, connected and differentiated applications across technology's biggest megatrends, including Machine Learning, 5G Wireless, Embedded Vision, Industrial IoT and Cloud Computing and more.

If you are a passionate, innovative and an out-of-the-box thinker that enjoys challenging projects, Xilinx is the right place for you. Our global team is growing and we are looking for bold, collaborative, and creative people to help deliver groundbreaking technologies that enable our customers to differentiate. Come do your best work and live your best life through collaboration, wellness and giving back to your community as a member of the ONEXILINX team.

Key responsibilities may include:
Work in Singapore Shared Services Centre (SSC), supporting business partners in San Jose headquarter, Dublin and Singapore.
Support budget planning, headcount reporting and expense tracking.
Participate in financial month end close activities with budget variance analysis and commentary.
Publish business performance metrics in alignment with corporate templates.
Support value-added analysis and simulations to enable timely decisions on business opportunities.
Responsible for performing special projects to improve process efficiency as assigned by the Management.
Maintain and develop various financial models and standard templates distributed for use by all of Finance during the planning processes, ensuring quality, accuracy and focused analytic review.
Research and resolve inquires for assigned functional areas.

Qualifications

Qualifications:
A Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance or Accountancy. Minimum 2-3 years of relevant working experience.
Strong organizational skills, meticulous and comfortable working with numbers, spreadsheets and formulas.
Ability to multi-task and work in a challenging fast paced environment.
A team player who enjoys interacting with personnel across different management levels.
Strong work ethics with a positive, can-do attitude.
Good knowledge of MS Office applications like MS Excel, PowerPoint, Access. Experience in Oracle and Hyperion Smartview is a plus.

Job Posting: Feb 23, 2018, 6:36:11 AM

Xilinx is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Applicants and employees are treated throughout the employment process without regard to age, race, gender, religion, marital status and family responsibilities, disability or sexual orientation.

Implement and support on SAP Business Objects and FICO
Create and support Queries and Dash Boards based on reporting requirements
Prepare data and import data into SAP Business Object to develop and publish stories
Analyze, design, develop, test and maintain SAP system to streamline business processes
Identification and activation of Business Data

Creating Various Data Models for the purpose of Business Intelligence

Coordinate and conduct user acceptance tests and training
Provide system documentation according to the Project Development Methodology
Apply local configuration on changing, fine tuning on SAP settings
Perform rollout to various countries
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science/Information Technology, Engineering (Computer/Telecommunication), or equivalent
At least 4 years of working experience in SAP Business Objects
At least 2 full cycles of SAP implementation
Has a strong ability to understand business processes and create solutions addressing the current and future needs of the organization
Experience integrating with HANA
Experience with development of BI reporting using SAP Business Objects tools such as Lumira and Dashboard

description:
Test Analyst, Programme Management Office - (1800004K)
Description

To perform walk through with users on testing strategy, develop test procedures and perform test execution.

Responsibilities :
Perform walk through with users on testing strategy and highlight any exceptional issues and work together to achieve an optimal goal where necessary to augment test suites completeness and rigorousness
Develop test procedures based on tests designed according to requirements
Prepare test data as required
Perform test execution, capture and analyze test results
Perform defects tracking, resolution tracking
Document and produce daily activities report
Perform documentation and version control of the test deliverables
Perform training to fellow team members and users

Qualifications

Requirements :
Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or related discipline from a recognized University.

title: Business Analyst

description:
As a Business Analyst you will be responsible for ensuring Knight Frank Asia Pacific has the best digital software applications available, to support the requirements of its growing Asia Pacific business, now and in the future. You will be part of a broad global team delivering bespoke software applications, to satisfy complex requirements, with, multi-lingual, web applications used throughout the global business. Applications will be developed using the Microsoft solution stack, including C# ASP.NET and hosting in the Microsoft Azure cloud. Your responsibilities will include:


- Writing specifications in the form of user stories, wireframes, and any other supporting documentation for requirements of software solutions to be developed.

- Obtain sign off for the specifications from senior stakeholders (including Regional and Country Heads), relevant service line leaders, application users, team members in the Marketing, Digital and Software teams and if necessary, other software providers whether internal or external to Knight Frank.

- Conducting workshops, presentations and design walkthroughs\reviews with service line staff and software developers.

- Understanding business processes and document in process flow diagrams using tools such as Microsoft Visio.

- Working with application users such as front line staff (including Country Heads, Service Line heads and operatives), Business Services (IT, Marketing, HR, Finance etc.) staff as well as team members of the Digital and Software teams.

- Follow up to ensure the software solution has fully resolved the targeted issues and has met the requirements and specifications.

- Contributing to writing software test plans and test cases using a tool such as Visual Studio Online for functional, regression and smoke testing

- Understanding and participating the testing process used in the Agile methodology


Qualifications and Experience:


A proven track record of business requirements capture and analysis for successful bespoke software development projects. Experience across several countries in Asia will be an advantage.

- Possess a degree in Management Information Systems

- Ability to lead requirements workshops and specification reviews, and compose and deliver presentations

- Experience in working on highly interactive website application developments, which implement complex data requirements and business processes

- Experience in using Agile and SCRUM

- Knowledge of some UML techniques

- Knowledge of responsive website design and development projects

- Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office 2010 applications, Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint.

- Highly Desirable - Knowledge of Residential Property Sales and Lettings or Commercial Property Agency

- Ability to communicate clearly, professionally and adapting to people at any level within the business and across a range of AP countries, to understand and assist in identifying issues and requirements

- Strong communication and presentation skills, ability to lead workshops with end-users and explain technical concepts to a technical and non-technical audience

- Good problem solving skills

- Highly organised, systematic and adaptable with an excellent attention to detail, the ability to recognise the relative importance of tasks and to prioritise work effectively

- Ability to work with all members of our software project development teams and stakeholders, in a professional and yet dynamic and creative environment , fostering an open, friendly and constructive working relationship with all members of the Knight Frank team

description:
A full-time short-term research associate / research fellow position is available in the Department of Pharmacy, Faculty of Science, National University of Singapore. The research projects in Dr. Lau Aik Jiang’s laboratory are in the areas of drug metabolism and toxicology.
The major roles and responsibilities include:
Design and conduct laboratory experiments, e.g. in vitro drug metabolism assays, enzyme kinetics, in vivo drug metabolism experiments involving mice, ultra-high performance liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry (UPLC-MS-MS) assays, development and validation of UPLC-MS-MS-based absolute protein quantification methods
Managing and taking care of the UPLC-MS instrument and related consumables
Supervision of undergraduate students in the in vitro drug metabolism assays and proper use of UPLC-MS
Perform literature searches
Write laboratory notes/reports and analyze experimental data in an organized and timely manner
Prepare posters for presentation at conferences and draft manuscripts for publication
Provide laboratory and administrative support, including but not limited to maintenance of equipment and assisting in laboratory safety matters

Qualifications

Candidates must have at least a Bachelor/Doctor of Philosophy degree in pharmacy, pharmacology, biomedical science, or a related discipline. Successful candidate will be converted to Research Fellow position upon conferment of PhD degree.
Has very strong knowledge and foundation in the areas of drug metabolism, enzyme kinetics, pharmacokinetics, bioanalytical chemistry, and toxicology
At least 4 years of research experience in a research laboratory
Highly skilled in performing the following assays: enzyme kinetics, enzyme inhibition, metabolic reaction phenotyping, metabolite identification, ultra-high performance liquid chromatography-mass spectrometry (UPLC-MS) quantification assays, method development and validation of UPLC-MS methods, ex vivo/in vivo drug metabolism experiments in rodents, collection of blood/plasma samples from rodents, and preparation of rodent tissue fractions (cytosols and microsomes) for enzyme activity assays
Experience in managing and taking care of highly sensitive UPLC-MS instruments
Experience in using the Sciex Triple Quadrupole mass spectrometers and the Analyst/MultiQuant analysis software is highly preferred
Should show evidence of publications in the area of bioanalytical chemistry and/or drug metabolism.
Highly meticulous, attention to details, organized, diligent, highly motivated, and keen to learn
Proficiency in English, with good writing and interpersonal communication skills

description:
This role is responsible for ensuring the base oil procurement strategies as defined by regional base oil managers and global teams are executed in AP region and support of related activities i.e. e-sourcing & optimisation, maintaining PLMS, maintaining & consolidating Salesforce, spend data, supplier rebate, support IMT.Synergises with the regional base oil managers and global teams to manage the global relationships with key global & regional suppliers and their supply performance
Key accountabilities
Operate and remain compliant with Group / Segment / SPU & Procurement controls and standards, with focus on HSSE
Support the delivery of Base Oil Strategy through e-sourcing & optimisation space while working within PSCM Category Management framework & engaging key stakeholders across the regions
Support the Risk Management Register for BO, Quality Roadmap and Contracts Compliance agenda within the global BO teams, coordinate activities and key deliverables while managing stakeholders expectations
Develop with regional Base Oil managers the action plans to implement base oil strategy and coordinate/monitor implementation performance.
Translate strategic targets into business plans and performance contracts ensuring top down and bottom up consistency and transparency. Salesforce reconciliation.
Ensure Global volume plans are collated annually and Supplier contracts tracked vs contractual terms (rebate accruals for key suppliers / volume & CAPS tracking for Base oil Suppliers)
Ensure that Base oil prices in AP are updated and uploaded onto PLM – assist with BSC project to transfer responsibilities.
Monthly rolling forecasts responsibility:- consolidate AP Group III/PAO BO demand and ensure close links to SAP implementation to meet for future forecasting requirements.
Market Information
Build market data on all key refining capacity changes and the impact on supply by category globally using BP and external sources
Acquire information on key market trends in the base oil sector – capacity and supply by region and country for Lubricants key markets globally
Provide data and a risk analysis to the business to show the impact of base oil capacity, market trends and dynamics, potential shortages and risks for the Lubricants businesses globally and by region and Category
Support provision of timely supply market knowledge to the Business, relaying current and future impactful events and their potential consequences
Utilise IST resources and capability to construct modelling of base oil supplier refineries through LP and other appropriate models and techniques
Conduct analysis of BP Lubes competitor actions
Liaise with Marketing and sales on analysis of trends that will impact on future base oil demand in short, medium and long term
Market/Supplier Development
Identify potential additional sources of supply in respect of all high risk, high cost, limited supply categories and obtain information to build a target list of potential suppliers
Engage with potential suppliers to key markets and categories to build information profiles concerning their supply capabilities and risks, liaising with Finance as necessary, to carry out any due diligence required
Building relationships with potential suppliers through conferences, meetings, visits etc.
Generate the supplier portfolio by reviewing the potential supply base and establishing a consistent supplier selection process acceptable to all stakeholders, select and lead supplier negotiation
Identify and evaluate potential sourcing strategies; run risk analysis; document sourcing strategies
Work with supply chain and technology to undertake any supply trials or product tests necessary to confirm suitability of suppliers
Ensure all category sourcing arrangements are fully compliant to all corporate social, environmental and financial risk and HSE , and that requirements such as authority to commit and FSA regulations are fully implemented
Assist in developing and promoting standard procurement processes (in collaboration with the Procurement Transformation Manager)

Supply Negotiations
Negotiate supply arrangements with new suppliers and to lead/ participate those negotiations
Manage new supply relationships in conjunction with the appropriate Supply Chain and Procurement Specialists to ensure that the maximum joint benefits are obtained from the supply relationship.
Essential Education
University degree or equivalent
Essential experience and job requirements
8-10 years of relevant experience
Excellent networking skills, an open style, sound commercial judgment and be able to work well under pressure with competing priorities.
A sound understanding of strategic and business fundamentals and drivers.
Ability to communicate key messages in a clear and concise manner both verbally and in writing.
The Lubes SPU is in a people based business. The ability to form good relationships with people at all levels and from a variety of backgrounds is essential for this role.
Strong analytical and computer (Excel, Powerpoint etc) skills
A sound understanding of and experience in using financial concepts
Other Requirements (e.g. Travel, Location)
This role is based in Singapore
Desirable criteria & qualifications
Understanding and preferably experience of base oil refining and an understanding of base oil market & technology.
Relocation available
No
Travel required
Yes - up to 10%
Is this a part time position?
No
About BP
Our business is the exploration, production, refining, trading and distribution of energy. This is what we do, and we do it on a truly global scale. BP operates with business activities and customers in more than 80 countries across six continents. Every day, we serve millions of customers around the world. We are continually looking for talented, committed and ambitious people to help us shape the face of energy for the future.

The Asia & Pacific Automotive Lubricants Region of the Lubricants SPU was formed on April 1, 2009 by the coming together of three erstwhile regions - Transcon (India, South & Middle East), ASPAC Growth and SEA-Pac to form one of the most exciting long term growth opportunities for the Lubricants SPU. The Region has a footprint in over 30 countries in the Asia and Pacific region.

The markets in the Region are complex with a mix of material market spaces, mature/developed countries as well as emerging and growing markets with diverse demographic profiles and economic status set in a cross-cultural milieu. In 2010, the A&P Region achieved record breaking results of revenue in excess of US$2 billion and RCOP of approximately US$500 million. A&P is now the largest OU in the Lubricants SPU. India, Vietnam, and Australia are the biggest markets in the A&P Region.

The majority of our products are under the Castrol brand, however the BP brand is very strong in certain markets such as Vietnam and Thailand. Castrol is one of the leading automotive lubricants brands (in consumer awareness and brand health), which holds a strong market share position in most of the countries we operate.

This is an exciting place to build a career - as we are focused on building talent and honing skills to work in a diverse multicultural environment.
Segment
Downstream
Closing Date
06-May-2018
title: Procurement Analyst

description:
About JLL
We’re JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We help organizations around the world achieve their ambitions by owning, occupying and investing in real estate.
We’re a Fortune 500 company. We work across 80 countries, in 280 different offices, with a team of over 77,000 individuals. And we look after a property portfolio of over 4bn square feet, all on behalf of our clients.

If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. At JLL, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections through sharing different perspectives, and you’ll be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours.

Achieve your ambitions – join us at JLL!

We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst APAC.

Business Unit: Project Development Services

Reports to: APAC PDS BI Director

Location: Singapore

The Opportunity:
At JLL it’s our ambition to be the smartest when it comes to technology, data and insights. We want to have the best tools and technology in real estate, enabling our people to do their greatest work and making it easy to harness the power of data to drive sustainable and profitable growth and provide real actionable insights for both our clients and ourselves.

We are looking for someone to join our Project and Development Services (PDS) BI Team to support our business transformation. We want our business leaders to become more data savvy and use data proactively for all aspects of our decision-making. That’s where you come in. This role is not just about SQL, reports and analysis. You will be an integral member of our team, working with our leaders to find new and creative ways to use our data to create value.

What this job involves:

Do you have a talent for telling stories with Data? If so, you are what we’re looking for!

Illicit, understand and document the business need to build BI solutions
Identify and implement data acquisition programs as part of data discovery process
Facilitate the design and development of the most appropriate model to meet and exceed the business requirement
Build visualizations that tell a compelling story and turn data into actionable insights.
Understand the current state BI landscape and help define a future state that brings innovation and fresh thinking while addressing the current and future needs of the business
Create inspiration around the power of data within the PDS business
Be well versed in the latest BI trends to ensure that JLL remains at the forefront of the industry by continuing innovating and improving
Sound like you? To apply you need to be:

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Information Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a quantitative discipline in science, business, or social science. Advanced degree and/or 1-2 years of experience in the fields of information science, computer science or analytics preferred.

Experience:

5+ Years knowledge of standard analytical, reporting and programming languages and their applications (such as SQL, R, SSRS, DAX, M-Query Language)
5+ year experience in Data Wrangling: knowable in Data Discovery, Acquisition & and Transformation process and the specific use of tools to support Self Service data preparation and data governance (such as Altryx, Trifacta, Paxta & Collibra)
Experience developing and deploying machine Learning or statistical models
Previous experience working within Big Data Platforms beneficial
Understanding of data and systems engineering concepts to effectively integrate and analyze data to develop actionable business information deliverables.
Solid understanding of database design and modelling to facilitate the development of optimized BI models is a must.
Capability to self-learn new software applications and programming languages
Effective written and verbal communication skills, including technical writing
Experience of agile project management or lean six sigma with related certifications
Experience working in large global organizations with geographically dispersed teams and complex technical environments
Strong customer focus with a demonstrated ability to work seamlessly with business and technical teams

Skills:

Personal values that align with JLL’s values of teamwork, ethics, excellence
High energy and passionate about delivering real, sustainable change within the construction and real estate industry
Somebody who is known for getting things done
Excellent listening and analytical skills. Can understand the needs of stakeholders and then deliver solutions that users describe as “making their job easier”.
A problem solver by nature who thinks creatively and sticks with it until resolved
Early adopter of BI Technology, reads incessantly, is curious and continuously learning
Speaks the language of data and BI and can tell a compelling story with data

What you can expect from us

You will be given a remarkable opportunity to be part of a truly inspiring team that is focused on using data to bring about the best improvements in our business.

You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things.

Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition, wellbeing, benefits and pay. We’ll offer you a competitive salary and benefits package.
Join us to develop your strengths and enjoy a fulfilling career full of varied experiences. Keep those ambitions in sights and imagine where JLL can take you...

Apply today!

description:
Functional area: Personal Financial Services (PFS)

Employment type: Full-time

Job Type: Permanent


Overview

You will be part of a very vibrant and dynamic team at the heart of the new UOB Digital Bank that is innovating the way the customers engage with bank through the most customized experiences possible. In joining the Engagement Lab as a Data Analyst/Scientist, you’ll be in a key role that helps deepen the customer interactions by applying advanced data analytics.

We will be expecting you to have extensive experiences in data science and analytics field – developing models, rules and algorithms from structured and unstructured sources and performing deep-dive analysis to derive data-driven decisions.


Responsibilities
Apply statistical tools/models to perform advanced data analytics, identify key underlying drivers for growing customer engagement and business opportunities, and recommend a clear action plan going forward.
Develop and implement artificial intelligence algorithms, rules and rapid prototypes from big data sets that will be fed into various business programs.
Behavioral segmentation based on customer journey, profiles, transaction patterns, and app activities that will lead to highly personalized customer insights.
Design and monitor A/B testing and various engagement activities.
Perform deep-dive analysis to solve various business problems arising from marketing, dynamic incentive programs, and campaign management.
Build and automate intuitive dashboards that help visualize and answer complex business problems.

Job requirements ;
Analytical mind with sound business insights. Ability to translate the business problems and requirements into analytics solutions.
Knowledge of a variety of predictive models, machine learning algorithms and statistical techniques, e.g. logistic regression, decision tree, clustering, neural networks, support vector machines, principal component analytics, natural language processing.
Knowledge of CRM platforms, campaign management, and A/B testing.
Experience in Adobe Analytics / Adobe Campaign is a plus.
Proficiency across the core statistical toolsets (SQL, SAS, R, Python), data visualization tools (Tableau, Qlik) and Hadoop ecosystem.
In-depth knowledge of digital banking, banking products and the overall industry a strong plus
Good verbal and written communication skills.
University degree, preferably in computer science, engineering or analytical discipline, e.g. mathematics, statistics, IT, economics, finance, accounting.
Minimum 3 years working experience in data analytics or business intelligence units, preferably in financial industry.
Self-motivated. Can-do spirit.
