title: Supply Chain Analyst

description:
Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. As a Financial Analyst, your work, whether it's modeling business scenarios or tracking performance metrics, is used by our leaders to make strategic company decisions. A master juggler working of multiple projects at a time, you are focused on the details while finding creative ways to tackle big picture challenges.


As someone who knows the workings of the core Finance team inside and out, you'll lead individual projects to transform planning, tracking and control processes. You'll provide senior level management with insightful recommendations, planning and reporting support.


The APAC Marketing Finance team creates financial insights to help senior management make informed strategic marketing investments across the company. We solve complex business problems to reveal opportunity, manage risk, and steward scarce resources. Our impact is fueled by a bias to action, a grounding in hard data, and a willingness to put the team before the individual.


In this role, you will use your business acumen and deep financial knowledge to inform all of Google’s marketing investments across products and markets in APAC. You'll provide senior level management with actionable, data-driven insights to inform strategic planning and scenario modeling. As someone who knows the workings of the core Finance team inside and out, you'll lead projects to transform planning, reporting, and control processes. Our business partners are leaders across Marketing, Finance, Sales, and Product. As such, you will be an adept communicator with the ability to influence across these functions.


This role reports into the Finance function and combines both strategic and operational projects. Additionally, you'll be focused on the details while also finding creative ways to tackle big picture challenges and working effectively on multiple projects at a time.


The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.


Responsibilities
Partner with Marketing and Finance Management to develop and drive the APAC marketing growth strategy. Set strategic priorities for advertising and promotional budgets, as well as headcount-related investments, across APAC Marketing.
Support marketing strategies by synthesizing drivers of user and market trends, opportunities and risks for Google’s products, and conduct competitive analyses. Monitor key business metrics such as acquisition and retention, surface trend drivers, and provide actionable recommendations.
Manage and drive efficiency in core Finance processes, including financial planning, expense management and reporting. Monitor key business metrics such as acquisition and retention, and surface trend drivers. Provide actionable recommendations.
Develop reporting tools and data infrastructure to explain spending activity and effectiveness across different initiatives to a range of audiences.
Design, implement, and maintain good governance processes for managing expenditures and risk.

Qualifications
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in an analytical environment, working with business analytics, quantitative marketing, financial planning and analysis, management consulting, banking or a related field.
Experience working with SQL.

Preferred qualifications:
Understanding of fundamental corporate finance principles and accounting concepts.
Proven success in planning and managing at both the strategic and operational level - organized, detail-oriented, strategically-focused and ability to multitask in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment.
Track record of increasing levels of responsibility and independence.
Distinctive problem-solving and project management skills. Excellent communication and facilitation capabilities, proven track record of building relationships with stakeholders.
Business-level proficiency in Japanese.
title: Financial Planning Analyst, Marketing

description:
About Morgan Stanley Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the Firm’s employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments, institutions and individuals. Research at Morgan Stanley (http://www.morganstanley.com/what-we-do/research)Morgan Stanley has earned an enviable reputation for the originality of its research and the value it creates among investors and decision makers. Consistently ranked among the top in its field, our Equity Research team looks at economic, market, industry and company data to enhance the performance of clients' global portfolios and to help companies set their strategic direction. An opportunity exists for a Research Associate to join the ASEAN Oil & Utilities team based in Singapore. The role will entail an understanding of companies in oil & gas, refining, chemicals and utilities space in ASEAN countries and putting them in perspective from a global context. The role will require the candidate to support the Analyst in database management, financial modeling & analysis, client presentations and research report writing. Key Responsibilities: - Creating and maintaining earnings models leveraging skills in accounting, finance and economics - Keeping abreast of ASEAN oil & gas industry-related news flow - Researching and writing reports with a company or sector specific focus - Responding to requests for data and information from internal and external clients - Assisting in the design and preparation of analyst marketing strategy and materials
Qualifications and Skillset: Bachelor's degree or aboveHave at least 2 years of relevant equity research experience preferredExcellent and well-structured written & verbal communication skills requiredPassion for the Oil, Energy and Utilities sectorsStrong interpersonal skills necessaryAbility to effectively work with diverse cultures in a global team with sensitivity and appreciation for diverse culturesQuick learner with an ability to work well under pressureProactive & hard working with strong professional accountabilityShortlisted candidates will be invited to attend a written test and modeling assessment
title: Equity Research, Oil & Utilities ASEAN, Research Associate - Singapore

description:
Company Overview
Style Theory is a Fashion-Technology company that is redefining Fashion Consumption. We believe that there is an inefficiency in the way we consume fashion in today's world, and are on a mission to provide a smarter solution.


We are currently Southeast Asia's largest and fastest growing Fashion Rental startup. Our core product is Fashion Rental Subscription using a “Netflix-for-Fashion” model, the first and only of its kind in the region. Today, we are focused on building more products to improve Fashion Consumption and driving these solutions across the region.
Job Summary
As the Marketing/CRO Analyst, you will be responsible for optimising the marketing/customer funnel, ensuring that our efforts track the business' needs and planned growth trajectory.


This is achieved by providing clarity on the overall department objectives and drivers, identification of gaps and opportunities, tracking progress on our initiatives, and ensuring we operate on top of a accurate and stable data and technical infrastructure.


You will manage Conversion Rate Optimisation (CRO) across all devices and platforms (Site/App), plan and design tests to increase efficiency of the funnel, and drive product and technical improvements to build up the marketing-technology toolset in according with the scale of our marketing operations.
Responsibilities and Duties
Support the tracking and reporting of overall marketing KPIs, marketing channel effectiveness and campaign performance by building, automating and maintaining a series of dashboards and reports to help identify trends and patterns for problem diagnosis and action steering
Implement tracking structure and CRO toolsets across all Site/App properties, co-own the marketing-technology and systems road-map, coordinate with external vendors and stakeholders to enable up-to-date marketing operations for the business
Collaborate closely with the Head of Marketing to hypothesise and understand customer/marketing funnel development, and provide actionable insights through data/statistical analysis and data research
Collaborate closely with marketing channel stakeholders to improve the way data in prepared, consumed, and used daily, coming up with meaningful customer targeting strategies to drive impact for the business
Collaborate closely with data and product teams to develop improvements to internal data structure and marketing platforms/toolsets
Qualifications and Skills
Passionate about the Fashion and Sharing Economy space
Strong analytical skills, must love working with data and technical setups, able to relate to qualitative aspects of work
Strong communication skills, works well in a team setting
Strong and critical thinker, problem solver
Strong willingness to learn and grow independently, has an owner/builder mentality
Enjoys the challenges of a fast-paced, high-stakes environment
Adept in data visualisation using charts, graphs, and pivots
Prior experience in Excel, Python, PostgresSQL, MySQL, R or other programming/database languages
Working knowledge on technical/analytical toolsets such as Microsoft Excel, Google Analytics, Bigquery, Tableau, Amazon Redshift, Google Cloud
Minimum of 1 year experience in a similar field or scope of work
title: Marketing / CRO Analyst

description:
BACKGROUND:

About Dentsu Aegis Network

Dentsu Aegis Network helps clients build consumer relationships by communicating their products and brands effectively. Our distinctive and innovative range of products and services include marketing and communications strategies through digital marketing and creative execution, media planning and buying, creative services, technology applications, SEO, content creation, brand tracking and marketing analytics.

Find out more about us at https://www.dentsuaegisnetwork.com/


About Dentsu Aegis Network’s Global Data Innovation Centre

As the world of data continues to grow exponentially in the advent of connected devices, IoT, industrialised digitization of the economy and the way people move through digitized networks, Dentsu Aegis seeks to harness the power of data and transform this into intelligent applications, products and platforms.


The Dentsu Aegis Network Global Data Innovation Centre, hubbed in Singapore, is a strategic initiative to ensure that the Group stays at the forefront of the digital economy and develops global products which sit at the intersection of deep domain knowledge, consumer psychology, data and technology.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:

As a Data Science Analyst, you will work closely with the Data Scientists and the engineering team to develop leading edge data analytics solutions and capabilities that uncovers insights from vast amounts of structured and unstructured data, through a combination of research and experimentation.


On a day to day basis, your responsibilities can comprise of:
Apply quantitative methods and build statistically valid and scalable algorithms that convey actionable conclusions from very large datasets. You should be able to synthesize scientific publications on statistical applications and then write programs to implement the applications that are most suitable for our data.
Complete tasks effectively and in a timely manner.
We invite people passionate about data and artificial intelligence to join a growing team.

You have to be a self-starter, hands-on builder and collaborative team player . You can think on your feet, connect disparate dots, imagine connections and importantly, craft approaches to turn ideas and imagination into real capabilities, inspired by data. You are excited by your work going live in the market with clients and teams around the world.
Desired Skills and Experience
1+ years of experience in applied data science.
At least a Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or Information Systems.
Familiar with Python programming, including pandas and NumPy libraries.
Working knowledge in machine learning / data mining.
Highly logical, systematic, independent and fast learner.
Self-starter and motivated.
Confident, responsible and can proactively think of and implement solutions to tricky problems.
title: Data Science Analyst

description:
About JLL
We’re JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We help organizations around the world achieve their ambitions by owning, occupying and investing in real estate.
We’re a Fortune 500 company. We work across 80 countries, in 280 different offices, with a team of over 77,000 individuals. And we look after a property portfolio of over 4bn square feet, all on behalf of our clients.

If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. At JLL, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections through sharing different perspectives, and you’ll be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours. Achieve your ambitions – join us at JLL!

We are looking for a Business Analyst APAC.

Business Unit: Project Development Services
Reports to: COO PDS, APAC
Location: Singapore

What this job involves:
You’ll join our Project and Development Services (PDS) business which is on a digital transformation journey. We’re implementing new systems and processes to make things easier, better and faster for our people and our clients. We’re looking for someone to join our team who is passionate about simplifying business processes so that we can harness the full benefit of digitization.

As we implement new technology, we are taking the opportunity to review and optimize our business processes across sales, procurement, finance and project delivery. Workflows, processes, data definitions and business rules will need to be rigorously mapped, documented and shared in a way that is simple to understand, easy to adopt and accessible. That’s where you come in.

Sound like you? This is what we're looking for:

Responsibilities:

Document, optimize and continuously improve workflows for end to end business processes relating to sales, finance, procurement and project delivery
Work closely with our users, product owners, business owners and SME’s to gather and document user stories and requirements for new and existing systems ensuring full traceability through to implementation and UAT
Work closely with IT and Operations, develop test cases and support testing to ensure businesses processes are correctly configured and implemented to specification
Build and maintain the critical business data reference for the PDS business. Ensure that the documentation of the critical business data, metrics and supporting business rules is comprehensive, appropriately detailed, and promulgated across the PDS system landscape

Experience:

5+ years’ experience in Construction project management and PMO
3+ years proven experience in business analysis, requirements gathering, process documentation and data governance
Proven experience in transforming traditional processes into digitized environments
Bachelor’s degree required
Experience working across the APAC region preferred

Skills / Competencies:

Personal values that align with JLL’s values of teamwork, ethics, excellence
Passionate about business process optimization and continuous improvement using Lean techniques
A knack for taking complexity and converting it into simplicity
Outstanding English writing and process mapping skills
Attention to detail and a healthy obsession for delivering accurate, high quality output
Excellent listening and analytical skills. Can understand the needs of stakeholders and work with a team to deliver solutions that users describe as “making their job easier”.

What you can expect from us
You will be given a remarkable opportunity to be part of a truly inspiring team that is focused on using data to bring about the best improvements in our business.

You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things.

Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition, wellbeing, benefits and pay. We’ll offer you a competitive salary and benefits package.
Join us to develop your strengths and enjoy a fulfilling career full of varied experiences. Keep those ambitions in sights and imagine where JLL can take you...

Apply today!
title: Business Analyst APAC

description:
United Company RUSAL is the world’s largest aluminium producer and one of the major producers of alumina. The company took its current form through the merger of RUSAL, SUAL, and the alumina assets of Glencore in 2007. It now operates in 13 countries employing over 61,000 people.

RUSAL’s key sales markets are Europe, Russia and the CIS countries, North America, South-East Asia, Japan and Korea.

Rusal Marketing GmbH is the sales and marketing company of UC Rusal, based in Zug, Switzerland. We are looking for a Market Analyst for Singapore Branch to maintain and develop deep analysis of aluminium demand by end-use segments and products, collect and regular monitor “field” market information from producers, suppliers and customers and provide informational and analytical market support for Asian sales team. An ideal candidate shall have solid experience in metals market (aluminium is preferred), nevertheless candidates with right skills from others B2B or B2C markets will be considered.

WORKING AT UC RUSAL

Working in the Company is both challenging and exciting. No day here is the same – every moment we are pushing the barriers a little further. We are an enthusiastic and encouraging community: not a single one of your valuable ideas will get overlooked or lost in bureaucracy.

THE PURPOSE OF THE ROLE

Through excellent knowledge of Asian aluminium products market to maintain deep analysis of demand by end-use segments and products.

In this role you will collect and regular monitor “field” market information from producers, suppliers and customers, and provide analytical market support for traders.

ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES

1. Industry aluminium supply analysis (smelters production by cast-house products, import/export analysis, secondary production and consumption, scrap availability)

2. Industry aluminium demand analysis by producers (rolling mills, extruders, cable plants, castings).

3. Monitor customer’s “supplier’s portfolio” and its changes.

4. Identify RUSAL’s market position in the region by products and segments

5. Build demand analysis and forecast by final end-use sectors based on economic models (“Top-down” model)

6. Define customer’s growth plans linked to market sector growth. Build 5 years demand forecast by cast-house products (“Bottom-up” model).

7. Analyze activities of competitors, identify market risks and market opportunities for RUSAL to grow sales

8. Prepare reports and presentations in respect of market development and investment projects

9. Build market research upon to request

SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE SHALL BRING FOLLOWING SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

1. Bachelor or Master Degree in Marketing, Finance or Commerce. Engineering is an advantage.

2. Languages: English - fluent. Russian is highly appreciated. Chinese and other languages are an advantage.

3. Qualities: excellent interpersonal skills, extrovert character, dedicated and taking initiative, strong analytical, organization and planning skills, problem analysis and problem-solving, corporate spirit. Dynamic, independent and creative thinker, effective communicator

4. Experience in all aspects of developing and maintaining marketing strategies, technical marketing skills, proven experience in customer and market research, relevant product and industry knowledge. Knowledgeable in strategic market analysis. Translate market insights into actions to support company initiatives.

5. Significant working experience in sales and marketing functions and in-depth knowledge of the commodity markets. Non-ferrous metals markets are preferable.

6. Depth understanding of the link between market fundamentals and product’s demand dynamics in B2B markets. Ability to build and maintain Analytical models based on fragmented market data.

7. Ability to treat and analyze big massive of data and to draw both qualitative and quantitative conclusions.
8. Proficient with Microsoft Office. Excellent Excel knowledge, including statistical and analytical tools. Advanced Power Point skills. MS Access is a big advantage (SQL, queries). Extraordinary skills of data visualization and report writing (PowerPoint, Word).

If you are passionate about this opportunity please send us your application.
title: MARKET ANALYST ASIA, RUSAL MARKETING GMBH Singapore Branch
APAC Actuarial Analyst

description:
PropertyGuru Group is seeking an innovative, results-oriented, team player to help build our agent & developer listing business. This Pricing Analyst will report to the Head of Pricing & Yield and work closely with key stakeholders to drive the pricing strategy for PropertyGuru across SEA.

Some of the key job functions of the Pricing Analyst are:

Maintain rate cards update on a quarterly basis by analyzing existing pricing rules for opportunities to improve revenue and ensuring rates are updated into the system
Perform post mortem analysis on pricing initiatives, make recommendations for improvement
Building and developing new process / reports / systems
Support KPI growth by data analysis, finding gaps and working with country managers
Creating standard or ad hoc business reports and ensure delivery per SLA to achieve high efficiency Create and maintain competitor landscape analysis
3+ years in Pricing, Financial or analytics background
Bachelor degree in related field
Demonstrated success in data intensive quantitative analysis and recommendations
Ability to juggle multiple priorities and make things happen in a fast-paced, dynamic environment; strong bias for action
Strong in Excel & Modeling
Strong analytical and quantitative skills; ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and feature concepts.
Willingness to roll up your sleeves and do what's necessary
Strong verbal and written communication skills across all levels of the organization and ability to influence others internally and externally

title: Pricing Analyst

description:
Help Us to Shape the Banking of Tomorrow.

The Avaloq group is an internationally leading fintech company. With its core and digital banking software and its international network of Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) centres, Avaloq brings trustworthy and efficient banking to the world, delivered through great user experience. Headquartered in Switzerland, Avaloq has branches in the most demanding financial centres worldwide and serves around 155 banks and wealth managers and the 270 Swiss cooperative banks. Avaloq’s growing ecosystem comprises among others over 2’000 employees from 66 nationalities and more than 500 third-party developers that co-innovate with Avaloq.


More information on www.avaloq.com


The responsibilities

Be a member of a team which performs static data maintenance and fees processing
Responsible for ensuring timely and accurate processing, setting up and maintenance of static data tables in systems
Responsible for timely and accurate completion of custody fees, trailer fees processing and periodic reporting
Periodic review and update of process manual and key operating documents
Builds cohesive working relationships within the team and across different functional teams within WM Operations

Your profile

Tertiary education (Diploma / Degree in Banking and Finance / Accountancy preferred but not necessary).
At least 2 - 4 years of operations experience within Private Banking / Private Wealth Management.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Excel would be advantageous.
Preferably with knowledge of Avaloq system.

Main place of work

Singapore
title: Fees Analyst

description:
About JLL

We’re JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We help organizations around the world achieve their ambitions by owning, occupying and investing in real estate.

We’re a Fortune 500 company. We work across 80 countries, in 280 different offices, with a team of over 77,000 individuals. And we look after a property portfolio of over 4bn square feet, all on behalf of our clients.

If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. At JLL, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections through sharing different perspectives, and you’ll be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours.

Achieve your ambitions – join us at JLL!

We are looking for Transaction Management Data Analyst

What this job involves:

Working with people
You will be supporting the hiring leader to drive pre sales qualification and develop sales enablement process and tools. You will also be working closely with internal research teams to leverage existing industry research, and pair with external data sources to identify prospects and drive pipelines effectiveness. On top of that, you will also be working with management to prioritise business and information needs, and define new process improvement opportunities. You will also have an opportunity to work closely with transaction managers, learn and participate in numerous Asian markets, help to manage a broad range real estate transactions across the entire APAC region and achieve the best value for the client.

Being analytical
You will be building, maintaining, supporting and validating primary and secondary databases to be used to support sales efforts and pipeline management for the region. You will also be extracting valuable information from public data sources ranging from macroeconomic trends, industry developments, company financial information and competitor landscape. You will also be involved in data cleaning, preparation, interpretation and analysis using statistical technique and tools in Excel, Internal CRM database and other data management systems. Additionally, you will be developing insights dashboards and providing ongoing periodic reporting. You should possess a good understanding of financial knowledge; be able to run scenario analysis of various real estate options during each transaction management project and support in the preparation of business cases

A good communicator
You are proficient in English and are able to communicate effectively. You appreciate culture diversity within the region and can adapt easily to collaborate with colleagues / clients from different countries.

Sound like you? To apply you need to be:

Experienced
You have 1 to 2 years of working experience in a data analyst role. You possess advanced skills in Excel and is able to use functions such as Vlookup, Pivot Tables and Macros. It would be great if you have experience with CRM and dash boarding tools.

Capable
You pay strong attention to detail and possess excellent problem solving skills. Under limited supervision, you are able to deliver results when working on autonomous projects. You are also able to source, work with and combine multiple disparate data sets to answer business questions or perform analysis to isolate anomalies. You are also able to work with internal stakeholders to obtain and investigate data points and information to support sales effort.

What you can expect from us

You will be given a remarkable opportunity to contribute and hone your technical competencies at one of our most prestigious projects.

You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things.

Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition, wellbeing, benefits and pay. We’ll offer you a competitive salary and benefits package.
Join us to develop your strengths and enjoy a fulfilling career full of varied experiences. Keep those ambitions in sights and imagine where JLL can take you...

Apply today!
title: Analyst, Transaction Management

description:
Google's brand is only as strong as our users' trust--and their steadfast belief that our guiding principles are what's best for them. Our Trust and Safety team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users by ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products like Search, Maps, AdWords and AdSense. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic leader. You understand the user's point of view and are passionate about using your combined technical, sales and customer service acumen to protect our users. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google developers and Product Managers to navigate challenging online safety situations and handle abuse and fraud cases at Google speed (read: fast!). Help us prove that quality on the Internet trumps all.


At Google Safe Browsing, we help people every week protect themselves from harm by showing warnings to users when they attempt to navigate to websites that would steal their personal information or install software designed to take over their computers. On the Safe Browsing Operations team, you will become an expert in the workings of malware, phishing and unwanted software campaigns, and you will help us detect and prevent these abuse types at scale.


At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Gaining and retaining this trust is critically important to Google’s success. We defend Google's integrity by fighting spam, fraud and abuse, and develop and communicate state-of-the-art product policies. The Trust and Safety team reduces risk and protects the experience of our users and business partners in more than 40 languages and across Google's expanding base of products. We work with a variety of teams from Engineering to Legal, Public Policy and Sales Engineering to set policies and combat fraud and abuse in a scalable way, often with an eye to finding industry-wide solutions. Trust and Safety team members are motivated to find innovative solutions, and use technical know-how, user insights and proactive communication to pursue the highest possible quality and safety standards for users across Google products.


Responsibilities
Conduct investigations to identify harmful content, enforce product policies, examine distribution trends and identify vulnerabilities.
Grow and influence tools or automation systems by influencing key stakeholders with data and analyses.
Enhance operational workflows via process improvements and automation.
Communicate effectively with English, Indonesian, Thai, Vietnamese and Chinese speaking clients.

Qualifications
Minimum qualifications:
BA/BS degree in Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics or Accounting or equivalent practical experience.
Experience querying medium sized data sets.
Ability to speak in English, and either Indonesian, Thai, Vietnamese or Chinese fluently and idiomatically.

Preferred qualifications:
Experience with web security research; in mobile ecosystem, fraud investigation, fraud risk management, internet advertising or e-commerce.
Familiarity in one or more of the following areas: Coding (e.g., C/C++, Python, Java), Databases and querying (e.g., SQL, MySQL, MapReduce, Hadoop), Front end development (e.g., HTML, JavaScript, CSS), Statistical analysis (e.g., R, Stata, SPSS, SAS).
Demonstrated understanding of how the internet works economically, socially and technically.
Demonstrated ability to identify workflow issues and optimize or scale processes.
title: Safe Browsing Analyst (Multiple languages)

description:
Dimensional is a leading global investment manager with over USD $577 billion under management globally as of December 31, 2017. We are looking to grow the Global Portfolio Management team with the addition of an Analyst in the Singapore office. Since 1981, our entrepreneurial, collaborative culture has attracted and drawn on exceptionally talented people from both inside and outside of the financial industry—including the academic community.
Academic research forms the foundation of all Dimensional investment strategies, and guides the design, management, and implementation of client portfolios. This approach has helped lead to enduring client relationships, many of which date back decades. Over the years, the firm has translated financial research into real world investment solutions, developing innovative approaches to trading and portfolio design. With 13 offices around the world, Dimensional fosters a culture of learning, teamwork, and dedication to our clients.
About the Role
T he Portfolio Management group manages global funds across multiple asset classes for clients ranging from large institutions (such as sovereign wealth funds and central banks) to financial advisors and individuals.
The Portfolio Management team is responsible for translating Dimensional’s investment philosophy into practice and providing portfolio oversight. Portfolio managers ensure client portfolios continually pursue the targeted premiums, generate buy and sell candidate order lists, outline trading parameters, and assist clients to understand Dimensional’s investment practices. Analysts are responsible for performing a series of daily tasks to ensure that our portfolio management and trading processes run smoothly, which include portfolio reconciliation, reviewing and responding to corporate action events.
Additionally, Analysts execute ad hoc requests from Portfolio Managers such as portfolio characteristics analysis, data requests, and research into relevant market and company-specific developments. Depending upon skill development and business need, an Analyst may also complete long-term projects that involve identifying possibilities for improvement in Dimensional’s portfolio implementation processes and executing those improvements to improve efficiency. An Analyst will regularly coordinate with portfolio managers, traders, custodian banks, and Dimensional offices across the globe.
Qualifications
A Bachelor’s degree with demonstrated academic achievement
Strong philosophical alignment with Dimensional’s investment strategy
Fluent Korean language skills
Background or strong interest in finance and financial theory
Excellent quantitative problem-solving and analytic skills
Intellectual curiosity
Solid communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal
Comfort with large data sets
High attention to detail
Strong time-management skills
Aptitude for learning basic computer programming languages and software is helpful
Knowledge of SQL, Access, and Excel is helpful
It is the policy of the Company to provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. The Company does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, ancestry, medical condition, marital status, covered veteran status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, or any other protected status. This policy applies to all areas of employment including recruitment, hiring, training, job assignment, promotion, compensation, benefits, transfer, discipline, termination, and social and recreational programs.
title: Analyst, Portfolio Management

description:
The Talent COE (Centre of Expertise) is made up of 3 pillars – acquisition, management, and development. This role focuses on the management and development pillars. We are looking for a high-energy individual to coordinate talent programmes and initiatives across Mastercard to deliver impactful learning & development solutions. These include: learning initiatives, strategic and functional capability building, executive development, performance management, succession planning, career development, employee engagement surveys and talent assessment programmes.

As an individual contributor to the Talent COE you will be accountable for the development and initial implementation for all talent programmes/solutions in the Asia Pacific region.

Do you want to work for a technology leader in payments?

Do you enjoy creating tangible solutions?

Are you collaborative?


Role

• Creates campaigns to communicate learning and development programs, in partnership with cross-functional HR teams

• Gathers content and data for communication materials and reports; drafts designated deliverables for review

• Develops project decks and reports to be reviewed by senior team members

• Serves as a point of contact for dashboard updates on key people metrics, analysing progress and reviewing data for quality control

• Supports roll-out of engagement surveys and oversees user experience feedback collection and documentation to assist with various solutions

• Coordinates with vendors, HR teams, and the business to ensure program delivery meets budget and timelines set

• Provide support on the delivery & implementation of talent development programmes


All About You

• Strong project management and data analysis skills

• Demonstrated success in collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams in a matrix organisation

• Experience/Knowledge of implementation of talent management, research methods and learning & development best practices

• Experienced in preparation of analytics dashboard reports and presentation of summaries/highlights to senior team members

• High energy, proactive and able to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment


“Flexible Working Arrangements are possible for this position, in consultation with the Hiring Manager”
Equal Opportunity Employer
title: Analyst, Learning & Development

Team and s olutions-oriented.
Lonza. The place to Go, Stay and Grow.
title: Total Rewards Analyst

description:
About Electric8
Electric8 is a digital consultancy based in Singapore that specialises in Product, UX, Design and Growth. All of our work is informed by data and research, using a test-and-learn methodology.
Clients range from large corporations (Capitaland, Scripps Networks...) to fast growing start-ups (Evie, Mobikon, Helpster and HappyFresh...). We're a profitable company and are looking to keep growing in 2018 (who isn't?).
We're looking for a talented cat (or dawg, we don't discriminate) to join the team as a Growth Data Analyst to work on making data-informed, test-and-learn marketing and product experiments for our clients.
Goals You Will Own
• Increasing the growth rate for our clients via the right channels and data informed decisions

• Driving brilliant growth ideas to creation, whilst supporting, inspiring and instilling confidence with clients

• Using customer insight and analytics to validate customer problems, drop-offs, campaign optimisations and solutions throughout the customer journey

• Working with the clients to define the right growth strategy & KPIs for success, building quantitative growth models and iterating towards them

• Coaching clients into an Agile / Lean approach, driving ideas and innovative solutions across various platforms, devices, applications and technologies
Possible Activities to Achieve Those Goals
• Performing data analyses such as correlation, cohort, regression, Monte Carlo to answer quantitative questions to help unlock growth and product outcomes

• Researching, implementing and testing new acquisition & retention tactics and loops

• Implementing test-and-learn experiments on a lean framework to validate or debunk test assumptions

• Systemising validated tactics to be implemented as part of clients’ ongoing marketing strategy

• Outlining and implementing various growth experiments to improve various funnel metrics

• Analysing data from multiple sources to understand what is/isn't working and why
Experience, Skills & Attitude Desired


• Understanding of A/B Testing, Cohort Analysis, Funnel Analysis, Segmentation Analysis

• Intermediate to Advanced Excel Skills

• Intermediate to SQL Skills

• Familiarity or experience with either of those channels is desirable: SEO, Paid Search, Display Advertising, Mobile Advertising, Social Media Advertising

• Experience using Facebook and Google’s Advertising platforms

• Ability to design or even hack at HTML/CSS code comes in handy

• A quantitative educational background preferred

description:
Are you top notch at portfolio management and you know how to make investment decisions that benefit our clients? Do you have a knack for analyzing IT business processes and are able to manage projects efficiently? We’re looking for someone like that who can help us:
– manage clients' portfolios within the given investment and regulatory guidelines
– implement valuation methodologies and financial models to monitor performance and risk
– provide your subject-matter expertise to FI team and management
– manage trading flow into relative systems, support pricing with brokers and CFMP and investigate any trade breaks and irregularities
– understand the business processes / requirements and determine required IT business solutions and assist in implementing them
– optimization and streamlining of FI / MM PM tools

You’ll be working in the CPM Mandate Management team in Singapore. We manage UBS WM discretionary portfolios in APAC, where the CIO view and the client's investment preferences are reflected in the mandates

You have:
– a university degree, CFA/CIIA a plus
– solid skills and education in financial markets or economics
– experience in Fixed Income portfolio management
– strong analytical, problem-solving and synthesizing skills
– the ability to interpret a set of technical requirements and develop robust data solutions for the business
Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world.

We are about 60,000 employees in all major financial centers, in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?
Together. That’s how we do things. We offer people around the world a supportive, challenging and diverse working environment. We value your passion and commitment, and reward your performance.

Keen to achieve the work-life agility that you desire? We're open to discussing how this could work for you (and us).

Why UBS? Video
Are you truly collaborative? Succeeding at UBS means respecting, understanding and trusting colleagues and clients. Challenging others and being challenged in return. Being passionate about what you do. Driving yourself forward, always wanting to do things the right way. Does that sound like you? Then you have the right stuff to join us. Apply now.
UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.
title: Fixed Income Business Systems Analyst

description:
About the Company
Circles.Life is World’s first and most successful digital telco. We have a mission: to re-imagine the mobile experience for the digital consumer through our customer centric mobile platform and disrupt the multi-trillion dollar global telco industry.
We launched our services in Singapore in 2016 and have since gained market share quickly while delivering best-in-class customer experience. Currently Circles beats all other telcos on metrics like NPS, subscriber growth, average data used per subscriber and overall customer satisfaction.
We have an opening for a Billing Operations Analyst who wants to gain valuable experience and exposure at a rapidly scaling telco startup in Singapore.
Do you want to get first hand insights on how a rapidly scaling tech startup operate?
Do you enjoy working within an entrepreneurial environment, having personal freedom to act, and be part of a fun, energetic team who are running at full speed to ignite a digital disruption in telecommunications?
If the answer is YES, read on to find out more about the role at Circles.Life!
Responsibilities
Circles.Life is looking for a Billing Operations Analyst to hone and grow his/her skills in a rapidly expanding organisation. Being a part of the telco revolution, the ideal individual should possess strong analytical background, an ability and confidence to take a challenge and bring it on.
As a fast growing company, Circles.Life is looking for a Billing Operations Analyst to:
Assist with distribution, accuracy management and issue resolution on bill sending
Investigate and resolve billing issues. If needed, escalate them to our billing system provider and follow up until they are resolved.
Work with Customer Service team to address and resolve payment issues of customers
Provide help with internal and external reporting for billing and invoicing
Lead regular improvements in bill processing
What’s on offer
Circles.Life provides a great environment and platform for employees to build their career. In this role, you can expect:
Unique opportunity to be a part of the digital disruption in telecommunication (Circles.Life is the only company of its kind in all of Asia!)
Autonomy in the role and in managing your own portfolio
Exposure to the fast-paced world of high-tech start-ups
Attractive benefits and compensation
Working with passionate, smart and driven colleagues in a vibrant environment
Requirements
Proven experience as a Telecom Billing Analyst or similar role
Proficient in MS Office (especially Excel); familiarity with databases and SQL is an asset
Understanding of billing operations and / or Oracle telco billing systems a plus
Excellent communication ability and being able to work in teams and with other departments
Organizational and time-management skills along with an eye for detail
A strong focus on delivering value to customers
Hands on operational knowledge will be highly preferred over technical experience
title: Billing Operations Analyst

description:
Cyber Defence Analyst (Cyber Threat Intelligence) - (180000GS)
Description

Cyber Defence Analyst (Cyber Threat Intelligence) identifies, collects, analyses and disseminates cyber threat information for OCBC Group. With the information, they are to recommend preventive measures or raise an incident to stakeholders for their preventive actions.
Perform cyber threat analysis, alerting, and reporting based on intelligence and information gathered from both internal and external sources
Conduct research using multiple data sources, performs analysis and disseminates findings of key cyber threats to develop a comprehensive picture of the cyber threat landscape.
Provide understanding of Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) actors, their motivations, skillsets, toolsets and intent
Be part of a team that can perform deep inspection of both current and previous environmental indicators for indications of persistent attacker presence
Hunt down and respond to targeted threats and intrusions
Leverage Security Analytics to conduct research and analysis
Find/develop new threat intelligence, detection, and suggest hardening strategies. Drive changes needed to respond to emerging threats
Collaborate with leadership to improve investigation capabilities for responding to security events through tool building and training
Identify incidents of significance through fusion of current and historic threat data; determine impact, urgency and audience to whom prevention, detection, mitigation and remediation guidance
Prepare written reports and give presentations to internal and external stakeholders.
Apply expertise to ascertain the impact of an intrusion and develop threat trends to develop mitigation techniques and countermeasures that can prevent future attacks

Qualifications

3-5 years of related experience in the following areas:
Maintaining knowledge of threat landscape by monitoring OSINT and related sources.
Providing updates on the cyber threat landscape, including cyber espionage, ecrime and hacktivism.
Collecting, assessing, and cataloging threat indicators and responsibility for adding context to threat indicators to convey urgency, severity, and credibility
Tracking cyber threat actors and their infrastructure, targeted attack techniques, tactics, and procedures.
Cultivating and assessing new sources of threat information and intelligence.
Dynamic analysis of malicious code, either manually or through a malware sandbox. Experience or knowledge of hunting and detecting malware through YARA and OpenIOC signatures.
Analyze and triage malware use static/dynamic techniques, including investigations of botnet and rootkit behaviour.
Analyze DNS, network, honeypot, IDS/IPS, logs and other common industry hunting tools and feeds
Scripting (Python, Perl, Powershell, Bash, SQL etc...)
Preferred:

Knowledge in network protocols and operating system structures and hierarchy. Performs network traffic analysis and event log correlation to identify malicious activity.
Windows, Linux Operating System Knowledge
Exposure to Security Analytics, Network and End-Point Threat Detection Products.
Network-based and system-level attacks and mitigation methods
Disk/network/memory investigation tools, log analysis, and developing custom scripts/functionality
IT and InfoSec background including cryptography and network/systems security
2+ years performing information security incident responses are preferable.

description:
About Amobee:
Amobee is a technology company that transforms the way brands and agencies make marketing decisions. The Amobee Marketing Platform enables marketers to plan and activate cross channel, programmatic media campaigns using real-time market research, proprietary audience data, advanced analytics, and more than 150 integrated partners, including Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, Snapchat and Twitter. Amobee is a wholly owned subsidiary of Singtel, one of the largest communications technology companies in the world which reaches over 640 million mobile subscribers. The company operates across North America, Europe, Middle East, Asia and Australia. For more information, visit amobee.com or follow @amobee

Position Summary:
The Brand Insights Analyst position is part of Asia’s Brand Intelligence Analysts Team that uses the Multiple Award-Winning Brand Intelligence Platform to provide valuable insights used for strategy, senior management advisory, planning and digital activation by many of our most senior executive clients.

In the true realm of cutting-edge Big Data analytics, Amobee’s patented Brand Intelligence technology analyses over 60 Billion content engagements daily across the Web, mobile, social and video providing marketers with the ability to access 360-degree insights around a brand, an icon, a topic or a major event’s entire digital footprint and action in real-time across Amobee’s cross-channel, cross-device platforms.

The Brand Insights Analyst will be responsible for the creation of Brand Intelligence insights packages delivered to Amobee’s clients or internal stakeholders. Such packages include comprehensive actionable recommendations, which are based on the analysis of consumer interest gleaned by Amobee’s Brand Intelligence Technology

And you will do it all in a collaborative environment that values your insight, encourages you to take on new responsibility, promotes continuous learning, and rewards innovation. And in an organisation that has been voted one of the ‘Best Places to Work’ in.

The ideal candidate for this position is analytically superior, highly intellectually curious, familiar or keenly interested with the digital landscape, comfortable working independently, and has very strong oral and verbal communication skills.

Responsibilities:

Create Insight packages for Amobee's Fortune 500 clients based on Amobee Brand Intelligence technology
Support in client meetings, across both pre-sales, business development and post sales activities. Meetings include platform demos, collecting client requirements, and ongoing account management. Ability to portray confidence and gravitas in front of an audience of senior level client executives, encompassing both senior Business and Government leaders.
Actively drive issue-based analyses, deliver proactive insights, and build effective analytical presentations and consultative story-telling to clients through insightful and actionable recommendations
Walk clients (internal and external) through insights and recommendations
Work together with Amobee's sales team to identify the best opportunities to work on
Be part of strategy sessions held as part of the RFP response process
Join agency meetings as a representative of the Brand Intelligence team
Effective personal and team resource management leading to on-time delivery & meeting client quality expectations
Act as a 'Centre-of-Excellence' for Amobee Brand Intelligence across all of Asia

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree
At least 3 years of experience in research, analytics or insights roles in an established multi-national company preferred
Experience in a digital media agency is preferred

You will work amongst a team of passionate, talented and fun analyst and insights professionals, have the opportunity to work directly with multiple award-winning industry-leading technologies, to personally experience one of Singapore’s Best Places to Work and understand just what makes us tick. You will be given amazing opportunities to develop your career and skills within a leading-edge global digital marketing company. There is a host of employee benefits on offer, a great work environment and a number of reward and recognition programs all designed to make #amobeelife an unforgettable experience.

Location: Singapore

In addition to our great environment, we offer a competitive base salary, employee development programs and other comprehensive benefits. Please send a cover letter along with your resume when applying to the position of interest located at Amobee.com. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. No phone calls and no recruiting agencies, please.

Systems Analyst – Hadoop Architect - (18000008)
Description
The responsibilities include, but not limited to the following:
Design, deploy, manage big data platform
Install, maintain & upgrade Hadoop ecosystem components
Monitor Hadoop cluster for job performance and capacity planning
Configuration and management of security for Hadoop clusters.
Manage and monitor Hadoop cluster and platform infrastructure.
Automate cluster node provisioning and repetitive operational tasks.
Develop detailed design documentation of the Hadoop platform and integration with data ingestion and visualization tools
Work closely with the Infrastructure Management teams (Storage, Network, Unix, Backup) to develop a support model for Hadoop Cluster platform and services
Qualifications
A good degree in Computer Science or equivalent, with minimum 4 years in design and implementation of big data Hadoop ecosystem.
A deep understanding of Hadoop design principals, cluster connectivity, security and the factors that affect distributed system performance.
Professional experience with Hadoop technologies (complete ecosystem) such as HDFS, Hbase, Pig, Zookeeper, Hive, Impala, Kafka, Yam, Flume, MapR, MapRFS/Reduce
Proficiency in Cloudera, Hortonworks, or MapR control systems.
Strong knowledge on Spark and Flink
Experience working with integration of structured and unstructured data
Experience in implementing online functions and API using Hadoop
Experience in database sharding, replication, recovery, and performance optimizations
Strong knowledge in Hadoop monitoring tools

description:
Digital and Social Analyst - (1800003A)
Description

The web is an ever-changing playground. You love it and literally live in it! You are eager to know how people are interacting with the web and think of ways to optimise the web and improve their experiences. You justify your actions through sound analysis. Your abiding curiosity drive you to critically question what the data means contextually to a business or a brand. And most of all, you embrace change and have courage to initiate it.The ideal candidate should have a strong passion to use data meticulously to analyse ways to improve digital campaign efficiency or website performance. The job holder is also required to assist in growing StarHub’s Social Insights practice and will be responsible for delivering standard and custom Social Analytics and Listening reports.
Responsibilities :
Provide social media analytics and listening around - Products & Brands, Campaigns & Events, Competitors, Categories, Company News & Announcements and Social Pages & branded content
Responsible for analysing web usage data to evaluate site and marketing campaign performance
Develop and manage online reporting dashboards
Perform regular tracking and end of campaign/activity report generation
Make informed recommendations from data analysis to drive web elements, site content improvements and web site optimisation
Participate in consultations with key stakeholders to understand business questions that can be answered by analysing social buzz and metrics with the objective of providing actionable insights
Support in developing business specific reports and dashboards with the aim of providing data and analysis to relevant internal/external stakeholders for informed decision making
Visualize findings using charts, graphs, tables, infographics that transforms raw data into easily decipherable representation
Create and edit reports, delivered in PowerPoint, Newsletter and Excel formats that translate social data into a clear and compelling story
Assist during crisis situations by providing regular crisis monitoring updates for internal teams
Support development of a Social Media Command centre approach for the company and work with team lead and Social Technologist in execution of the agreed approach
Suggest ways to continually evolve the social insights practice in terms of process, tools and methodologies in order to maintain a best in class approach

Qualifications

Requirements :
5 to 6 years of experience in social listening, digital analytics reporting and social analytics
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Proficient in MS Excel, Powerpoint, Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics and/or other Web/ Social Analytical tools
Independent self-starter who works well in a fast paced, dynamic, team oriented environment with a strong passion for data/web marketing performance
Able to meet aggressive deadlines with minimum supervision
Efficiency in stakeholder management
Ability to work independently and with initiative
Excellent English comprehension and writing skills and tactful in interpersonal dealings
We regret only shortlisted candidate will be notified.

Be working closely with business stakeholders to understand business issues and provide suitable IT Analytical solutions

Develop recommendations for targeted cases by analysing data from HRIS and other IT solutions
Design and generate reports, data visualization and dashboards

Profile
You are best equipped for this task if you have:
Bachelor’s Degree with at least 3+ years of working experience in the area of data warehouse / reporting / big data analytics with HR Information Systems such as SAP HCM
Strong knowledge in database & reporting architecture and development

Part of your life. Part of tomorrow.

We make life easier, safer and greener – with technology that achieves more, consumes less and is accessible to everyone. Microelectronics from Infineon is the key to a better future. Analyst, Corporate Treasury - (17000245)
Description

We are looking for a dynamic individual to join the Corporate Treasury team. Corporate Treasury is part of the CFO office. We are a dedicated strategic planning unit that supports Group ALCO in managing the optimal balance sheet composition and growth.


What you’ll do

The optimal deployment of scarce financial resources. Corporate Treasury provides central guidance and allocation of available financial resources, and supports ALCO to follow through and track its strategies;
Promoting visibility and transparency within the Group through the Funds Transfer Pricing policy and incentive schemes;
Supporting ALCO to provide stewardship over the strength of the balance sheet and intrinsic earnings;
Reviewing and managing the structural liquidity, interest rate and foreign exchange exposures.
Reports to:

Head of Corporate Treasury Singapore

Qualifications

What you need to succeed

Passionately curious
Able to visualize, articulate, conceptualize and solve problems by making logical decisions given the information available
Keen interest in strategic balance sheet management
Strong written and verbal communicator
Proficient in Microsoft Excel to deliver efficient data analysis, and Microsoft Powerpoint for effective communication.
2-4 years of experience in a related banking/finance role

description:
Your Responsibilities :

Our Company

At GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) we are dedicated to improving the quality of human life by enabling people to do more, feel better, live longer. GSK is one of the world’s leading research based healthcare companies, with over 100,000 employees in 150 countries across our Pharmaceuticals, Vaccines and Consumer Healthcare business.


We are proud of the difference we make and in 2016, FORTUNE Magazine ranked GSK #1 on its list of companies that are changing the world. The 'Change the World' list recognises companies that have made significant progress in sustainable, scalable approaches to addressing societal problems as part of their company strategy. Put simply, our focus is on improving access and affordability of medicines, regardless of where people live or their ability to pay.


GSK has been present in Asia for over 50 years and our commitment to the region is strengthened by the establishment of our purpose-built headquarters for Asia. Situated in Singapore, GSK Asia House is a further step in our long-standing strategy to grow and diversify our company - emphasizing the globally balanced business we have built over the years. To better support Asia, we focus on developing talent to improve our ability to make the right decisions for healthcare professionals, patients and consumers across the region.


GSK Vaccines grew by 14% in 2016 and is one of the largest in the world. Every year we distribute nearly 1 billion doses to 170 countries, of which over 80% were supplied to developing countries. We produce 30 paediatric and adult vaccines, 11 of which are world first, to prevent a range of infectious diseases including; hepatitis, rotavirus and HPV infections, diphtheria, tetanus, whooping cough, measles, mumps, rubella, bacterial meningitis and influenza. Our Tuas site, one of only two GSK global vaccines manufacturing facilities worldwide, operates around-the-clock to manufacture the active ingredient used to make a GSK vaccine that protects children against pneumonia.


The Role

Based in the Quality department and reporting to QA Lead (Sterility Assurance), you will be part of a team supporting the environmental monitoring activities on-site to be in compliance with GMP standards.


Key responsibilities include:

• Environmental monitoring (EM)

- Perform routine environmental sampling in controlled environmental areas

- Encode non-viable particle (NVP) results into SAP and review NVP results

- Assist in EM data trend analysis

- Conduct EM OJT training

- Ensure EM equipment are calibrated before due date by coordinating with calibration and maintenance coordinator

• Documentation

- SOP (EM related) author and owner

- EM OJT material author and owner

• Deviation management

- Event (EM related) initiator and reviewer

- Identify and report problems encountered to QA Lead, including participation in problem solving and implementation of corrective actions

• Audit Readiness and Validation

- Support/perform L1 audit on EM

- Participate in method and/or equipment verification/validation

• General

- Comply with cGMP and EHSS requirements at all times

- Practice 6S and ensure good housekeeping of work area and equipment, including cleaning where appropriate


This role is on normal office hours, Monday to Friday. You may need to support weekend (OT) or afternoon shift (from 2pm onwards) at times.


New joiner will use the title of "Associate" instead of "Analyst" due to internal naming.


What We Can Offer You

GSK’s dedication to the wellbeing of our employees is reflected in the benefits we offer; including healthcare for yourself and dependents, performance related bonus, long term incentives and a host of other flexible offerings you can tailor to your own preferences. We also offer a range of employee health and wellbeing programs including our truly unique Partnership for Prevention program, a global commitment by GSK to provide all employees with up to 40 preventative healthcare services bringing to life our mission to: do more, feel better and live longer.


Application Process

At GSK we value diversity and treat all candidates equally. We aim to create an inclusive workplace where all employees feel engaged, supportive of one another, and know their work makes an important contribution.


If you would like to join us in innovating and inspiring changes in the industry, we urge you to apply.


Closing date for applications: 11-Dec-2017


*LI-GSK


Why You? 

Basic qualifications:

• Looking for NITEC/Higher NITEC or Diploma holders with majors in Microbiology, Biology, Biotechnology, Life Science or relevant Science discipline


Preferred qualifications:

Technical

• Good sampling and analytical skills

• Prior experience in working in clean classified environment will be an advantage

• Knowledge of clean room process & cGMP will be an advantage


Business

• Organized individual

• Team player


Why GSK? :

At GSK, our mission is to improve the quality of human life by enabling people to do more, feel better and live longer. Our three world-leading businesses research and deliver innovative medicines, vaccines and consumer healthcare products. We need a talented and motivated workforce to deliver against our strategy. To achieve this, we strive to attract the best people and to create an environment that empowers and inspires.


Contact information:

You may apply for this position online by selecting the Apply now button.


Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies


GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

description:
Job Description:


Get to know the role:

As our reporting and automation expert, you will be the custodian of Grab's analytics reporting stack that provides business metrics regionally across different functions and teams.
Very quickly, you will develop cross-domain and cross-functional knowledge about Grab's business, products and operations while working with vast volumes of data.
The day-to-day activities:

Manage, create and maintain critical business reports and dashboards
Perform data wrangling and automate acquisition/transformation of custom data sources
Interface with business stakeholders across Grab for ad-hoc reporting and analyses
Develop and uphold best practices with respect to change management, documentation and data protocols to ensure high performance reporting
Perform internal analytics to continuously refine how we operate
The must-have's:

A polytechnic and/or university degree
Strong in SQL (min 1-2 years hands on experience with relational databases and/or big data warehouses)
Knowledgeable in Python or other programming languages
Cognizant of coding best practices and performance tuning
Experience working with Redshift and/or Presto is a plus
Experience with Tableau or similar BI tools, familiarity with Tableau Server is a plus
Strong problem solver, able to investigate and resolve issues independently
Able to work under pressure and deliver work arounds quickly to ensure business as usual
title: Regional Data Analyst

description:
Position Purpose

Trade and Structured Finance (TSF) complements the efforts of Cargill business units (BU) by providing financial solutions to Cargill's business partners (suppliers and buyers). TSF's experience and expertise in global financial markets aid in mitigating documentary, cross-border and credit risks associated with structured trade finance. TSF plays a key role in funding the global operations of Cargill through cross-border funding structures and management of transferability and convertibility risks. In addition to structured trade finance and internal funding, TSF also leverages Cargill's international trade flows to create trade structures that provide funding to emerging market-based financial institutions and corporations.

To handle the administration of all aspects of the Trade & Structured Finance activities in a timely and accurate manner. Ensure compliance to the TSF guidelines and procedures. Responsibilities also include developing thorough knowledge of transaction structures and related documentation, legal and tax implications, settlements, funding, delivery of assets, and working with other local and regional offices to ensure that appropriate Cargill controls are included in settlement process.

Principal Accountabilities
70% - Trades settlement
Execution of all TSF trades in adherence to the TSF Standard Operating Procedures/Guidelines. Ensure work processes and procedures are in compliance with Cargill and TSF policies.Manage all aspects of trade settlement. Preparation and execution of all documents arising from TSF activity based on approved templates (trade confirmations, financing agreements, LC formats, etc.); Coordination with counter-parties and internally on issuance of instruments (letters of credit, stand-by LC, guarantees) and on timing of funding;Input/processing of deals in the trade capture system;Second review and verification of trades (system input, documentation, approvals) & cash payments (amounts, value dates, bank details)Liaise with other functional groups including traders, trade execution teams, accounting and treasury to resolve execution issues and provide assistance where necessary.Assist in transaction file reviews within defined timelines.

20% - Develop a thorough understanding of relevant TSF structures through PAF reviews including the key risks and controls associated with each structure, and relevant tax & legal implications. Ensure complete understanding of transaction specifics, including data integrity, documentation, and settlement processes as well as the attributes of the relevant market and geography. Assist other team members in obtaining a deeper understanding of structures and processes through informal, on-the-job training opportunities.

10% - Facilitate innovation and work process improvements through idea generation and applying of business knowledge . Champion and/or participate in global projects where appropriate.

Qualifications

Education, Experience, Skills

Required Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration/Finance/Accounting/Economics plus 2 - 4 years of relevant business experienceUnderstanding of trade finance businessStrong people/teamwork skills, yet able to work independentlyProven ability to take initiative to independently analyze and solve complex problemsDemonstrated knowledge of internal control structure & complianceGood oral and written communication skillsGood written and spoken Chinese language.Strong attention to detail, and thoroughness and accuracy in workGood organizational skills with ability to perform well under pressure and manage multiple prioritiesAbility to adapt positively to an ever-changing environmentAbility to work flexible hours in support of global counterparties and global TSF teamFamiliarity with Mircosoft office applications

Preferred Qualifications

Exposure to forwarding operations of Commodity Trading companyExposure to commodity finance and documentationsFamiliar with ICC publications and use of various types of instruments including LCs, Bills of Exchange, SBLCs, BGs, etcExperience in loan administration in a financial institution

Note- Only Selected candidate will be called.

Job Type

Shift

You will be expected to support the drafting and refinement of the Risk Standards and Aggregation policy. To meet the target delivery timeline, the tasks on the policies will need to be done in parallel with the data documentation, which will consume the bulk of current resources' time.
You will be expected to work with the functional leads from the various risk reporting teams to review options to operationalize the requirements in the policy, while working with the consultants to update the policy to provide better clarity (where necessary) to meet BCBS239 requirements.

Have good knowledge of credit or market risk concepts, with some experience in the analytics and reporting role
Possess the ability to multi-task and good communications skills
Team player and self-starter

description:
Cyber Fraud Analyst - Group Risk Management - (17000244)
Description

Responsibilities:
Manage the Bank’s cyber fraud intelligence platform.
Lead efforts to produce quality fraud intelligence reports and alerts.
Lead the design and production of new and advanced techniques to recognise and prevent cyber fraud.
Author and review reports and contribute to metrics production.
Maintain knowledge of cyber fraud trends and modus operandi.
Engage in problem solving, process improvement, and strategic planning initiatives.
Provide support to the business units with regards to cyber fraud management.
Continually identify and evaluate 3rd party solutions to augment cyber fraud management process.
LI-CT

Qualifications

General Requirements

Experience:
5 or more years of experience in either area of fraud and/or cyber security domains.
2+ years of experience collecting, analysing and writing professional fraud intelligence reports.
Strong knowledge of cyber criminals’ tactics, techniques and procedures.
Strong knowledge of financial malware and exploit kits
Technical Skills:
Core competencies in fraud and cyber security domains.
Knowledge of exploitation activities related to the above domains.
Knowledge of data analytics tools and concepts.
Process Skills:
Strong attention to detail in conducting analysis combined with ability to accurately record full supporting documentation.
Ability to leverage the efforts of multiple teams into a cohesive product/service.
Ability to work in a fast paced environment that includes the translation of complex concepts and issues into detailed reports which is easily understood by business stakeholders.
Communication Skills:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required.
Able to articulate and visually present complex analysis results.
Ability to communicate effectively with business representatives in explaining findings clearly and where necessary, in layman's terms.
People Skills:
Excellent people, time and organization management.
Ability to work with minimal direction and supervision-independently or in leadership role.
Experience managing aggressive deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to coordinate, work with, and gain the trust of business stakeholders, fraud risk management teams to achieve a desired objective.
