These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes World's Most Innovative Company five years in a row and one of Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For eight years in a row. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world.


We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our Business Development teams. You will work strategically to source and consolidate leads to set the business up for success. This role is an excellent foundation for a successful career in sales within Salesforce.


Responsibilities:

Strategic Business Development
Proactively identify decision makers in strategic accounts through creative research
Utilize resources such as LinkedIn and other external data sources
Identify new companies in specific target markets
Navigate and profile organizational structures for priority accounts identified by sales management
As a key member of the team, collaborate with Business Development Representatives to execute account plans according to business priorities
Participate in team meetings and contribute valuable ideas
Results Driven Assignments
Work towards weekly targets in line with team goals
Benefit from regular management coaching related to key performance indicators

Required:


Interested in being a part of a fast-paced sales environment
Team player with excellent oral and written communication
Exceptional organisational and planning skills and ability to prioritize
Proactive
Target driven
Experience with Excel and LinkedIn Sales Navigator
Experience using/cleaning external sources of data such as Hoovers and OneSource to validate company information and add new companies
Bachelors Degree preferred (not essential)
Posting Statement
Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org.
title: Business Development Associate, Singapore

description:
We are pleased to announce that Frontier Strategy Group (FSG) has acquired Ducker Worldwide! Together, the combined company will offer a full spectrum of services executives need to make decisions in today’s global high-stakes markets: data-driven insight into diverse macroeconomic environments, deep industry-specific coverage, and expert analyst advisory support on aligning business strategy and operations to anticipated changes. For more detail about the acquisition, please click here .

About Frontier Strategy Group

Over the past decade, FSG has become a proven leader in helping multinational executives outperform in emerging markets across Asia, Latin America, Europe, the Middle East, and Africa. Its consultants and analysts help power the growth mandates and decision processes of regional and corporate executives with an integrated solution of on-demand advisory support, award-winning data and market intelligence, white-glove service, executive roundtable forums, and tailored consulting services. FSG has built strong client communities in the healthcare, consumer products, industrials, and technology sectors. The company is based in Washington, DC, with offices in London, Singapore and New York.

About Ducker Worldwide

Ducker Worldwide, a premier business-to-business (B2B) consulting and research firm, is driven to help its clients achieve their most ambitious growth goals. Custom market intelligence, strategic consulting and transaction advisory services are delivered by fully engaged Ducker principals and a diverse team of global talent. With exclusive access to industry leaders and opportunities, Ducker applies robust analytics and critical thinking to every engagement, delivering unique, fact-based solutions for our clients – solutions that lead to superior commercial results. Ducker is headquartered in Detroit, Mich., with offices around the world, including Bangalore, Berlin, London, Paris and Shanghai. Founded by William H. Ducker in 1961, Ducker celebrates over 56 years in business.

As we plan for continued growth, FSG is seeking a Business Development Professional (Mid-Level) to join our Asia Pacific (APAC) team based in Singapore. The successful candidate will be expected to travel (approx. 50%). Qualified individuals with passion for emerging markets are strongly encouraged to apply.

Job Description & Responsibilities

Business Development Professionals (Mid-Level) are responsible for new business generation through a consultative sales process, and must possess strong business knowledge, executive presence, as well as excellent commercial instincts.

The successful candidate will be expected to:
Build and execute a plan to meet and exceed target revenue goals

Manage the entire sales process from beginning to end using a consultative sales approach

Follow a metrics-driven approach to manage a pipeline of opportunities using Salesforce.com to ensure predictable monthly revenue performance

Work closely with the Business Development Associate to identify and pursue prospective clients and develop the required pipeline to achieve target

Schedule new sales interactions as targeted

Work closely with colleagues in the Client Service and Research team to develop compelling solutions tailored to client needs

Document and share best practices

Other responsibilities include:
Collaborate with other FSG departments to increase potential client awareness/satisfaction

Collaborate with colleagues in the Product team to ensure the continual refinement and improvement of the FSG value proposition

Partner with Client Services team to identify cross-selling opportunities within existing client base

Qualifications & Experience

The successful candidate will possess:
Bachelor’s degree

Minimum of three years of outside sales experience; experience selling intangible products such as research or advisory services is preferred

Proven track record of success exceeding sales targets and managing a new business territory

Strong prospecting, needs analysis, negotiating and closing skills

Strong process discipline

Language fluency in relevant regional languages is a plus but not required

This position will be located in our Singapore office. Ideal candidates will be located in Singapore. However, FSG will consider candidates who are willing to relocate. Interested candidates should send a resume and cover letter (including salary requirements), via the link in this job posting or at http://frontierstrategygroup.com/careers .
title: Business Development Professional, Asia Pacific (Mid-Level)

description:
Implement processes to better manage the administration, planning and financial needs of a division or department. Monitor compliance with corporate policies and procedures.


Role
 

Ensure timely and realistic financial forecasts, reports and analyses by assisting team in the budgeting and forecasting process for business function.
 
Support the business and finance teams in budget and forecast reports to support management review for financial outcomes.
 
Ensure forecasts and budget submissions and make recommendations to improve forecasts accuracy.
 
Assist to track and evaluate business performance against forecasts and budgets by analyzing targets against variances.
 
Undertake ad-hoc business cases and analysis which may include business opportunities, customer needs and marketing campaigns analysis to identify issues, trends and growth objectives.
 
Support the team in preparation for business reviews with timely, accurate reports and presentations to customers.
 
Oversee budgets, forecasts and long range planning for expenses and capital.


All About You
 

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business or equivalent experience
 
Proven related work experience in financial planning and analysis comprising of forecasting and budgeting.
 
Outstanding analytical skill with sound business knowledge of the payments industry.
 
Excellent interpersonal, written and communication skills with the ability to analyze financial information with clear and concise explanations and provide actionable recommendations with business stakeholders.
 
Proven written communication skills; expertise in communicating complex concepts through visually appealing presentations.
 
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft applications (Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
 
Working knowledge in financial planning systems such as Hyperion and Oracle.
Equal Opportunity Employer
title: Senior Analyst, Business Administration

description:
(Job Number: 01ULW)
Do you want to apply your skills, knowledge and energy to implementing ICT and digital solutions that will impact the lives of Singaporeans and the public? In GovTech, you can!

As a Business Analyst, you will assess applicability for adoption, understand user requirements, and provide Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Business Process Management (BPM) or Case Management solutions to bridge business needs. You will be working in a Government Agency as a key member of the GovTech project team, comprising the Project Manager, Solution Architect (where applicable) and the Technical Services Consultant, to deliver ICT capabilities to realise Singapore’s vision of a Smart Nation.

What to Expect:

Analyse Agency’s needs, scope the problem and develop business case to address the problem
Capture business requirements, source and evaluate alternatives, and recommend solution that best fits Agency’s needs
Work with Agency users to ensure smooth deployment and adoption of new solution
Work on the integration of solution with other business systems and applications used in the company
Work directly and manage development partner to implement new CRM/BPM/Case Management functionality
Involve in managing the post-implementation support and maintenance of the applications
Review and analyze organization business needs; confer with users to evaluate requirements, discuss solutions and develop plan of approach; analyze existing processes and make recommendations to better streamline the overall processes within the solution
How to Succeed:
Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering or related discipline
At least 4 years of working experience
Participated in full software development life cycle (SDLC), with past software development experience
Implementation experience in least one CRM or BPM Solutions (e.g. MS CRM Dynamics, SugarCRM, SAP CRM, Pegasystems, etc)
Strong analytical, conceptualisation and problem solving skills
Ability to take a broad, strategic perspective as well as drill deep to understand business needs and challenges
Results and customer oriented
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, with the ability to pitch ideas and influence stakeholders
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to relate and interact with various stakeholders, including senior management
Pluses+
Consulting or Business Analysis experience
Business Analysis certification: Certification of Competency in Business Analysis (CCBA) / Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP)

Schedule - Full-time
Employee Status - Permanent
title: Business Analyst/Senior Business Analyst (CRM / BPM / Case Management)

We are pleased to announce that Frontier Strategy Group (FSG) has acquired Ducker Worldwide! Together, the combined company will offer a full spectrum of services executives need to make decisions in today’s global high-stakes markets: data-driven insight into diverse macroeconomic environments, deep industry-specific coverage, and expert analyst advisory support on aligning business strategy and operations to anticipated changes. For more detail about the acquisition, please click here .

About Frontier Strategy Group

Over the past decade, FSG has become a proven leader in helping multinational executives outperform in emerging markets across Asia, Latin America, Europe, the Middle East, and Africa. Its consultants and analysts help power the growth mandates and decision processes of regional and corporate executives with an integrated solution of on-demand advisory support, award-winning data and market intelligence, white-glove service, executive roundtable forums, and tailored consulting services. FSG has built strong client communities in the healthcare, consumer products, industrials, and technology sectors. The company is based in Washington, DC, with offices in London, Singapore and New York.

About Ducker Worldwide

Ducker Worldwide, a premier business-to-business (B2B) consulting and research firm, is driven to help its clients achieve their most ambitious growth goals. Custom market intelligence, strategic consulting and transaction advisory services are delivered by fully engaged Ducker principals and a diverse team of global talent. With exclusive access to industry leaders and opportunities, Ducker applies robust analytics and critical thinking to every engagement, delivering unique, fact-based solutions for our clients – solutions that lead to superior commercial results. Ducker is headquartered in Detroit, Mich., with offices around the world, including Bangalore, Berlin, London, Paris and Shanghai. Founded by William H. Ducker in 1961, Ducker celebrates over 56 years in business.

As we plan for continued growth, FSG is seeking a Business Development Associate to join our Asia Pacific (APAC) team based in Singapore. Qualified individuals with passion for emerging markets are strongly encouraged to apply.

Job Description & Responsibilities

Business Development Associates (BDAs) support our new sales teams. As the first point of contact for potential clients, BDAs play a critical role in the firm’s business development efforts.

Specific responsibilities include:
Research, Prospecting and New Lead Generation:
Gather business intelligence on target companies and industries to identify new business opportunities

Identify senior executives, namely Heads of Region, Heads of International and C-Suite executives, who might be a fit for FSG’s services

Obtain executives’ contact information through internet research, e-mail, and cold calling

Utilize Salesforce on a daily basis to ensure the accuracy of leads and qualified prospects

New Meeting Generation:
Work closely with the Marketing department and Sales Director to conduct targeted and content-led e-mail campaigns

Prioritize outreach and prepare target lists for cold calling and e-mail follow up through Salesforce.com

Schedule and confirm sales meetings in order to reach performance-based goals

Prepare background material on the prospective client for all sales meetings

Pipeline Management

Using Salesforce, partner with Sales Director to manage a pipeline of opportunities and ensure predictable monthly revenue performance

Support each sales cycle and help drive urgency whenever possible

Qualifications & Experience

The successful candidate must possess:
Bachelor’s degree

0-2 years of experience working in a business setting (full-time or internship)

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

Proven ability to meet and exceed goals

Demonstrated attention to detail

Competitive spirit and a tenacious attitude

Interest in a long-term career in Marketing, Business Development, Consulting, or Emerging Market

While not required, the following qualifications will also contribute to a strong application:

Experience in sales, lead generation, fundraising, or customer service

Proven leadership experience

Exposure to different cultures – comfortable in an international environment either through work, school, or travel

Application Process:
This position will be located in our Singapore office. Ideal candidates will be located in Singapore. Interested candidates should send a resume and cover letter (including salary requirements), via the link in this job posting or at http://frontierstrategygroup.com/careers .
title: Business Development Associate, Asia Pacific

description:
You're the brains behind our work.
You're ready to bring your knowledge from the classroom to the boardroom; and Citi wants to help you get there. Whether it's honing your skills or building your network, we know that success can't come without growth. Our programs equip you with the knowledge and training you need to play a valuable role on your team, and establish a long-term career here. At Citi, we value internal mobility; and career growth is not a question of if but when.
Our Technology business is looking for enthusiastic individuals to join the team. Technology plays a central role in driving value for Citi and our clients by providing a foundation that enables Citi to achieve daily operational and long-term growth goals. As measured by transaction volume and customer touch points alone, Citi's Technology is one of the largest single organizations in the world, you will touch many lines of Citi business and support functions across the globe. By becoming a member of this team, you will be working as part of Citi Service Centers or part of a core function in Technology.

description:
In your new role you will:
Work as an expert on Business Analytics / Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence and present research findings to internal & external stakeholders
Ideation and change agent who works closely with all business units to inspire data driven business business innovation with examples and ideas
Thought leadership (data science), Problem statement analysis and Use case validation (including PoV and PoC)
Prove concepts, prototypes and implementations, mainly pertaining to Predictive analytics, Reinforcement Learning, NLP, Anomaly Detection, Deep Neural Networks etc
Responsible for End-to-end analytical cycles, covering Data pre-processing, EDA, Modelling and Visualisation of insights
Build Performance Metrics & dashboard / storyboard to present information and insights gathered as part of analysis
Apply Machine Learning frameworks such as H2O, Tenser Flow, Pytorch & Agile Methodologies for Business Analytics projects
Create and review technical design documentations / researches, patents and other intellectual property
Provides guidance to junior data scientists
Profile
You are best equipped for this task if you have:
PhD / Master’s Degree in Business Analytics / Mathematics / Statistics with min 5 years of relevant working experience
Strong understanding, conceptualizing and hands-on working knowledge using Data Science and Analytical methods for AI/ML including deep learning methods
Good understanding of cloud based AI/ML products from Google, Amazon, IBM & AWS
Programming & framework experience in one or more of the following: Python, C, C++, APO.ai, Cortana, Alexa, CloudML, AureML, CoreML, TensorFlow, Theano, Torch, Caffe, H2O.ai, etc
Experience in best practice adaption and external benchmarking
Structured and methodical with high degree of self-initiative
Excellent interpersonal skills with enhanced facilitation skills and practice influencing techniques
About Us
Part of your life. Part of tomorrow.

We make life easier, safer and greener – with technology that achieves more, consumes less and is accessible to everyone. Microelectronics from Infineon is the key to a better future. Efficient use of energy, environmentally-friendly mobility and security in a connected world – we solve some of the most critical challenges that our society faces while taking a conscientious approach to the use of natural resources.
What we offer you in Singapore
Singapore is our regional headquarter for Asia-Pacific and consists of production, research & development, sales & marketing, supply chain and many central functions.

 Find out more about our location Singapore
title: Senior Analyst - Business Intelligence and Analytics

description:
The World Wide Supply Chain team is seeking to hire a Senior Business Analyst to join the Asia Pacific team. The role will be varied, encompassing all aspects of Supply Chain Operations throughout the life cycle of our products. The position is based in Singapore and reports to the Asia Pacific Supply Chain Manager.
The successful candidate will have high level analytical skills with the ability to dissect and analyse large amounts of data, present in an understandable format plus develop and present proposals for change.

This role will require the person to work both on individual studies and as part of wider project teams delivering significant business change.
The successful candidate will be expected to participate in:

• Identifying & analysing large amounts of information from multiple sources to identify profiles & trends. This could be APAC specific or it could be for any Apple geography or World Wide Analysis.

• The person will form part of the Global Supply Chain Group and ensure they are representing the requirements of the Asia Pacific region in the Global Supply Chain meetings.

• A key part of their role will be to understand and leverage the Supply Chain concepts and opportunities being worked across the other regions with a view to applying these to the Asia Pacific region. Where appropriate they will project manage the implementation of these initiatives in their region working closely with the relevant Supply Chain and Business Process Re-engineering (BPR) teams.

• The person will drive innovative and challenging thinking in our approach to supply chain and will ensure appropriate benchmarking takes place from a regional Supply Chain perspective at least on an annual basis.

• Undertake analysis to support decision making on fulfillment decisions.

• Evaluating current business processes and identify opportunities to improve.

• Present comprehensive proposals for enhancements based on investigations & analysis undertaken

• Work closely with Finance to focus on the identification of supply chain cost challenges and opportunities by product and by route to market.

• Work closely with other operational business units such as Reseller Operations, SDM, Retail Fulfillment and Apple Fulfillment Operations to focus on the identification of supply chain cost challenges and opportunities.

• Developing processes focusing on cost, lead-time and customer supply chain performance expectations

• Ability to maintain and develop relationships, within a project and team.
Technical person with the ability to quickly understand business processes and business drivers

Strong analytical and financial capabilities with experience in developing suites of reporting

Ability to manage complex projects in a matrix organization

A desire to operate hands on in the role and have excellent verbal, analytical, written, organizational and interpersonal skills

The appetite of a self-starter who is motivated and innovative, with a high tolerance of stress in managing multiple priorities and meeting all deadlines

Strong excel skills are essential with data base experience a distinct advantage

Experience with LTL, FTL, Parcel, Air and Ocean modes of transportation and providers of same, as well as global shipping standards and freight forwarding, would be a distinct advantage.
Supply Chain or Industrial Engineering Degree qualified with 7 years logistics, supply chain, fulfillment operations experience.
Prior experience in fields that demand complex quantitative analysis such as finance or operations research is beneficial.

title: Business Intelligence Expert Lead

description:
People Operations strives to revolutionize human resources the same way that Google has revolutionized search. We are helping to find, grow and keep the remarkable assemblage of talent who are our Googlers. You'll be a champion of Google's culture and values, partnering with our business leaders to help them build their organizations and make sure all people decisions are based on data. Whether coaching your clients on how to lead their teams, navigating and resolving employee relations issues or managing programs that help develop our Googlers, you are exceptionally focused on putting them first, and being as clear and transparent as possible to help Googlers understand how people decisions get made.


The People Consultant team works directly with Googlers and People Partners to provide personalized guidance, support and solutions in relation to a breadth of People Ops-related activities.


In this role, you will ensure our Googlers experience the best that Google has to offer, using your client-facing, problem solving, analytical and execution skills, along with your domain expertise and empathy. You'll focus on optimizing Googler’s experiences, providing timely responses, sharing knowledge with fellow team members, and balancing Googlers' individual needs with Google's philosophy, principles, and available resources.


Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the champions of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.


Responsibilities
Provide support and consultation to the business regarding HR programs, policies, and other HR-related items.
Advise on performance management issues and lead minor investigations and reorganizations.
Assist People Partners with planning and roll-out of HR programs and initiatives.
Triage Googler enquiries via a ticketing system and connect Googlers to the right subject matter expert when necessary.
Identify opportunities to improve HR policies by connecting the dots across multiple experiences provided by Googlers/Managers. Identify and propose solutions to correct inconsistent HR policies and gaps.

Qualifications
Minimum qualifications:
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant work experience.
Business partner or generalist experience. Experience with data, analysis, trends and reports.

Preferred qualifications:
Experience in HR, people programs, staffing or other large-scale people related roles.
Client-service experience with a focus on delivering exceptional customer service.
Demonstrated experience with cross-functional collaboration and influencing.
Effective interpersonal, teamwork and organizational skills.
Ability to speak and write in Mandarin fluently and idiomatically.

title: Business Analyst Cash management

description:
If you really want to make a difference – make it with us
Launched in July 2017 by Prime Minister Lee and Siemens CEO Joe Kaeser, the Singapore Digitalization Hub is the first fully-integrated major Digital Hub for Siemens in the world. With contributions by all Divisions, the Singapore Hub will demonstrate our IoT leadership with digitalization show-cases and brings its expertise and innovations to the markets in the APAC region. An Urban & Infrastructure Data Analytics and Application Center (DAAC) forms the core and largest portion of the Digitalization Hub.
The City Use Case Innovation Lab and the Analytics & Visualization Lab help to kick-start the DAAC with sufficient expertise and to champion innovation and co-creation, complementing the digital centers of the Divisions. Driven by innovation, we develop data-driven intelligent solutions for the increasing digitalization of cities, infrastructure and industries. To do this, we work closely with our customers, partners and the global Siemens network, with agile methods and rapid prototyping.
We are forming a passionate group of solution innovators, UX devotees, techies, data scientists, software lovers, AR/VR experts, visual artists, and architects, working in a lean startup concept. We strive to solve complex problems in various domains ranging from industry, energy, mobility and buildings to smart cities by applying methods and principles of data analytics, artificial intelligence, simulations, and interactive visualization. We are looking for equally passionate techies to join us in this exciting journey of finding solutions to some non-trivial challenges of the always connected petabyte world.
Chief Architect - Software & Data Analytics
What are my responsibilities?
Provide technical leadership to the Urban & Infrastructure DAAC team, collaborators, eco-system partners and customers.
Leading & mentoring a team of SW Architects, Data Architects, Data Analysts, Cloud Experts and Web-developers
Oversee & manage projects implemented by Corporate Technologiy teams in India and China
Drive implementation of high-impact software architecture methods, tools, and processes.
Consult and collaborate with the Use-case Specialists, Solution Innovators and Product Owners as well as with the design team to identify and prioritize new data-analytics driven business opportunities, to define target architecture based on business requirements to implement innovative solutions in Minimum Viable Products and pilot installations as well as for future productization
Govern the architecture, design and technical implementation to guarantee scalable solutions. Guide, Define and Improve high-level platform architectures (data, software, enterprise) and framework definition, platform/application design specification, etc.
Define, articulate and apply architectural principles and patterns; Perform architecture reviews and assessments.
Communicate complex solutions in a clear and understandable way to both experts & non-experts.
What do I require to qualify for the job?
Masters degree or Ph.D. in Computer Science or Data Science or a related discipline
At least 10 years professional experience in designing, architecting and developing software based solutions (incl. large-scale / distributed systems) by applying state-of-the-art technologies for Scalable/High Throughput Data Management, Edge/Fog Analytics, Decision Support Systems, Machine Intelligence, and data intensive Digital applications on-premise and in cloud.
At least 6 years of experience setting the direction of data science projects with multiple stakeholders, collaborating with Developers, UX Experts, Product Owners, etc.
Multi-year Experience in executing architectural reviews of Data / Enterprise / Software architectures
5+ years Experience in working with cross-cultural global architect and SW developer teams from India, Europe, China, US
Experience in managing 3rd party and/or overseas development teams is a must
Worked as Product Owner for platforms and SW applications
Experience in Software development using Agile methodologies
Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
Strong problem solving, communication and Social skills
Strong business analysis skills and experience, including development of business vision and strategies, functional decomposition, requirements capture, process modeling
Experience in applying machine/deep learning techniques on large volume sensor/image/video data (Hadoop, Spark, Druid, TensorFlow, Caffe and Theano) e.g. for prediction, simulation and decision support in future road management, edge analytics for factories and power plants, grid optimization
At least 6 years of proven deep technical expertise using any of the high level programming languages viz. Javascript , Python, Scala, R or Go
Solid proven experience with developing platforms using Micro-Services Architecture and the ecosystem with cloud as backend.
Deep knowhow of all the flavors of cloud i.e. PaaS, IaaS and SaaS for public, private, hybrid cloud.
Hands on with Containerization technologies like Docker, Docker swarm, Brooklyn, Kubernetes, Amazon ECS, Azure Container service
Deep understanding, passion and experience in distributed computing frameworks, especially Hadoop, Mahout, Spark, Pig, Hive and RDBMS, NoSQL datastores e.g. Cassandra, InfluxDB
Exposure/ experience to tools & Infrastructure such as Jenkins, Chef/Puppet/Ansible, GITHUB, Eclipse is desirable.
Experience of at least one of the commonly‐used methods, notations and tools (e.g. MooD, Rational Suite, METIS, Artisan, ISSE, System Architect, UML, RUP).
Knowledge of MQTT, Kafka, Apache Nifi, S3, Influx, Cassandra, Presto and Redshift
Hands on in developing application using J2EE, Webservices, Spring framework
Strong analysis skills and experience, including development of implementation strategies, functional decomposition, requirements capture, process modeling etc.
Strong knowledge of design and architectural patterns.
Closely following latest developments in Big Data landscape and be an early adopter of disruptive trends/technologies
Experience on Siemens related platforms and applications is preferable
Industry recognized certifications on enterprise architecture or software architecture, certification on underlying concepts, practices or tools from enterprise architecture to cloud computing/distributed computing and Scrum process are desired.
Certification in Design Thinking is a plus
Publication record in high profile peer-reviewed journals and conferences is also a plus

General presentation of the position:
Under the responsibility of the Products & Services Domain Manager, the MyAdvisory Business Analyst (MyADv BA) will assist and work with the MyAdvisory Project on the entire projects and related to MyAdvisory for our WM sites.
The 2 main missions of the MyAdv BA will be to coordinate the implementation and bring added value to the existing functional setup by analyzing potential changes to existing process as well as analyzing new products to be added to the program.
Jointly with the IT teams, the MyAdv BA will also have to guarantee that each new setup is compatible with the existing WMIS standards in term of parameterization, in order to mutualize as much as possible the target solution. A detailed gap analysis will have to be performed on each site in order to minimize specific local solution in favor of MyAdvisory Calypso and our Global Asset solution.
The SP BA will interact with IT teams located in Singapore, Geneva while complying with WMIS norms and Standards. He or She will be the privileged contact for Asia site, and will assist the MyAdvisory Project Manager on all standard project management tasks such as:
Risks, attention points and issues follow-up
Requirements and general functional specifications

Drive and challenge business units on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans

Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, managers, and subject matter experts.

Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs.
Be the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams.

Financial Products functional/business knowledge;

Autonomy

description:
We are currently seeking a Senior Business Analyst, IT to join DHL eCommerce Asia Pacific!
The Senior Business Analyst, IT will be responsible to provide IT solutions that meets the requirements of the Business and the Customer. The role requires the incumbent to work jointly and communicate effectively with other functional areas of the business (Commercial, Operations, Products, Marketing, Sales, etc.), the development supplier, the global and regional IT teams as well as the user community.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
• Gather, analyse and document business requirements in complex projects, in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
• Manage solution development.
• Drive innovative solutions that are easy to use for our customers.
• Develop and facilitate best practices in a global DHL eCommerce IT team.
• Develop system specifications (including wireframes, use cases, UML, business process modelling).
• Drive requirements effort estimation and develop release plans in alignment with stakeholders, including the project and business leads.
• Act as the primary e-business liaison to business teams as well as onsite or offshore development team for assigned projects.
• Provide Quality Assurance for newly developed solutions and coordinate User acceptance.
• Support deployment and post-launch maintenance/enhancement.
Desired Skills / Qualifications
• At least 8 years in of experience in IT or related field, proven experience with commonly used concepts, practices, and procedures within IT field, preferably within airline, transportation or logistics industry.
• Preferred e-Commerce website and/or customer portal design experience. Experience in B2C e-Commerce advantageous.
• At least 5 years experience with requirements engineering tools and SQL databases.
• At least 5 years experience with HTML, CSS, related web technologies and backend systems to support online commerce.
• Demonstrated Go-Getter attitude.
• Strong analytical and problem solving and quantitative analysis skills.
• Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills. Must be able to communicate effectively and confidently with users, team members and management.
• Demonstrated facilitation skills.
• Is able to elicit requirements from stakeholders across organizational and geographical boundaries.
• Proven experience at driving consensus across multiple stakeholders.
• Has worked in a global/regional setting, with globally distributed stakeholders.
• Willing to travel internationally.
• Experience with DP DHL group of companies is advantageous.
• Is a Go-Getter.
Minimum Educational Qualification
• Master or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/ Engineering or related fields.

description:
Asia IT Applications Architect
More about Aimia and what we do
Loyalty management is the process of identifying, understanding and influencing best customers in order to build sustained, reciprocal and meaningful relationships that increase profits and drive long term enterprise value. We are Aimia and it is our vision to be the recognised global leader in loyalty management.
Across our global enterprise we offer a full suite of services delivered through three loyalty service streams:
Coalition Loyalty – designing, building and managing multi-partner and shared currency loyalty programs around the globe
Proprietary Loyalty – designing, building and managing strategic business and customer loyalty programs for individual clients around the globe
Loyalty Analytics – collecting, analysing and deriving actionable insight from customer data to deliver measurable marketing ROI for clients and partners around the globe
Here in Asia Pacific, Aimia has proven experience in partnering with clients to deliver leading proprietary loyalty programs across the region. Our proprietary loyalty service experts design, launch and operate new client programs, re-launch, refresh and operate existing client programs and bring our digital, mobile and analytical expertise to bear on behalf of clients. As we continue on our journey to realise our vision to be the recognised global leader in loyalty management, we are actively building out our capability to offer increased services across the loyalty analytics and coalition loyalty streams.
Our Asia Pac initiatives are currently being supported primarily by our Sydney and Singapore teams. Other regional teams are based out of Kuala Lumpur, Jakarta and Auckland offices.
In Singapore we are an office of 53 employees, located at 1 Maritime Square, #07-02 HarbourFront Centre (Lobby C) Singapore 099253.
In Sydney we are an office of 170 employees, located at Level 2, 33 Saunders Street, Pyrmont NSW.
What is the focus of this role?
The APAC Applications Architect is accountable for ensuring flawless IT delivery of AIMIA solutions to clients in APAC. As a member of the APAC IT team, and reporting to the APAC ADM Director, the APAC Applications Architect will collaborate closely with other GLS teams and AIMIA’s IT partners involved in client projects regionally (RSC, PMO, and Client teams), to ensure successful technology delivery.
The APAC Applications Architect will provide leadership and direction to the Application Development & Maintenance (ADM) team to support AIMIA’s global strategic directions and services.
The APAC Applications Architect will also collaborate with AIMIA’s IT partners and 3rd parties to ensure a quality process and delivery.
Ability to build relationships and work in a matrix environment while being adaptable / flexible and maintaining big picture thinking is a must.
Responsibilities include:
Delivery Management
Responsible for the technology delivery of AIMIA products on client implementation projects, including the hosting infrastructure, development operations (DevOps) and technology integrations with client systems and third parties.
Partner with Commercial and Solutions team in Pre-Sales and TBS activity when required to ensure that deal estimation includes appropriate estimates for technology e.g. RFP preparation, pre-sales workshops, upgrades, change requests, etc.
Responsible for ensuring use of best practises for development and testing from AIMIA’s IT team and IT partners.
Update, report and escalate to ADM Director on project status, key technical issues.
Operational Management
Provide management input into the demand forecast, leadership and work prioritization with our Global IT technology partners (Infosys and HPE) whose resources (analysts, developers, project managers, etc.) are both onshore and offshore.
Liaise with Global Engineering, Service & Operations to ensure acceptance into service by client, and to continually improve the service experience from a technology standpoint, increasing AIMIA value by driving cost effective standardization across the client portfolio.
Liaise with Commercial and Regional Solution Centres teams as required
Communication and Collaboration
Collaborate with Commercial and Regional Solution Centres teams as required.
Provide timely and proactive communication to all stakeholders across the client release lifecycle.
Work closely with other AIMIA and IT partner architecture teams to ensure standardised solutions and collaboration.
Build rapport and strong working relationships with AIMIA’s IT partners for an effective ADM relationship
Talent Strategy
Articulate and live the Aimia culture, set an example by modelling the required behaviours and hold others accountable for their actions by identifying and acting on behaviour which is inconsistent with agreed standards
Support a consistent culture of continuous improvement across all aspects of IT activities.
Essential skills and experience:
Bachelor Degree, with technology or business emphasis
Graduate level training or professional certification preferred (e.g. ITIL foundation certification)
5+ years previous experience in IT with a multi-national background desired with solid process skills and a champion of industry best practices. Particular focus on IT Business Analysis, Service Delivery, and Project Management and functions utilizing a flexible sourcing model.
Business Literate – good commercial understanding and business acumen
Demonstrated ability to work as part of a global technology team and partner with different cultures across a global business
Experience managing and leveraging a shared services function, off-shore centres of an outsourced vendor providing application development and maintenance services
Experience managing internal team resources, consultants, contractors including offshore ADM partners in staff augmentation and project based delivery models.
Experience implementing enterprise business or IT solutions
Preferably experience working in a global technology consultancy
Deep understanding of technology and process implementation methodologies, practices and continuous improvement tools and techniques
Strong written and verbal communication skills and executive presentation experience
Strong problem solving skills
High level planning and organizational skills
High level negotiation and influencing skills
Proven ability to build strong collaborative relationships across organizations
Communication skills with the ability to effectively and simply communicate technical concepts, solutions and implications in a business language.
Proven track record of participating as a member of a business management team and thriving in a team oriented culture
Self-directed and focused on a goal or end-state as opposed to specific tasks
Vendor management experience and skills set
Desired skills and experience:
Experience working in an outsourced delivery and operations support environment in a global multinational organization ideally within the loyalty sector.
Proven ability to deliver complex technology projects in a fast-paced, global environment.
Highly effective communication skills, across all levels of the organization and in multiple channels (formal presentations, informal, technical documentation, social, video, etc.)
Experience in Product lifecycle and/or Agile development best practices is an asset.
Experience in related IT disciplines such as hardware platforms, enterprise software applications, and outsourced systems.
A deep understanding of the interdependent relationship between infrastructure, information security and the applications/services they enable as well as the criticality of maintaining strong connections between the respective teams within IT.
Flexibility to adapt to rapidly changing conditions and priorities
Excellent understanding of multi-disciplinary nature of IT solutions
Ability to see the "big picture" across such areas as private and public hosted infrastructure and services, identity management, security, telecommunications, enterprise storage and big data opportunities, end user experience, and training/education.
Able to manage the accountability of individuals and teams in regards to timelines and quality
Strong analytical, leadership and interpersonal skills
What is success in the role?
Delivery to our commitments to our clients
Successful establishment of outsourcing relationship
High engagement of the broader team
Strong working relationships with business partners
Exhibits AIMIA Passion Values
Delivery of technology solutions and services to meet the Aimia objectives.
Trusted working relationships in place with key business stakeholders
Projects are delivered on-time & on-budget vs agreed integrated project plans with the technology team
Why would you not take the role?
If you are apathetic to multiple parallel initiatives on a day to day basis.
You are not willing to diversify the technology solutions to be supported.
You do not enjoy working with a geographically diverse team.
You are not results orientated.
You do not enjoy working directly with business stakeholders and clients.
Why would you take the role?
You are motivated by the challenges of competing business demands.
You are a change agent and are driven by continuous process improvement to drive positive business results.
You are motivated to support the growth of the business in the Asia Pacific region and be a part of the Aimia global portfolio story.
You enjoy collaborating with a range of stakeholders across the wider business and thrive on establishing effective relationships
You are delivery focused and see success as ensuring projects are delivered on time, within budget and leverage the best of AIMIA’s offering globally.
Reporting To
APAC ADM Director based in Sydney
title: IT Applications Architect

description:
BlackRock helps investors build better financial futures. As a fiduciary to our clients, we provide the investment and technology solutions they need when planning for their most important goals. As of December 31, 2017, the firm managed approximately $6.288 trillion in assets on behalf of investors worldwide. For additional information on BlackRock, please visit www.blackrock.com | Twitter: @blackrock | Blog: www.blackrockblog.com | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/blackrock .

Job Description:
Technology & Operations
BlackRock is one of the world’s preeminent asset management firms and a premier provider of global investment management, risk management and advisory services to institutional, intermediary and individual investors around the world. BlackRock offers a range of solutions — from rigorous fundamental and quantitative active management approaches aimed at maximizing outperformance to highly efficient indexing strategies designed to gain broad exposure to the world’s capital markets. Our clients can access our investment solutions through a variety of product structures, including individual and institutional separate accounts, mutual funds and other pooled investment vehicles, and the industry-leading iShares® ETFs.
Team Overview
Reporting and Distribution Services (RDS) is accountable for all aspects of our clients’ reporting experience, including the provision of market leading reporting solutions and effective client service. Responsibilities include successful delivery of critical functions on a daily basis and partnering with global colleagues to create and advance a globally aligned vision and business model
Role Responsibility
Deliver a superior client experience via front-line client service to clients and related third parties, including fielding and responding to client queries and the creation of accurate and meaningful ad hoc reports
Analyze trends in queries to constantly improve service and client deliverables
Understand flow of client, market and fund information across BlackRock and external data providers
Configure new client deliverables, maximizing the use of existing processes and tools
Facilitate bespoke report creation through analyzing and researching client, market and fund data and related information
Oversee and ensure timely and accurate distribution of all deliverables, proactively communicating potential delays to clients
Constantly evaluate systems, processes and procedures for inefficiencies and make recommendations for improvement
Support various projects, including automation/standardization efforts and the evolution of standard deliverables
Leverage data and feedback to help evolve report content and presentation
Build strong relationships with stakeholders and partners
Inspire colleagues and self to engage and excel in work and career
Embrace a culture of excellence, innovation, communication and accountability, where all members of the team are motivated to go above and beyond, think globally and outside the box
Support process re-design/improvement and systems development
Understand the risk environment within the department – promote risk awareness, assessment and control
Experience
BS/BA in business, finance, accounting, economics, or related field. MBA or CFA welcomed.
Keen interest in investment products with 1-3 years client service within financial services, particularly investment management or data visualization
Outstanding client service skills, maturity and judgment in dealing directly with clientele
Ability to manage change and business process improvement
Highly tuned analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to synthesize information, summarize issues and think outside the box
Sharp control/risk mitigation mentality with high attention to detail and ability to know when to escalate issues
Service provider oversight and/or regulatory reporting experience a plus
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills are essential
Proficiency in Microsoft Office and an aptitude for learning new application
BlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law.

BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

title: Junior Business Analyst (ERP software)

description:
Who we are 

At Criteo, we connect 1.2 billion active shoppers with the things they need and love. Our mission is to create an open, transparent and fair marketing ecosystem. With more than $550 billion in annual commerce sales and 600 terabytes of daily shopper data, we deliver performance at scale. And, with over 30 offices across the world, our company DNA is truly international. Do you want to have an impact on more than half of the world’s internet users? Join us and be part of something big.


Why work for us? 
We are innovative, passionate about big data, fearless, creative, driven, and adaptable. Our core values are at the heart of who we are. We have a spontaneous and vibrant culture, and we truly believe in team spirit and collaboration.


The Global Supply Analytics team at Criteo transform Big Data into Smart data for commercial teams, providing actionable insights and recommendations which help making informed business decisions, to generate more revenue for our clients and for Criteo. Within the fast growing Supply (for Publishers) department and reporting to the Director of Global Supply Analytics, you will manage the dedicated Supply Analytics team based in APAC (Singapore and Tokyo).


What will you be doing ?
Oversee Supply Analytics efforts for the whole APAC region and act as the APAC senior leadership group primary point of contact for all Analytics related topics.
Partner with commercial teams to demonstrate Criteo value to external partners and ensure inventory quality
Contribute to the APAC Supply strategy definition alongside regional leaders and participate to key regional leadership meetings
Elaborate and monitor a set of key KPIs which reflects the APAC Supply pulse of business
Identify main opportunities and threats to our revenue stream and provide clear recommendations to the leadership group
Manage and develop a strong team of analysts sitting in multiple locations
Run/ Contribute to Global projects which aim at optimizing our business performance and cross-team efficiency
Work closely with the entire Criteo Analytics community to better understand and anticipate market trends – and with Product team to provide feedback from the field.

description:
NOTE:Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
Job title: Business Analyst
Reports to: Chief Information Officer
Company information
JERA Trading Ltd. is an energy trading joint venture between majority shareholder JERA Inc. and EDF Trading. Currently, JERA Trading is responsible for providing global coal and freight trading and logistics services to both JERA Inc. and the EDF Group. In the future, the remit of the company is expected to extend to LNG trading.
Department
Information Technology
Relevant context
EDFT is currently providing IT systems capability and associated services to JERAT until April 2021. These services are managed by the terms of Transition Service Agreement (TSA) agreed by both parties. JERAT is now embarking on a programme of work to build out its own system capabilities. This role will be closely aligned to this programme of work.
Position purpose
Provide business and systems analysis across the portfolio of projects to help enhance and support the existing IT landscape and service the business needs.
Work under the leadership and direction of the Chief Information Officer ensuring best industry practise of analysis is applied.
Business analysis and documentation of functional and non-functional requirements for the implementation of vendor and bespoke software and application solutions in line with the demands of the strategic IT roadmap and governance frameworks.
Fulfil the role of ‘Product Owner’ and support the technical development process, advising developers/technical staff on business context and detail.
Provide expertise and support to other IT teams to ensure that our solutions are well considered, re-usable, meet the requirements of our IT strategy and are managed correctly through to successful implementation.
Ensure that robust, comprehensive and realistic system test and cutover plans are defined and executed. Facilitate and support business expert users during User Acceptance Testing.
When required assist with new product configuration and testing and provide systems analysis to help resolve third line support issues.
Experience required
Thorough understanding of full transaction cycle within a multi-commodity energy trading environment is essential for this role.
This is detailed as follows:
Understanding of commodity market fundamentals and physical operations for Coal & Freight and/or Natural Gas/LNG.
Understanding of the full deal life-cycle from order placement through to settlement and invoicing.
Understanding of regulatory reporting obligations.
In addition, an understanding of the following aspects of the deal lifecycle are critical:
Forward curve management (and associated bespoke or vendor software for managing forward curves)
Freight physical deal lifecycle (and experience of working with Softmar or IMOS)
Finance / Treasury processes (and experience of working with Sun and CSL packages) and interface between finance systems and front office systems
Experience of working on a large scale change programme, either a rewrite of an existing ETRM or transition from an existing bespoke ETRM to a vendor product.
Extensive experience in functional analysis, design and implementation of software solutions in transaction and risk management systems working in a large scale trading and risk environment is essential - preferably within an investment banking, commodities trading house, tier one ETRM software solution provider or energy consultancy.
Person specification
Five to ten years’ experience as a Business Analyst or in technical support role with a significant analytical component.
Ability to communicate in a meaningful manner with different levels within the organisation (traders, operations, department heads).
Ability to translate complex business requirements to solid functional specifications, whilst ensuring business context is fully understood. Must be attentive to detail with strong focus on accuracy of information.
Ability to drive change to business practices by working effectively with all levels of users, looking to automate and streamline processes where possible, whilst retaining high levels of operational control.
Ability to work closely with the JERAT Head of Development to help jointly define the optimum solutions.
Must be able to communicate complex functional requirements and designs to technical staff.
Highly motivated to complete projects and ‘go the extra mile’ to meet deadlines.
A very proactive individual able to handle multiple projects/work packages simultaneously – often at different stages of analysis, design or development.
Able to multi-task with minimal supervision and highly structured and organised in the way tasks are approached.
Knowledge of programming & querying languages such as SQL, VBA & Python considered a considerable advantage.
Educated to at least degree level in Maths, Sciences or Business Studies.
Other skills
Relevant and useful qualifications:
International Diploma in Business Analysis (BCS, The Chartered Institute for IT) or equivalent.
Foundation Certificate in IT Service Management
Useful technical skills:
VBA, SQL, Python, XML
Operating Systems: MS DOS, Windows, Linux, Citrix.
Databases: MySql, MS SQL Server, Oracle 11g, Microsoft SSIS, SSRS, SSAS.
Knowledge of the following third party systems:
GV8/Joule (Trayport)
VesselOps (SoftMar)
IMOS (Veson)
Endur/Findur (OpenLink)
Horizon (Allegro)
DatatGenic
SunSystems (Infor)
OnesumX (Wolter Kluwer)
Sun (Infor)
Experience of working with bespoke ETRM products
Hours of work: 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday

title: International Business Analyst

description:
Position: Business Process Analyst


A Business Process Analyst (BPA) is a specialty Business Analyst Role that involves “thinking processes”. BPAs draw inferences from process details and link these inferences to the big picture by considering business objectives in identifying process improvements. A Business Process Analyst typically has the ability to structure a large amount of information within a process framework.


The BPA is:

responsible to consolidates the information from the Business Analysts (BA)
understand the big picture of the process
can explain the Project Owner why decisions are made
how the information will be captured in the system
who is responsible to process the information (user or automation)
The BPA should:

be an experienced leader to lead and guide Business Analysts
have excellent communication skills
drive business sign off meetings
be the bridge to the offshore Design Team
has agile/ DevOps experience
have understanding of SalesForce solutions

The good news for anyone who likes variety at work is that this is a wide-ranging role that can see you immersed in a variety of different projects. In general, you will work with business teams to find the best way to design new processes and solve process-related problems. This will often involve mapping existing processes and designing improved ones. Let´s not forget that the different parts of a company often speak different languages, so one of the tasks of the Business Process Analyst is to interpret business requirements for IT staff. As a BPA, you will often find yourself holding meetings, researching processes, collecting data, analyzing information and performing related tasks. It is generally an office-based job, though it may involve a reasonable amount of travel to meet with end users, observe processes in action and meet the key stakeholders of your project.


Business Process Analysts have knowledge of process mapping and business process reengineering. They analyze business processes and workflows with the objective of finding out how they can be improved or automated. They facilitate process workshops, after which they document any information elicited using process maps and business requirements documents. They may also be involved in documenting procedures and presenting new process designs to stakeholders for discussion.


Work Location: Singapore.


Position: Permanent


Interested applicants, Please send us latest resume in word format at careers@zentactsystems.com
title: Business Process Analyst

description:
We are looking for an experienced Business Analyst to implement and enhance commodity trading and risk management (CTRM) front-office applications in ASIA region, analyze existing processes and enhancement requirements, document gaps and existing functionalities, work with a global implementation project team to facilitate implementations with minimal business impact.
In this position, you would:
Ensure that the system implemented meets business requirements; that users are trained and use the system correctly; and that support is delivered in a pro-active and efficient manner.
You will work as part of the Regional Project Team, interacting closely with the Regional Project Manager, other Business Analysts, and Global IT teams.
Collaborating trading, execution, finance operations to identify, develop, and implement best practices and leading core business processes in order to drive business transformation. This includes activities such as training and communication, developments specifications, process mapping and workflow.
Responsibilities include:
Understanding and documenting current business processes
Conducting gaps analyses between the as-is and to-be processes, identifying gaps with existing system functionalities, reports, and controls
Running workshops to identify current and best-practice procedures
Running training workshops with key stakeholders and end users
Understand system functionalities and be able to recommend solutions and improvements
Document functional specifications and work closely with the Regional + Global teams to facilitate developments
Act as first line support to the business in case of issues during project and second line support post go-live
Contribute to regular project and business meetings, provide progress updates, report issues and risks
Help to develop and manage key stakeholder relationships
Support the PM throughout the project (e.g. defining scope, estimating resource requirements, timelines)
5+ years of experience working as Business Analyst
Commodities trading, inventory or logistics experience is a must.
Direct experience in implementing or working with front office commodity trading & risk management (CTRM) systems is preferred
Good accounting knowledge would be an advantage
Understanding of Project Management methodology and best practices
Good Microsoft Visio and Excel skills
Business Analysis Certification a strong advantage
title: IT Senior Business Analyst

description:
About JLL
We’re JLL. We’re a professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We help organizations around the world achieve their ambitions by owning, occupying and investing in real estate.
We’re a Fortune 500 company. We work across 80 countries, in 280 different offices, with a team of over 77,000 individuals. And we look after a property portfolio of over 4bn square feet, all on behalf of our clients.
If you’re looking to step up your career, JLL is the perfect professional home. At JLL, you’ll have a chance to innovate with the world’s leading businesses, put that expertise into action on landmark projects, and work on game-changing real estate initiatives. You’ll also make long-lasting professional connections through sharing different perspectives, and you’ll be inspired by the best. We’re focused on opportunity and want to help you make the most of yours. Achieve your ambitions – join us at JLL!
We are looking for a Business Analyst APAC.
Business Unit: Project Development Services
Reports to: APAC PDS Business Intelligence Director
Location : Singapore
What this job involves:
You’ll join our Project and Development Services (PDS) business which is on a digital transformation journey. We’re implementing new systems and processes to make things easier, better and faster for our people and our clients. We’re looking for someone to join our team who is passionate about simplifying business processes so that we can harness the full benefit of digitization.
As we implement new technology, we are taking the opportunity to review and optimize our business processes across sales, procurement, finance and project delivery. Workflows, processes, data definitions and business rules will need to be rigorously mapped, documented and shared in a way that is simple to understand, easy to adopt and accessible. That’s where you come in.
Sound like you? To apply you need to be:
Responsibilities:
Document, optimize and continuously improve workflows for end to end business processes relating to sales, finance, procurement and project delivery
Work closely with our users, product owners, business owners and SME’s to gather and document user stories and requirements for new and existing systems ensuring full traceability through to implementation and UAT
Work closely with IT and Operations, develop test cases and support testing to ensure businesses processes are correctly configured and implemented to specification
Build and maintain the critical business data reference for the PDS business. Ensure that the documentation of the critical business data, metrics and supporting business rules is comprehensive, appropriately detailed, and promulgated across the PDS system landscape
Experience:
5+ years’ experience in Construction project management and PMO
3+ years proven experience in business analysis, requirements gathering, process documentation and data governance
Proven experience in transforming traditional processes into digitized environments
Bachelor’s degree required
Experience working across the APAC region preferred
Skills / Competencies:
Personal values that align with JLL’s values of teamwork, ethics, excellence
Passionate about business process optimization and continuous improvement using Lean techniques
A knack for taking complexity and converting it into simplicity
Outstanding English writing and process mapping skills
Attention to detail and a healthy obsession for delivering accurate, high quality output
Excellent listening and analytical skills. Can understand the needs of stakeholders and work with a team to deliver solutions that users describe as “making their job easier”.
What you can expect from us
You will be given a remarkable opportunity to be part of a truly inspiring team that is focused on using data to bring about the best improvements in our business.
You’ll join an entrepreneurial, inclusive culture. One where we succeed together – across the desk and around the globe. Where like-minded people work naturally together to achieve great things.
Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your ambitions in career, recognition, wellbeing, benefits and pay. We’ll offer you a competitive salary and benefits package.
Join us to develop your strengths and enjoy a fulfilling career full of varied experiences. Keep those ambitions in sights and imagine where JLL can take you...
Apply today!

GT Research and Strategy – Credit Research (AVP/VP)

Credit Research advises the Bank’s clients and traders, helping them to stay one step ahead of the market. Their impartial intelligence is key to shaping sales and trading strategies for clients and for our business. Joining the Credit Research team, your role will include:
§ Analyzing market and economic data to produce analysis

§ Collecting and compiling data on both industries and companies

LI-MLee

description:
Functional Area:
OP - Operations
Estimated Travel Percentage (%): No Travel
Relocation Provided: No
AIG Asia Pacific Insurance Pte. Ltd.
Program Description
At AIG, we are constantly working to ensure that all employees have the training and skills they need to have a rewarding and successful career. Designed with that commitment at its core, our Early Career program provides a platform for participants to launch or accelerate their careers. Through a range of approaches including innovative experiential learning and technical training, performance assessments, formalized mentoring, and exposure to senior leaders, our Early Career program offers unparalleled development opportunities for our diverse early career talent. Whether you’re a recent university graduate, someone with less than two years of work experience, or a professional seeking a new career path, the program is designed to evolve with the rapid pace of technological advancements and changing employee preferences to ensure that today’s participants become leaders capable of conquering tomorrow’s challenges.
At the start of the program, you will join the global class of hundreds of Analysts for the initial training in New York where you build your peer network and meet our senior leaders. There will also be opportunities to convene the group during and at the end of the program, providing you with the greatest level of global exposure and peer network.
Department Description
The Business Solutions Group is a dynamic multi-faceted division that partners with all parts of the organization to deliver initiatives and projects ranging from strategic to regulatory and from streamlining business processes to technology implementations where it acts as a center of change and project management excellence.
Job Description
With 2018 focus to automate across the repetitive back-office processes in the Singapore operations (i.e. with Robotic Process Automation), you will be working with stakeholders from the different business and service support functions, thereby being in a key position to gain knowledge of products and business processes related to the organization, i.e. personal insurance, distribution and the other service support areas.
You will be able to hone your negotiation and relationship skills as you engage with the different cadre of stakeholders to scope and document their as-is processes and working with the technology enablers on the to-be processes.
You will also be a champion of efficiency by partnering with the business units on streamlining processes, reduce service issues, mitigate risks and lower costs with technological enablement, i.e. Robotic Process Automation, Artificial Intelligence, Chatbots, etc.
At the end of 2 years you would be a strategic thinker with strong business analysis and planning skills, and with the ability to understand the implications of specific solution across processes, e.g. costs, risk, service , moving into a senior Business Analyst role.
It has been and will continue to be the policy of American International Group, Inc., its subsidiaries and affiliates to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We provide equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender expression, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected categories.
At AIG, we believe that diversity and inclusion are critical to our future and our mission – creating a foundation for a creative workplace that leads to innovation, growth, and profitability. description:
If you could change one thing about travel, what would it be? At Amadeus, you can make that happen!
Travel makes the world a better place and we are fully dedicated to improving it and making it even more rewarding. We are one of the world’s top 15 software companies: we provide technology solutions and services within the travel industry.
Do you have ideas on how to improve travel for everyone? Do you find the idea of working in a diverse, multicultural environment exciting? Are you ready to make an impact across the world? Great, then join us! Let’s shape the future of travel together. #shapethefutureoftravel@Amadeus
The Senior Commercial Business Analyst for Travel Channels, Airline, Airport, Hotel and Rail IT Services.
He/she will support all BUS’s initiatives/engagements with Customers through managing all interactions between Amadeus Global Operations and the BU’s and Customers. Managing the responses to request documents, managing the technical solutioning, positioning SLA’s, providing G-OPS cost inputs and managing contract negotiations with customers.
Support all Business Units in the region
Working with the BUs within the region, support the IT business initiatives with Airlines, Airports, Distribution Partners and Hotels in APAC through the Customer acquisition to Contract signature phases.
Provide support for new contracts, as well as revisions and renewals of contracts.
RFP Management
The Senior Commercial Business Analyst will manage all information requests, e.g. RFPs and other business requests, from customers within the Region and be the focal point of contact for selected BUs and Customers from a TPE perspective.
The Senior Commercial Business Analyst receives requests and performs the initial analysis whence these steps will be triggered:
Identify the input needed to build the response
Plan and control the response development in partnership with the Proposal coordinator to make sure the delivery requirement is met
Briefing staff and if necessary vendors on the requirements
Coordinate with the customer(s) for questions and clarifications
Manage the cost and pricing models for TPE for the response and aligning with the expectations of the BU’s and ultimately our customers
Obtain sign off from senior TPE management for the proposal response
For accepted proposals the Senior Commercial Business Analyst is responsible for negotiating the commercial terms, Service Level and contract with the customer as representative of Global Operations.
For successful sales bids, ensure handover to the project/line organization for implementation
Support Amadeus Core Services
The Senior Commercial Business Analyst is responsible for supporting the marketing and sales groups of Amadeus in the sale of main Amadeus products. The Senior Commercial Business Analyst is responsible for the process during the pre-sales through contract signature phases. It will include these responsibilities:
Providing presentation material
Making presentations of Amadeus infrastructure related subjects to customers in the pre-sales/sales period
Manage and drive technical workshops/discussions as necessary
Manage the Proposal Generation Process as above
Manage the Contract negotiation with Commercial and Legal
Drive New Business opportunities
Identification of new opportunities to increase the existing business or develop new business, which involves defining the opportunity, assessing the opportunity for Amadeus and building a business case for the development of the product or service.
Within the Region, promote and drive the IT infrastructure product opportunities from idea to implementation. In working with BU’s and Marketing build a formidable Value Proposition encompassing the Amadeus traditional and IT product suite with the evolving IT infrastructure products.
Development of General Resource Plans and Budgets
The Senior Commercial Business Analyst is responsible for being aware of the activities in other departments within TPE and other Amadeus group companies.
This information will be used to build an understanding of the ability of TPE to introduce new customers or products within the short and medium term, where this understanding will be formalized into budgets and planning documents.
Requirements
Diploma/Degree level IT qualification
Minimum of 3 years IT Service experience in Travel and Tourism Industry (Airline/GDS) with a focus on IT Business or equivalent
Understanding of IT services marketplace
Understanding of travel IT marketplace a plus
Understanding of e-commerce services issues, understanding of commercial drivers for IT selection
Understanding of competitors offers for IT services a plus
Fluency in English
MS Office
Our diversity commitment: equality, diversity and inclusion are part of who we are. We’re committed to equal opportunities and treatment regardless of age, ethnicity, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation or disability.
