description:
(Job Number: 01U5M)
Do you want to apply your skills, knowledge and energy to implementing ICT and digital solutions that will impact the lives of Singaporeans and the public? In GovTech, you can!

As a Business Analyst - Knowledge Management (KM), you will be working in a Government Agency as a key member of the GovTech project team, comprising the Project Manager, Solution Architect (where applicable) and the Technical Services Consultant, to deliver ICT capabilities to realise Singapore’s vision of a Smart Nation.

What to Expect:
Your primary focus will be on the Functional, Technical and Information management practices aspects of the Knowledge Management (KM) project. In this role, you will work in a project team, in collaboration with Agency users and KM Champions, to:

actively define and analyse the Agency’s Business and Information Management Requirements to derive a KM Framework and Strategy for the Agency
lead and facilitate KM consultancy sessions to elicit the needs of various groups of knowledge workers

drive a smooth deployment, change management, adoption and operations of the solution

work with developers to understand and troubleshoot technical problems, as needed (Operations & Maintenance phase)
undertake root cause analysis to fine tune, processes, governance and ICT-Enabled KM solutions
As a Business Analyst - KM, you are:
pro-active, resourceful and self-motivated to innovate and take smart risks to achieve business goals and customer satisfaction
able to take a broad, strategic perspective as well as drill deep to understand business needs and challenges
able to facilitate discussions/workshops to elicit, manage and prioritise key business needs
a team player with strong influencing and people handling skills
How to succeed:
Degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information/Infocomm Technology, Computer or Electronics Engineering or related discipline
Minimum 5 years of working experience
Past training or experience in developing Enterprise KM Framework and/ or implementing Enterprise Content Management Solutions, Information Governance, Search and Taxonomy/metadata preferred

Working with businesses, head office and regional IT teams, develop technology architecture, production and DR solutions, business systems, end user products roadmap, policies/standards and formulate adoption strategies for the region
Working with head office and regional IT teams, develop solution adoption strategies, and ensure solution adequacy, scalability, data consistency, security compliance and performance
Drive solution or product rationalization and apply standardization appropriately
Drive introduction of new and emerging financial technology tools and services that would enhance the bank service capabilities
Collaborate with application and infrastructure development teams and IT operation team to guide realization of the defined architectures and solutions
Participate in all phases of the SDLC driving architecture solutions and design decisions that result in scalable implementations of the systems
Improve the resiliency, scalability and performance of applications through proper technology design review methodology
Reduce system maintenance cost and complexity thru standardization and simplification
Improve system development project and portfolio management through proper project management methodology
Establish and maintain the list of technology standards approved by Technology Standard Team
Establish and maintain the list of Architectural Guiding Principles to be referenced in system delivery
Define and maintain the target enterprise architecture for APAC
Provide technology and technical know-how guidance to project teams
Requirements:
Recognized university degree or Masters in Information Technology, Computer Science, Manage Information Science or equivalent
At least 8+ years of working experience in Technology domain
Solid understanding of development using technology governance frameworks
Minimum 5+ years/proven track record of Project Management or involvement in SDLC
Strong knowledge in Financial sector technologies, products and services.
Strong Knowledge of IT security, Risk Management and Security Controls
Understanding of MAS, JFSA or APAC countries regulators’ technology risk guidelines or mandates would be valuable.
Deep Knowledge in IT architecture knowledge across various technology infrastructure layers
Experience in corporate governance of IT/IS within the financial industry
Experience in IT architecture, system design and analysis, service oriented architectures (SOA) or message orientated middle-ware/web services
Knowledge of industry technology trendsStrong experience in multi-tiered, distributed application and service architectures
Proven ability to work well in a challenging environment, with ability to multitask whilst delivering high quality solutions
Team oriented and team player, ability to function independently
title: VP (Enterprise Architect), Technology Governance

description:
Commercial Sales Executive
Location: Singapore preferred (consideration for other South East Asia)
Kony is the leading mobile application solutions provider in the industry and provides an integrated mobile application development platform (MADP) to define, design, develop, test, deploy and manage multi-channel applications from a single code base. With Kony, you can deliver stunning user-first experiences, drive Digital Disruption and Transformation and get to market faster to lower Digital TCO.
Our Success speaks for itself! For the 5th year in a row, Kony has been named a “Leader” in the Gartner Magic Quadrant!
A bit about our Culture
Here at Kony, employees are MOBILIZERS. A mobilizer is someone who acts and inspires to build a digital world. Being a mobilizer means that we realize that our impact goes far beyond our job function; from human resources to marketing to product development to engineering to admin and everything in between, everything we do at Kony has a lasting impact on the world. Mobilizers also help connect people. Whether it’s through an HR app, a mobile banking app, or the app that a utilities company uses to connect employees and customers, we’re helping to connect people in an increasingly digital world. Being a mobilizer means you’re so much more than just an employee—it means you’re an integral part of making the digital world a better, more connected place. #IAmAMobilizer
A bit about our Product:
The Kony AppPlatform™ is an open and standards-based, integrated platform for the next generation of mobile app development. Powered by the Kony Nitro Engine, the Kony AppPlatform™ supports the entire application software development lifecycle (SDLC) and enables organizations to go from idea to omni-channel app in just a few weeks.

About the Role:

We are looking to hire exceptional sales talent with expertise in Mobile and Digital solution sales in the Commercial (Non-finance) Sector. Individuals will be responsible for selling into our SEA sub-region.
Responsibilities
Discover new opportunities in a geographic territory for the Commercial (Non-finance) Sector
Execute a sales process that validates and qualifies the technical and business requirements of the customer in order to close the business on a timely basis.
Partner with the Digital Architect Sales Engineering pre- and post-sales organization and Sales management to define the best strategy across both the business and IT to execute sales in the defined territory.
Work closely with the Channel EcoSystem to drive sales and delivery.
Articulate Kony’s value proposition and be familiar with ROI and TCO tools at a business level to provide empirical data to the Business Stakeholders.
Leverage your network, marketing, trade show, and cold call leads to gain access to selling opportunities.
Responsible for attaining annual quota.
Requirements
A Bachelor’s Degree with at least 5 years of successful enterprise software sales experience selling complex IT solutions.
At least 3 years of experience selling into the Commercial (Non-finance) Sector
Ability to call on and develop relationships with C-level executives across the business and IT.
Able to prospect, and conduct account development activities. Must be able and willing to cold call and prospect within their patch.
Experience using an established enterprise software sales process/forecasting
Experience selling Enterprise Mobile solutions is a plus.
title: Commercial Sales Executive

description:
The future is infinitely wide and begging to be reimagined and SapientRazorfish is looking for people who have the courage to make their dent in what has always been. If you have an optimism that says there is no limit to what we can achieve in a time inviting those with vision to shake things up, then we should talk. Our work is fueled by connected thinking, challenging boundaries, and the power of digital redefining a connected world. Our people thrive because of the belief that it's both our privilege and responsibility to usher our clients and the world into what is next. We're seeking those who question the status quo and want to reimagine the way the world works while realizing a smarter way for business to help - all in service of improving the daily lives of people, the world, your career. Next_reimagined.


Job Title:


Senior Manager, Technology (Enterprise Applications)


Job Summary:


The Senior Architect Enterprise Applications has multiple responsibilities including technical management of project teams, architecture and technical design development, providing best practice points of view within your area of expertise and also being the authority for technology development methods and processes. You will guide the architecture, design, user interface, and technology integration of projects, working closely with the client's technology and management teams. Using your expertise on enterprise-wide trends, you will also act as a trusted client and team advisor and realize new business opportunities.


Key Responsibilities:

Work closely with client stakeholders to establish Enterprise Applications & DevOps strategy at a business and technology level, and serve as a trusted advisor
Lead the architecture, design and planning of complex custom software solutions or modifying package solutions
Accumulate market know-how, industry and technology trends, to enhance and manage knowledge on projects
Support vendor evaluation and decisions on technology investments with quantitative and qualitative analysis methods
Ability to manage large architectural systems with large development teams
Work with business stakeholders to provide solutions that deliver to business needs
Consult clients' senior technical leaders on best practice points of view on Next Generation Platforms
Establish and manage high, mid and low level project plans working with a Program Manager
Provide leadership and technical direction for multi-disciplinary, distributed teams of 20+ team members
Lead design, estimation, planning and implementation of IT related business solutions
Prepare sales proposals to represent SapientRazorfish's technical expertise
Deliver compelling presentations to senior internal and client stakeholders
Job Requirements:


We are looking for individuals who can design and implement solutions combining multiple technologies, frameworks and libraries to deliver outcomes that meet business objectives. The ideal candidate will have experience in architecting systems using a number of the listed technologies across the following areas:


Enterprise Application Technologies

HTML5 with rich user experience
MV* architectures such as React, Ember, AngularJS
SOAP and REST based systems
API Management and Documentation (APIGEE, Mulesoft, Swagger.io, I/O Docs)
Node.JS, Netty, AKKA, CEP engines (Streambase, Apama), IMDB's (KDB+), NIO
High scale, highly transactional, high performance, highly available systems and robust applications
Continuous Integration/DevOps Technologies

Puppet, Chef, Ansible, Docker, Urban Deploy
Automated Package Delivery and Build tools such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef, Npm, Gulp, Maven, Gradle
Build management server technologies such as Jenkins, TeamCity, Travis
Docker and other software container technologies
PaaS and Container infrastructure such as Cloud Foundry and Kubernetes
Application deployment orchestration technologies such as UrbanCode deploy
General Requirements

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science (or related field)
Extensive project experience with enterprise architecture, design patterns and implementation of custom developed solutions (and/or product integration projects). TOGAF architect or similar certification a plus
Expert proficiency in Java or .NET, OO Application Development, under UNIX or Windows is required
Expert proficiency working in fully agile product or software delivery teams
Proficiency with designing solutions to take advantage of latest cloud (IaaS/PaaS) offerings (e.g. Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure). Cloud Developer or Architect certification a plus
Experience with designing modern architectures, such as cloud-native and micro-services based solutions
More than 10 years of experience in systems integration and development, package analysis and implementation
Openness to travel and work on client site is essential
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, as well as presentation skills, are essential
Fluent in English
About SapientRazorfish


SapientRazorfish is a new breed of transformation partner designed to help companies reimagine their businesses for the connected world. With more than 12,000 people and 70 offices around the globe, our capabilities span growth and business model strategy, new product and service innovation, customer experience, enterprise digital transformation, IT modernization, Omni-channel commerce, precision marketing, change management, digital operations, digital innovation, data strategy and advanced analytics.


*LI-SNAP

Singapore-Singapore-Singapore

:

title: Senior Manager, Technology (Enterprise Applications)

description:
Hewlett Packard Enterprise is an industry leading technology company that enables customers to go further, faster. With the industry’s most comprehensive portfolio, spanning the cloud to the data center to workplace applications, our technology and services help customers around the world make IT more efficient, more productive and more secure.
Business used to rely on technology, now business is technology , and customer experience is the IT experience. Navigating and harnessing this digital transformation quickly is how to get ahead but it comes with challenges. HPE Pointnext services are designed to help accelerate digital transformation by making Hybrid IT simple and powering the intelligent edge. By leveraging HPE’s strength in infrastructure, partner ecosystems and end-to-end lifecycle experience, solutions are optimized supporting unique business demands.
We are looking for a Business Development and Solution Architect for Hybrid IT Services that encompasses multiple disciplines, including technology architects, solution architects, and enterprise architects. Architects: Are responsible for delivering business value to customers by architecting effective information systems solutions that address the customer’s business problems, needs and opportunities, in a manner consistent with company’s strategic and business goals. Have knowledge of architectural frameworks, methodologies, and tools and understand how to apply this knowledge to successfully deliver customer projects. Establish and maintain a professional working relationship at multiple levels both internally and with the customer by understanding the customer’s business context and their unique situation. Collaborate with both internal and external/industry experts to anticipate customer needs in order to facilitate the definition and development of the solution. Strong supporters of the professional development framework for their profession and use the knowledge and best practice derived from their professional associations to the benefit of their customers. Collaborate with project managers to ensure effective and efficient development, delivery, deployment, operation and support of these IS solutions. Collaborate with the account team to meet or exceed revenue, product, customer satisfaction and market share goals for assigned account(s).
Responsibilities:
Architect custom solutions of project and program or operational scope.
Architect reusable solutions of project or operational scope.
Customize reusable solutions of project and program or operational scope.
Capture and share architectural IP at the project and program level.
Oversee the implementation and governance of architectures of project and program or operational scope.
Contribute to the Architect profession worldwide and across the company businesses.
Develop for client technically feasible long-term IT strategies and plans.
Assess business impact of specific technologies/ strategies.
Identify and address technical or operational risks.
Provide review/input on project activities for medium to large business unit level projects.
Collaborates with the project manager to develop detailed project plans and work breakdown structures for medium to large business unit level projects.
Develop and deliver sales presentations at CEO/Executive Staff/CIO levels for medium to large opportunities
Education and Experience Required:
Industry experience - 7 years to 10 years Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field, or equivalent experience
Minimum 7 years’ experience in Datacenter, Platform and Cloud solutions, of which last 3 years should be in a bid pursuit, presales consulting and solution architecting capacity
Preference will be given to candidates with experience in legacy systems (eg Mainframe) migration solutions
Knowledge and Skills:

Architecting:
Ability to understand the customer's business problem, need, or opportunity and to design an IS solution that appropriately addresses the business problem, need, or opportunity.
Ability to lead a team of two or more consultants in the completion of one or more architecture, requirements, operational, or implementation deliverables.
Ability to lead the architectural design, development, deployment, and technical quality of medium to large business unit level IT based solutions (typically within multiple technology or specialty areas).
Be able to provide architectural direction for multiple medium sized projects concurrently. For larger engagements, a single active project is reasonable.
Understands and applies information system or operational solution related modeling methods and tools.
Can validate/evaluate if an information systems or operational architecture meets technical requirements and specifications.
Familiar with multiple architectural, development and operational methodologies (e.g., Zachman, TOGAF, ITSM).
Applies appropriate methodologies and SME knowledge to resolve complex business issues.

Business Acumen:
Identifies risks and challenges the customer should expect to encounter with the solution based on similar efforts done with other customers.
Develops Architecture Specification deliverables that map customer business requirements into specific technology or operational recommendations.
Ability to apply business management and financial concepts, capital investment, financial modeling, and general aspects of business contracts. Use this knowledge to analyze business needs and develop meaningful system or operational recommendations.
Ability to apply knowledge of how the industry uses IT to address business challenges using, for example, technical standards and infrastructure, cross-industry trends that impact IT investment, industry-specific roadmaps, and IT enablers.

Technical:
Deep IT industry knowledge in Datacenter, Platform and Cloud solutions and services.
Understands future technology or operational trends as they relate to and support customer business requirements ("trusted advisor" role).
Deep knowledge of IT and business standards and best practices in specific areas and how to apply them appropriately in solutions.
Expert or Master level of knowledge of specific technologies, IT operations, or IT disciplines.
Able to design planning for accessibility, scalability, and availability.

Engagement Delivery:
Ability to write Statements of Work for medium to large business unit level solutions that span multiple technologies or operational areas.
Ability to apply program/project management methods and processes to define, plan, cost, resource, track and ensure the accomplishment of targeted goals for medium to large business unit level projects.
Successfully works on project teams (individual success defined by how the organization works as a team, including resource and skill sharing across the organization).

Opportunity Pursuit:
Able to play a leadership role in business development activities for medium to large opportunities.
Lead in identifying, qualifying, and closing medium to large opportunities.
Position the company offering against the competition.
Be able to provide the company with voice of the account.
Play key role in preparing proposals and bids for medium to large opportunities.
Manage internal reviews and contribute to Solution Opportunity Approval and Review (SOAR) process for medium to large opportunities.
Build rapport and trust with client.
Demonstrates excellent consultative, solution selling skills.

Leadership:
Collaborates effectively with the project manager to manage regional medium to large projects as necessary. For architectures of project scope may include the technical management of customer staff assigned to implementation team.
Plays a leading role in the Architect profession at the local level.
Makes consistent and ongoing contributions (at least 2 per year) to the company knowledge systems.
Make formal recommendations to customers to improve the level of job satisfaction for other company employees working on the project.
Can contribute in the development of new company services and modifications to the methodology.
Assists in development and delivery of training.
Coaches and mentors Specialist level architects.
Participates in defining the company unit's processes, standards, and policies.

Consulting:
Build and manage long term strategic relationships at Business Unit leader and CIO, CTO level.
Good customer influence and negotiation skills.
Ability to tactically consider all sides of an issue within the contexts of time, breadth, and range of options.
Ability to systematically gather, assess and apply organizational, technical, operational, and sales/marketing information for business decisions.
Ability to prepare clear, concise, and persuasive communications for multiple audiences, including demonstrating effective writing and presentation skills, listening actively, and projecting a trustable image.
Ability to articulate technical or operational problems or issues into understandable business terms.

Communication:
Able to design and present high-impact messages to customer's senior level management.
Able to use a wide variety of presentation tools to persuasively communicate complex messages to multiple audience levels, including senior level management.
Ability to use prepared and create complete original materials to communicate with the customer. Communicates a mix of Strategic information and Tactical information.
title: Business Development and Services Solution Architect

description:
Job Objectives/Job Summary:
As a Business Development Manager, he/she identifies business opportunities by cultivating and maintaining mutually beneficial business relationships with current and potential clients. He/she promotes company’s services at networking events, trade, etc.
Responsibilities/Duties:
Responsible for own lead generation and appointment setting.
Identify sales lead, pitch services to new clients and maintaining a good working relationship with clients.
Work on tenders for pre-questionnaire and assist in tender submission.
Follow up all leads generated from website, networking sessions, trade fairs and other events/ contacts.
Develop & maintain solid, long-term relationships with prospects (owner’s reps, architects, consultants, interior designers, etc.) Networking to build new relationships and profile TEE where necessary.
Garner market intelligence and feedback to support project teams’ tender process.
To effectively match sales target as set by the Managing Director.
Identify opportunities to increase TEE’s awareness and exposure – presentations / 1-1 meetings.
Identify key growth industries and develop strategic plans that potentially place the company in a niche market in the infrastructure and construction industry.
Perform competitive analysis.
Identify and formulate partnership agreements.
Oversee for overall management of all strategic and operational marketing and customer relationship activities.
Drive increased revenue and profit to achieve the Company`s ambitious growth.
To adopt a professional and knowledgeable approach to each new business call.
Planning and coordinating the implementation of business plans and the penetration of new markets.
Screens potential business deals by analyzing market strategies, deal requirements, potential, and financials; evaluating options; resolving internal priorities.
Adopting both short term and long-term view for the company to achieve and optimal balance between profit and risk through cross regional and cross industrial diversification.
Sending survey forms to garner feedback from clients.
Preparing testimonial letters for clients’ endorsement.
Support in monitoring central emails to ensure communication channels are not broken.
Documentation of information and data.
Filter and monitor general enquires so as to disseminate it to relevant parties i.e. suppliers to procurement, QS etc.
Coordinate meeting appointments between TEE and clients, consultants, vendors, suppliers etc
Maintaining all procurement and government agencies’ e-portals i.e BCA online account, SESAMi, Ariba etc.
Monitoring of public and open tenders (Daily monitoring of public e-procurement portals – GeBiz, SESAMi, Straits Times Notices for relevant tenders).
Circulate tender opportunity to division heads – include key information i.e. site briefing & show round.
Coordinate with division heads on the decision for tender participation.
Involve in the tender process as well and ensure project team meets the submission deadline.
Identify other opportunities for invitation to pre-qualifications.
Involve in the renewal of License / Permits (Coordinate with HR department to update CET forms and documents for technical personnel).
To take note of expiry dates of all certifications, license and permits.
Submission of annual returns and survey forms from BCA.
Maintaining the BDU and Tender Folder in the Server.
Update and maintain DFMA Folder.
Ad-hoc tasks as assigned.
a) Qualifications
Degree in Business or equivalent.
b) Experience
At least 5 years of relevant working experience in construction industry.
c) Skills & Knowledge
Meticulous, detailed, well-organized and able to work independently to meet datelines.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
High level of problem solving skills.
Highly developed organizational and planning skills as well as time management skills.
d) Personal Qualities
Organized and attentive to details with ability to maintain confidentiality of highly-sensitive information.
Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills.
Ability to present professional image of self and the company.
Able to work with people at all levels.
Good Business Sense & communication skills.
Positive attitude, plenty of initiatives and negotiation skills.
Must have a good network.
title: Business Development Manager

description:
Functional area: Business Technology Services

Employment type: Full-time

Job Type: Permanent


Job Responsibilities:
Serve as technical lead to implement Enterprise Web API, Microservices and Data Modelling for the Bank with full capability /accountability for architecture deliverables (process, information, technology etc.) from concept to implementation
Communicate and influence key elements of one or more technology architectures to technical and business audiences
Provide consultation and issue resolution services to IT colleagues for one or more technology architectures, consulting with other architecture leaders as required.
Contributes in group strategic initiatives and decision making at a group level including product architectures and roadmaps
Interface with senior stakeholders including other group architects to drive architectural directions

Identify opportunities to leverage technology synergies to save costs and improve efficiencies

Strong programming fundamentals (Java, JavaScripts, Python)
Experience implementing noSQL databases (Cassandra or MongoDB)
Java 8+/JEE (REST web services, SprintBoot, JDBC, WebLogic/JBoss, performance tuning)
Excellent understanding of enterprise architectures (Micro services, EAI)

Enterprise Service Architecture Platforms (Enterprise Service Bus-ESB, Business Process Management-BPM, Business Process Orchestration-BPEL, Business Activity Monitoring-BAM), Business Rules and Event Management

Mediation (example REST, SOAP, OData, MQ)
Mashups for all types of interactions (Stateless, Session-Based or Persistent State).
People management skills:
Strong, proactive leadership capabilities – inspiring fellowship
Ability to stimulate and participate in creative thinking for out-of-the-box solutions
Resolving and influencing the positive outcome of conflicting objectives and priorities Communication and relationship skills:
Ability to effectively communicate, interact with and influence senior technical associates, business and operational partners and executives
Work effectively within a fast-paced, cohesive architecture team and willing to learn fast and adapt quickly to change
Excellent written (technical) and verbal communication
title: VP, Web API & Microservices Technical Lead / Architect

description:
Atos SE (Societas Europaea) is a leader in digital services with pro forma annual revenue of circa € 12 billion and circa 100,000 employees in 72 countries. Serving a global client base, the Group provides Consulting & Systems Integration services, Managed Services & BPO, Cloud operations, Big Data & Cyber-security solutions, as well as transactional services through Worldline, the European leader in the payments and transactional services industry. With its deep technology expertise and industry knowledge, the Group works with clients across different business sectors: Defense, Financial Services, Health, Manufacturing, Media, Utilities, Public sector, Retail, Telecommunications, and Transportation.
Atos is focused on business technology that powers progress and helps organizations to create their firm of the future. The Group is the Worldwide Information Technology Partner for the Olympic & Paralympic Games and is listed on the Euronext Paris market. Atos operates under the brands Atos, Atos Consulting, Atos Worldgrid, Bull, Canopy, Unify and Worldline.
In this exciting role, you will work as part of the Microsoft Applications team in Singapore and will be responsible for guiding the sales team in providing consultancy services to clients in technical solutioning. The role oversees the selection of technologies and estimate resources required to develop the proposed solution to meet customer’s requirements. In addition, the role is expected to provision client consulting skills, thought leadership and industry best practices in solution architecture, lead opportunity identification, assess current and future state design, and develop system and application roadmaps for the countries.
The successful incumbent will conduct high quality pre-sales presentation and demonstration, perform solution analysis, and prepare winning proposals. You will be expected to develop good working relationships with clients, business partners and other units.
The role
Be the first technical point of engagement for all clients
Be involved with helping clients build solutions to business problems and be an integral part of the requirements gathering process. This allows the practice to help shape the solutions to client problems and also to thoroughly plan for implementing the solution.
Work closely with clients to gain an understanding of their business issues and will contribute to the development of an appropriate solution
Collaborate closely with the team to design, build and deploy the most appropriate solution that will meet the clients’ requirements
Operationally, the Solution Architect will work in partnership with Programme or Project Managers and will be responsible for delivering software development initiatives on time and within budget that satisfy client expectations
Education & Experiences
At least 8 - 10 years of experience in an application design and development role
Min 5 years should be in managing, developing and delivering software solutions in a client facing environment.
Computer science tertiary education qualification preferred
Credentials are preferred in the following areas: Sharepoint, Microsoft .NET Framework, Microsoft SQL Server.
Knowledge in Windows Forms applications and Service Oriented Architecture.
Experience in implementing enterprise scale projects and interface/integration to other enterprise systems.
Experience in executing technical feasibility, proposal development, POC, consulting in complex tender/pre-sales process.
Experience in driving the quality of deliverables in the project.
Excellent verbal and written communication and strong team leader.
Knowledge and Behaviour
Best practice and knowledge of Microsoft applications development framework and thorough understanding of Microsoft Server products and their capabilities, deployment and operation.
Ability to understand complex business environments to recommend proposals for client management decisions.
Sound knowledge of architectural frameworks (e.g. TOGAF, Zachman) and the eTOM business process framework.
Be action orientated with the ability to work quickly and efficiently in a fast moving environment.
Personality – independent, friendly, self-starter, highly motivated, team player.
Excellent client facing skills including facilitating of workshops, presentation and document writing
Ability to create innovative designs, content and accurate documentation
Solid practical experience in software solution development
Sound understanding of Microsoft software development methodologies and languages.
Sound understanding of systems analysis and design, principles and tools
Strong project management, understanding and experience in estimating and project costing techniques.
Solid practical experience in consulting principles combined with the ability to understand complex business environments
Maturity to engage with people in senior positions.
Excellent communication (verbal/written) and networking skills – ability to work with colleagues across a broad range of skills and senior management.
Key Relationships
Microsoft team members Sales Specialists/Sales Consultants/Professional Services/Managed Services/Regional team and countries
Sales Specialists and Sales team
Clients
External suppliers and vendors
Compensation and Benefits
A great incentive to join the Atos team is the market competitive range of benefits that the Company provides.

Your Application
If you wish to apply for this position, please click below to complete our online application form and attach your CV in either Word, rtf or text format.
Atos does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, sex, age, disability or sexual orientation. All recruitment decisions are based solely on qualifications, skills, knowledge and experience and relevant business requirements.
We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to the applications process for people with disabilities.

title: Senior Consultant - K2

description:
To provide engineering leadership for any new or ongoing projects related to the Singapore office.
To provide internal consultancy and be the technical reference point on project and technical related matters
To provide technical advice, analysis and troubleshooting for issue investigation and correction approaches
To maintain good relationships with Company staff, Customer representatives and other stakeholders
To take the lead on technical presentations, discussions and workshops with the customer
To maintain and review engineering and technical documents and work products
To liaise with customers on project requirements and requested variations
To analyse and capture user requirements using requirements management tools
To assist in the production of Solution Architecture and System Architecture documents
To elaborate system and sub-system requirements and develop functional specifications
To develop systems solutions based on functional specifications and system requirements
To ensure project, development, and test teams are remain properly appraised of requirements and system solutions
To assist with the integration of solutions both internal teams and external vendors.
To work directly with Software and Test Engineers in order to deliver and develop solutions.
To ensure that solutions comply with appropriate standards and legislation
Degree in system, software or electrical engineering or related discipline (or equivalent experience)
Post graduate study in Systems Engineering or related area
Project Management certification
At least 10 years of experience in a Systems or Software Engineering role.
At least 5 years of Team Lead/Project Management experience
Ability to interpret technical requirements.
Ability to interface with customers, subcontractors and vendors, and deal with employees and managers at all levels in engineering and other departments.
Lead and manage a team of skilled technical staff, including contractors, offshore, and 3rd party resources
Formal Systems Engineering Experience
Familiarity with Software Development Life Cycles using both Waterfall and Agile approaches
Familiarity with expressing system designs using UML or other modelling language.
Ability to troubleshoot and debug technical issues.
Must be able to solve complex and difficult systems engineering problems.
Experience in project engineering of back office systems with customer facing subsystems
Project engineering experience across full SDLC, with multiple methodologies, including waterfall and agile SDM
Experience as a lead architect/designer in related back office systems
Experience within quality systems, configuration management, release management in technical project management
Experience in engineering and formal testing approaches
Excellent problem solving skills
SQL, Data modeling and system design using formal notations
Experience in dealing at customer interface level
Project co-ordination experience
Experience in a Systems or Software Engineering role within the Automatic Fare Collection industry.
Human factors knowledge and familiarity with HMI considerations
Knowledge of embedded devices and technology, and engineered IT system solutions.
Ticketing and automated fare collection, or similar applications involving large networks of unattended/passenger-operated devices
Familiarity with a variety of operating systems such as windows, linux, etc.
Worked with NFC, contactless smartcards, credit card personalization bureaus, payment systems and retail networks
Familiar with standards such as ISO 27001, PCI
Demonstrated ability to lead, motivate, and mentor senior technical staff
Demonstrated ability to work effectively with other departments within Cubic in order to deliver an overall solution to the Customer. This involves being able to liaise not only with senior management/staff within these other departments, but also key technical and ‘on-the-ground’ staff.
Demonstrated ability to develop good customer relationships
Ability to liaise effectively with Project Managers, technical staff and customer
Ability to communicate well, both verbally and in writing
Dedicated to getting the job done on time and in budget
Ability to travel overseas if required
Demonstrated experience in presenting and managing difficult issues and/or technical negotiation whilst maintaining a positive technical customer relationship and representing company position and interests
Commercially aware and able to protect Cubic’s business interests while striving to deliver superior products and services
Ability to learn and be a system reference expert
title: Engineer System Principal Lead

description:
Backed by Benchmark, Index Ventures, and Sequoia Capital, Confluent is an infrastructure company founded and led by the original authors and thought leaders behind Apache Kafka, one of the most successful open source data projects ever. Confluent’s products let leaders in industries spanning retail, logistics, manufacturing, financial services, technology and media move data from isolated silos into a real-time data nervous system. We believe all businesses will come to be modeled in software and built atop a streaming platform, and we want to put ours at the heart of every company, both on-premises and in the cloud.


Solutions Architects drive customer success by helping them realize business value from the burgeoning flow of realtime data streams in their organizations. In this role you’ll interact directly with our customers to provide software architecture, development and operations expertise, leveraging deep knowledge of best practices in the use of Apache Kafka, the broader Confluent Platform, and complementary systems like Hadoop, Spark, Storm, relational databases, and various NoSQL databases.


Throughout all of these interactions, you’ll build strong relationships with customers, ensure exemplary delivery standards, and have a lot of fun building state-of-the-art streaming data infrastructure alongside colleagues who are widely recognized as leaders in this space.


Promoting Confluent and our amazing team to the community and wider public audience is something we invite all our employees to take part in. This can be in the form of writing blog posts, speaking at meetups and well known industry events about use cases and best practices, or as simple as releasing code.


While Confluent is headquartered in Palo Alto, you can work remotely from any location on the East Coast of the United States as long as you are able to travel to client engagements as needed.


A typical week at Confluent in this role may involve


Preparing for an upcoming engagement, discussing the goals and expectations with the customer and preparing an agenda 
Researching best practices or components required for the engagement 
Delivering an engagement on-site, working with the customer’s architects and developers in a workshop environment 
Producing and delivering the post-engagement report to the customer 
Project work that may involve building tooling for another team, performance testing components for Engineering or improving documentation and knowledge base articles 
Honing your skills, building applications and trying out new features


Culture


Culture is a huge part of Confluent, we’re searching for the best people who not only excel at their role, but also contribute to the health, happiness and growth of the company. Inclusivity and openness are important traits, with regular company wide and team events. Here are some of the personal qualities we’re looking for:


Smart, humble and empathetic 
Hard working, you get things done 
Hungry to learn in a field which is ever evolving 
Adaptable to the myriad of challenges each day can present 
Inquisitive and not afraid to ask all the questions, no matter how basic 
Ready to roll up your sleeves and help others, getting involved in projects where you feel you can add value 
Strive for excellence in your work, your team and the company


Required skills and experience


Excellent technical skills and industry experience are a must, as you’ll be representing Confluent Inc, working with some of the best companies and sharpest minds. Credibility is key, in the knowledge and skills you’ll be calling on and delivering to customers. We don’t expect everyone who joins us to be Kafka experts, but we do want to see some tentpole achievements and skills.


Deep experience designing, building, and operating in-production Big Data, stream processing, and/or enterprise data integration solutions using Apache Kafka 
Exceptional interpersonal communications capabilities demonstrated through a history of successful B2B infrastructure software development projects 
Strong desire to tackle hard technical problems and proven ability do so with little or no direct daily supervision 
Bachelor’s level degree in Computer Science or an engineering, mathematics, or another quantitative field 
Proficiency in Java 
Use of Amazon Web Services for running high throughput systems 
Skilled in operating Linux, you know how to configure, tune and troubleshoot both RedHat & Debian based distributions 
Ability to travel up to 50% of the time to client engagements


Extras


There are always extra skills that can give you an edge, not necessarily just in technology:


Previous experience building solutions that use Apache Kafka alongside Hadoop, relational and NoSQL databases, message queues, and related products 
Scala, Python or Go experience 
Commercial acumen, experience working alongside commercial teams 
Prior experience working for a technology startup 
Project management experience, working with any known methodology and more importantly, being able to scope, manage and deliver on a plan no matter how simple or complex
title: Solutions Architect - EST

description:
The Network Engineer carries out the installation of the LAN/WAN according to agreed service levels, including creating scripts and configuring network servers. He/She allocates and manages network accounts. He/She manages network resources. He/She creates a secure networking environment by monitoring and reporting security breaches and any unauthorised data access. He/She participates in the disaster recovery and contingency plans. He/She monitors network performance for reliability to assure minimum interruption in network service. He/She identifies, analyses and solves network problems to improve levels of service. He/She performs timely recovery of service in event of outages. He/She prepares network traffic reports for the purpose of planning changes in the network.
Working experience in Networking and Network security technoloiges.

CCNP certified with minimum 5 years experience

Working experience in Designing IT Technical solutions

Solid experience of medium-to-high level network design

Working experience in Database Administration (MS SQL, Oracle etc)

Working expereince in Windows / Linus Technologies

Solid experience of server virtualisation

Expert level knowledge of Firewalls and traffic management

Experience of installation, configuration, maintenance and troubleshooting of Windows Server based operating systems

~ Apply the authentication system to network and user according to the system.

~ Configure authentication, authorisation and accounting (AAA) services to support remote access protocols based on security requirements

~ Configure authentication software or tools as required to protect different areas of servers.

~ Define project scope and quality requirements with stakeholders.

~ Develop project budget in accordance with project specifications and organisation’s costing policies.

~ Develop project schedule to guide time management of the project.

~ Enforce backup procedures are maintained according to the backup plan.

~ Enforce network security policies.

~ Execute Business Continuity Planning and Disaster Recovery Planning.

~ Identify key measurement metrics based on business requirements.

~ Manage procurement activities to minimise risks of not meeting project objectives on time and with budget.

~ Monitor and maintain Service Level Agreement with vendors for infrastructure and services provided.

~ Monitor and review service provider performance based on service-level agreements.

~ Monitor project costs.

~ Monitor project progress to identify divergences.

~ Negotiate and confirm the service levels with the service provider.

~ Prepare evaluation report of the service or product and recommend for approval.

~ Report to management on Service Level Agreement performance.

~ Review and finalise contract with relevant parties.

~ Review the authentication system according to the user and enterprise security.
title: Network / Infrastructure Architect and Engineer

description:
Job Summary

This role sets, communicates and activates the short-term and longer-term Asia Pacific Distribution agenda, and is responsible for designing, developing and overseeing the delivery of a world class customer experience, through all the different distribution channels.

The focus of this role transcends business/product lines, as well as across engagement channels such that the delivery of customer experience is consistent, whether the contact is face to face, over the phone, in print or digital formats. You will partner closely with the appropriate business teams to ensure the aspects of the intermediary and end customer segment experience are fully aligned with business strategies.

In addition, you will manage key stakeholder relationships across multiple levels to drive customer centric design thinking into the DNA of our partnerships, bringing meaningful insights and ideas to the table to drive better outcomes for our clients and customers.


Duties and Responsibilities
Develop attractive propositions for the business' current and potential partners across the region through the construction of high-level go to market strategies and plans, assisted by local country heads and distribution teams
Establish and maintain strong relationships with affinity opportunities across the region, with specific focus in Hong Kong and Singapore, creating opportunities for Allied World to compete, and ultimately be successfully appointed
Responsible for tracking campaign performance and reviewing with the Functional leads (Marketing, Product heads and IT) against pitch plans and KPIs, making recommendations for refinement where required.
Architects and delivers the Customer Experience roadmap and scorecard with measurable results by leveraging data, analytics and outcomes of customer journey/design sessions to analyze areas that may be underperforming, and develop a culture of operational excellence and continuous improvement with prioritization and high-level milestones.
Partner across front-facing functions to ensure all appropriate training is created and offered in order to understand, articulate and deliver all components of the intended affinity customer experience
Collaborate with key internal and external stakeholders on broader questions about product, sales, service, claims channels and technology based on customer experience impact.
Performs root cause and impact analysis on recurring customer issues across the region
Establishes and maintains/monitors current customer experience trends and insights across the various disciplines, and any implications for the business based on industry practices.
Monitors competitive intelligence - both traditional and innovative, with the ability to interpret those trends to create future business opportunities, leveraging knowledge of key competitor products and experiences to help differentiate Allied World’s position in the market.
Contribute to the growth and profitability of the company by ensuring high client persistency rates, high client satisfaction, cultivation of profitable win / win client relationships and creating efficiencies in handling and delivering customer experiences.
Ensuring compliance with regulatory and legal requirements
Knowledge, skills and abilities required
Strong proven track record in either local Distribution, Agency, Affinity Partnerships, Proposition or Product Management within General Insurance environment
Expertise in end-to-end campaign management processes and of affinity business
Demonstrated ability in understanding customer touch points and customer journey mapping
Experience leading transformational cross-functional customer initiatives
Ability to synthesize implications of key industry competitive and innovation trends
Excellent communication skills to work with internal and external stakeholders and customers.
Strong strategy development, proposition management, negotiation, interpersonal, and motivational skills
Excellent decision making and problem solving skills


About Allied World:

Allied World Assurance Company Holdings, AG, through its subsidiaries and brand known as Allied World, is a global provider of innovative property, casualty and specialty insurance and reinsurance solutions offering superior client service through a global network of offices and branches. All of Allied World's rated insurance and reinsurance subsidiaries are rated A by A.M. Best Company, A by Standard & Poor's, and A2 by Moody's, and our Lloyd's Syndicate 2232 is rated A+ by Standard & Poor's and AA- by Fitch. Headquartered in Switzerland, and with over 20 offices across North America, Europe and Asia-Pacific, Allied World strives to provide exceptional service and convenience to our clients and distribution partners. We have over 1,400 employees globally, all of whom are focused on providing superior customer service and creative risk solutions, building long-term, mutually beneficial relationships. Allied World is an Equal Opportunities Employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to an individual’s race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, genetic information, or disability status. Please visit www.awac.com for further information on Allied World.

description:
General information

Entity
Crédit Agricole CIB is the Corporate and Investment Banking arm of the Crédit Agricole Group, the world's n°13 bank measured by Tier One Capital (The Banker, July 2017)

Crédit Agricole CIB offers its clients a large range of products and services in capital markets, investment banking, structured finance and corporate banking.

The Corporate and Investment Bank is structured around six major divisions:

• Client Coverage & International Network,

• International Trade & Transaction Banking,

• Global Investment Banking,

• Structured Finance,

• Fixed Income Markets,

• Debt Optimisation and Distribution.

The Bank provides support to clients in large international markets through its network with a presence in major countries in Europe, America, Asia Pacific and the Middle East.

Reference number
2017-20538

Publication date
07/04/2018


Job description
Business type
IT / Project Management


Contract type
Permanent Contract


Management position
No


Job summary
An Expert has a wide spectrum of responsibilities and actions.


As an expert of his/her team, he/she:

• assigns technical tasks and manages delegation for technical issues,

• animates the team to encourage collaboration and sharing of best practices,

• has a role in supporting technical skills development and provides training when required,

• supports new technologies and leverages them to provide consistency of service across streams,

• manages service improvements for all SAN & Backup services supported throughout the organization,

• documents, reviews, maintains and shares relevant technical information to the team

• provides technical direction, supports services both proactively and reactively to maintain the availability and reliability of system infrastructure in accordance to the SLA,

• implements and develops improvements based on LEAN-CA-CIB best practices,

• focuses on automation and optimum use of the team to improve efficiency,

• drives and delivers root cause for any high severity issue,

• reviews technology changes to identify potential risks,

• is responsible for problem management and resolution.


As an experienced professional in SAN & Backup Services, he/she:

• supports his/her team during diagnosis when technical issues rise in his/her scope of expertise,

• is aware of the global IT structure so that he/she anticipates interrelationships within the organization,

• engages with technical peer, Service managers, Architect and project teams on technology roadmap and projects,

• facilitates transformation projects and suggest future directions for new areas of improvement and change,

• guarantees the production readiness and license to operate of new projects and solutions,

• is available and able to drive technically, any complex or high severity incidents that occur within the scope of their role,

• actively engages to understand new technologies and technology trends and reviews them with a view to incorporating them into CACIB operations,

• actively assist in identifying the most technical skilled candidates for open roles,

• technically coach and develop partner resources to improve quality and productivity,

• defines the technical skillset required to support CA-CIB technologies.


As the escalation point of contact for Clients, he/she:

• manages the daily relationship with Clients including planning, requests clarification, risks mitigation and service quality


Job location
Geographical area
Asia, Singapore


City
Singapour


Candidate criteria
Minimal education level
Bachelor Degree / BSc Degree or equivalent


Academic qualification / Speciality
Relevant Engineering Degree


Level of minimal experience
6-10 years


Experience
• Minimum 8-10 years of experience in managing SAN & Backup environment with about 3-5 years of experience in financial institutes


Required skills
• Excellent communication, interpersonal and logical skills

• Customer service oriented and a strong team player

• Ability to work under pressure and a commitment to solving issues


Technical skills required
• Subject matter expert on HP P9500, HP 3PAR, EMC ISILON, Brocade DCX and standard Core/Edge architecture with dual-fabric per site (DWDM links)

• Knowledge and hands on working experience with EMC Networker, HP Storeonce VTL is preferred and hands on experience with Perl/shell scripting is an advantage

• Knowledge and/or hands on working experience with emerging technologies – Cloud IaaS, Hadoop Big Data, Software Defined Storage (SDS) is advantageous
title: SAN &Backup RUN Expert

description:
Join Accenture and help transform leading organizations and communities around the world. The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. Choose Accenture, and make delivering innovative work part of your extraordinary career.

Job Description:

The job of an Oracle Exadata and Big Data Technical Architect includes responsibility for the installation, configuration, upgrading, administration, monitoring, maintenance, and security of databases and/or Hadoop clusters within an Oracle Exadata and/or Oracle Big Data Appliance (BDA) architecture. More specifically, the role includes the development and design of Exadata/ BDA strategies, system monitoring and improving Exadata/BDA performance and capacity, and planning for future expansion requirements. They may also plan, coordinate and implement security measures to safeguard the database/cluster within Exadata/BDA. Basic Qualifications:

Strong interpersonal and communication (both verbal and written) skills
Excellent analytical, troubleshooting and debugging skills
2+ years of experience with Oracle Engineering Systems (Exadata, Big Data Appliance, Exalytics, Exalogic, SuperCluster, etc.) including areas such as:
Oracle Engineered Systems Architecture
Oracle IaaS/PaaS Cloud Architecture (e.g. Exadata CS, Big Data CS)
Cloudera Hadoop (e.g. HDFS, Hive, Impala, HBase) Architecture
Setup and Configuration, Linux System Administration, Scripting
Migration to Engineered Systems and Consolidation
High Availability, MAA and DR: Real Application Clusters & Active Data Guard
Diagnosability, Manageability and Operations
8+ years of Core DBA Skills including areas such as:
Database Architecture Design and PL/SQL
Database Installation, Configuration and Patching including RAC
Database Performance Tuning, Data Warehousing, Big Data and Data Lakes
Data Replication, Database Security, Encryption, Compression and Data Masking/Redaction
Backup and Recovery, DataPump and SQL*Loader
Oracle Enterprise Manager Grid Control & Cloud Control
4+ years of industry experience as an Oracle Database Architect with a strong understanding of infrastructure
8+ years of experience with Oracle databases including hands-on knowledge of Oracle Database solutions
Preferred Skills:

Knowledge of other Database brands is a plus: SQL Server, DB2, MySQL, PostgreSQL
Knowledge of other Cloud vendors is a plus: AWS, GCP, Azure
Knowledge of other Hadoop vendors is a plus: Hortonworks, MapR
Very large databases and in-memory database solutions
Oracle OCP or OCM certification
Oracle GoldenGate
Oracle Spatial and Graph
Oracle R, Python, and general machine learning
Oracle Big Data Discovery and Big Data SQL

title: Oracle Exadata and Big Data Technical Architect Manager

description:
Responsibilities
Conduct presentation and demonstrations on IoT solutions to customers.
Responsible to develop IoT solutions (for various industry verticals) that meet or exceed the customers’ requirements.
Provide expert solution architecture and design skills in areas of people, processes and technologies in line with industry best practices.
Provide technical advice and communicate to the business community (Engagement Managers, Sales Account Managers, Bid Managers etc.) on solution alternatives, corresponding risks and implications.
Identify project risks, plan, organize and manage the deliverable across the Project Lifecycle.
Define the resources and services that are required to propose and deliver the solution architecture and designs.
Regularly communicate with and work with the various stakeholder groups (e.g. Delivery Towers) to ensure the proposed solutions are deliverable and profitable.
Maintain proper records and documentation of solution offerings and negotiated options with the customer.
Conduct proper handover of details of solution offerings to the Delivery team upon winning an opportunity so that they are fully aware of the detail scope to avoid scope creep during the delivery stage.
Participate in design and construction of IoT solution demonstrations and proof-of-concepts.
Keep abreast with new technologies that can complement and/or improve the IoT solutions Participate in developing and maintaining the IoT solution templates (presentation slides, proposals, solution templates, reference architectures, etc.)
Use diplomacy across multiple internal business units to achieve overall pursuit objectives Support the regional Solution Architects in terms of enablement and providing assistance and guidance
Requirements
Degree in IT or related field with minimal five(5) years of architecting experience in two or more areas in Business Intelligence, Application Development, Text Analytics or Statistical Analysis.
Possess strong experiences in IoT or Big Data solutions including designing batch data processing, Big Data analytics, Spark processing, streaming processing, and machine learning analytics.
Familiar with year on year productivity improvements and transition planning.
Knowledge of IT Infrastructure Library and processes.
Certified Data Centre Professional is an advantage.
Knowledge of Cloud ( VMware, Citrix Zen, VCS etc ) is an advantage.
title: Presales Solution Architect (Data Analytics)

description:
Company overview:
Google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers.
The area: Finance
The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.
The role: Deal Governance and Compliance Specialist - Singapore
The Google Compliance team makes sure that our business is always consistent with the current financial regulations. Comprised of master jugglers, this team balances Google's legal and compliance requirements with the dynamic needs of our users and the values of our company. As part of this team, you proactively identify pain points and gaps in existing policy frameworks and find innovative solutions. You develop efficient compliance systems and work with teams to implement these across the organization. You are thorough in all you do and see to it that as Google pursues our next big idea, we always have our bases covered.
Consisting of experienced, creative, driven and savvy high performers, our team provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross-functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives. We enable faster, simpler, and safer business agreements.


On this dynamic team you will harness your business acumen and risk management creativity to craft and implement solutions that optimize execution velocity and risk mitigation. You love data and harness its potential to influence stakeholders to adopt the processes and controls you create. The role provides you with a unique perspective from which to influence Google’s most important customer agreements, and learn from our senior management on how they think and act when reviewing them. You can not only successfully drive cross-finance collaboration to support both finance as well as business-led initiatives, but also those who can implement and continually look to improve existing processes. Every day is a new challenge, and you're continually looking for ways to help our team get better at what we do, in the most efficient way possible. You move fast while keeping your attention to detail, and you tap into your problem-solving skills to support Google's business objectives.
Responsibilities:
Lead cross-functional business and governance projects; define, implement, and maintain processes and procedures to support global sales, finance, product, technical, engineering, and marketing teams
Identify, create, and measure process improvements that automate manual steps, consolidate bespoke processes, and scale with Google’s rapid growth
Manage programs, develop policy, and execute training
Use Google’s big data (and knack for the creative) to architect metrics, solve problems, and affect executive decision making
Influence executives and stakeholders to close gaps in control frameworks and develop scalable solutions
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a Business/Commerce discipline or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant work experience.
Preferred qualifications:
Experience implementing projects, managing programs, designing and implementing processes/controls; Experience working cross-functionally among teams and business groups
Management or strategy consulting experience with an Internet background
Ability to thrive in a demanding, change-oriented, fast-paced environment requiring a high degree of deadline-driven productivity
Excellent ability to take charge, motivate others, set objectives, and drive results. Ability to surface and resolve conflicts diplomatically
Demonstrate exceptional performance in prior roles, with increasing levels of responsibility and independence.
Exceptional analytical skills, combined with impeccable business judgment and ability to communicate effectively with senior management.

Demonstrate exceptional performance in prior roles, with increasing levels of responsibility and independence.
Exceptional analytical skills, combined with impeccable business judgment and ability to communicate effectively with senior management.

description:
(Job Number: 01UKQ)
As a Technical Services Consultant, you will collaborate with a team of business analyst, solution architect, project manager passionate about developing the required ICT capabilities in government to realise Singapore’s vision of a Smart Nation. You will drive the design, deployment and management of ICT infrastructure. Using your extensive technical experience in designing, deploying and managing enterprise level ICT infrastructure, you will collaborate with service providers to design, develop, deploy and configure infrastructure to meet resiliency, availability and data integrity needs.

What to Expect:
Involved in supporting infrastructure architecture, resource planning, infrastructure performance and system hosting environment focusing on Hardware Infrastructure, Operating Systems, Virtualization, Storage and Backup in support of new application systems, including SAP system, at Public Service agencies
Single-point-of-contact for Infrastructure team for all new application system initiatives and to support/assist in application infrastructure architecture design, integration and acceptance and infrastructure performance testing
Manage infrastructure services to support application systems environments by working closely with Applications Service Consultant at Public Service agencies
Handle Infrastructure and Systems standard operating procedures and performs daily performance/availability monitoring
Understand systems operations environment and drive Architecture Review and Governance Process to ensure smooth and sustainable operations (including resiliency requirements)
How to Succeed:
Degree in Computer Science, Computer or Electronics Engineering or Information Technology or equivalent
Minimum 5 years of relevant working experience in designing, deploying and managing enterprise level ICT infrastructure for Application Infrastructure Services
Minimum 3 years of working experience as SAP Basis administrator in configuring, monitoring, upgrade, maintenance and troubleshooting the SAP technical environment, scheduling and executing the SAP transport system, migration of SAP database and application configuration into production, and SAP system health check assessment
Good technical knowledge of application infrastructure technologies as primary practice area, with knowledge in supporting technologies such as infrastructure operations Proactive and dedicated individual with good leadership and multi-tasking capabilities
Good communication skills, both oral and written, with the ability to present ideas and influence stakeholders
Passion and belief in GovTech core values – Agile, Bold and Collaborative

Schedule - Full-time
Employee Status - Permanent

description:
Position Summary:


This position reports to Senior Manager of Production, and will work closely with Enterprise System Architect and Network Support group.

The group manages the technology and applications that drives the manufacturing reporting and operation needs.

The position requires at least 2 years of experience having completed at least 1 software development life cycle.

You must have a working knowledge of relational databases, object-oriented programming in web and client-server concept. You must also be able to rely on experience and judgement to plan and accomplish goals.


All About You


Responsibilities:
Provide technical expertise and recommendations in assessing new IT software projects and initiatives to support and enhance our existing Microsoft based systems.
Identify opportunities that can improve efficiency of business processes.
Investigate and resolve application functionality related issues and provide first level support.
Manage application development for multiple projects.
Assist in application installation and testing.
Troubleshoot technical issues and identify modifications needed in existing applications to meet changing user.
Requirements
Diploma/Degree in Computer Science or related discipline.
Should have at least 2 years technical roles in software development preferably in web.
Good background in C# web development but not restricted to using Microsoft .NET / ASP.NET / MVC / WCF / AJAX. JavaScript / JQuery client-side scripting and Bootstrap / JQuery UI for components and styling.
Database design in Microsoft SQL with ability to write and optimized queries or stored procedures.
Experience with Version Management tool such as Microsoft Visual SourceSafe.
Ability to develop mobile apps for phones / tablets would be advantageous.
Knowledge of data processing, hardware platform and enterprise software applications.
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively as part of a highly-skilled team.
Excellent communication skills possess logical and analytical skills with attention to detail.
Education
Diploma/Degree in Computer Science or related discipline.
Passion in software development and keen in writing or debugging software codes.
Willing to learn and adopt coding practice to ensure system sustainability.
Have done coding with .Net Framework using C#, would be desirable.
Understand database schemas and design, ability to write queries or stored procedures, preferably with MS SQL.
Experience in developing mobile apps for mobile devices would be advantageous.
Excellent communication skills possess logical and analytical skills with attention to detail.
Candidates with no experience may be considered.
