description:
Serve as primary source of data insights supporting internal and external constituencies
Analyse and translate data findings into meaningful, actionable insights – including synthesizing relevant insights from different customer touch points and data sources
Lead, design and implement quantitative analytical frameworks, including scalable predictive models, customer segmentation and marketing mix optimization that improve business performance and customer engagement
Institute and adopt best practices in data science, platforms and approaches.
Establish internal organisational standards and benchmarks
Work with other teams in Mediacorp to understand business needs, document data and data integration requirements, and resolve conflicting business/data architecture rules. Ensure compliance with internal customer contact governance policies and drive closed-loop measurement through smart data capture.
Become an internal authority on Mediacorp’s data tools and resources. Function as a power user of data analytics to guide other business users.
Support ad-hoc business intelligence and other strategic initiatives
PhD or MS degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Machine Learning, Operations Research, CS, Econometrics or related field.
Minimum 5 years hands-on experience in data science.
Demonstrated expertise in developing and implementing a full range of analytical techniques to address commercial challenges. Proficiency in at least one statistical analysis tool such as R or Weka.
Demonstrated experience with distributed databases and query languages. Proficiency in at least one programming language (preferably Java, C++, Python, or Perl).
Must possess exceptional business judgment to identify core business objectives; synthesize and interpret disparate quantitative information, develop meaningful insights and clearly disseminate to key stakeholders
Strong project management and time management skills. Able to lead data initiative independently with minimal supervision.
Relevant experience in web, video, mobile or adtech domain is a plus.
title: Lead / Senior Data Engineer / Architect

description:
Are you someone who can solve challenging problems? You don’t just know coding, more importantly you know how to tackle problems innovatively. Programming language is merely a tool for you, making an impact is your real goal.


ReFUEL4 uses data-driven and AI-centric approaches to disrupt the way advertising used to be done. We are not an advertising agency. Instead, we help advertisers remove their reliance on agencies and achieve greater performance while spending less time on managing campaigns.


ReFUEL4’s DATA team is not made up of your typical software engineers. We are a team of people with diverse skill sets including deep learning, software engineering, computer vision, DevOps, statistics, and data engineering, and analytics. With core R&D of the company being the team's main responsibility, we do not limit your job scope, or, your potential. The only limit you may have is yourself.


You will start off by perfecting one of our core product offerings by renovating data pipelines on top of Google cloud platform alongside with experienced lead architects. Furthermore, you will also be tasked on meaningful and diverse projects requiring skills you don't necessarily possess, such as G﻿UI-based Windows/Mac application development.


Join us if you know what you have been doing.


Close your browser if you have hesitated.


Initial Responsibilities

Self-management.
Perfect data processing pipelines.
Collaborate well with your fellow teammates.
Experience in Python, C++, data structures, algorithms, and data analytics
Knowledge of threading, memory management, coding principles, and BigData technologies
Flexible, problem solving, and analytical mindset
Master's degree or above in relevant disciplines
Knowledge in any of the followings would be a plus:
Google Cloud Platform, Scala, BigQuery, Dataflow, Airflow, image processing, computer vision
title: Data Engineer

description:
What makes us Qlik
We’re motivated to help people make discoveries in data, share insights, make decisions and act with confidence. Making a difference, both in small and large ways, is our passion.
At the heart of Qlik is our Swedish soul, which guides everything from our culture and product design approach to our corporate social responsibility program. It’s what drives us to create a culture of innovation.
We believe data can change the world. And we believe people can, too
The Consulting Organisation
Qlik Services are all about accelerating the success of our customers, partners and employees. We provide the training, support and consulting needed to successfully develop, deploy and use Qlik.

How you will spend your time as our next Implementation Consultant in Singapore
Your role as Senior Implementation Consultant is about being the client’s advisor and foremost developer of Qlik’s visual analytics and master of User Interface, ergonomics, and best practices.
You’ll connect Customer’s data and create actionable Qlik Sense and QlikView reports/dashboards for end users to rely on for their day to day business decisions. Your technical and analytical expertise will nurture customers to drive adoption and repeat purchases.
Note: Qlik Consulting has specialized roles and separates implementation of Qlik applications and creation of dashboard visualizations from Server Platform and Infrastructure Configuration. The other role is Technical Architect which will work hand in hand with Implementation Consultants on the scalability of the platform.
Analyze customer requirements and develop proposals for technical solutions.
Provide onsite implementation consulting and professional services for Qlik Sense and QlikView implementations, potentially for multiple simultaneous customers and projects.
Maintain detailed knowledge of current and upcoming future product features and capabilities as well as knowledge of common customer applications and derived benefits.
Drive all aspects of successful implementations from requirements and design to mentoring and delivery.
Conduct kickoff meetings, document solutions and provide knowledge transfer.
Perform database analysis and data modelling. Build Qlik Sense and QlikView applications.
Perform software installation and configuration.
Development and testing of data extract scripts. Data validation & assistance with UAT (user acceptance testing).
Work within customer schedules whilst meeting QlikTech’s high standards for quality and professionalism.
Manage the balance between customer demands and expectations while considering overall priorities.
You will be successful if you are
Deep knowledge and experience with a range of Business Intelligence tools.
Deep knowledge in Relational Database systems and data modeling, SQL preferably from DBA related work.
Deep Knowledge of Extract, Transformation and Load (ETL) tools.
Experience building HTML5 based apps with complex JavaScript/AJAX interaction with web services is helpful.
Knowledge of enterprise systems, CRM, SFA, and ERP (e.g. Salesforce.com, Oracle, SAP R/3).
Knowledge of web software/development such as JavaScript, ASP, AJAX, Apache and Web Services.
Programming skills in C#/C++/VBA/JAVASCRIPT/HTML/CSS/JSON or other scripting languages.
Familiarity Web-based application development, including asp and IIS server platforms.
Advantageous to have basic understanding of Web application security and concepts, such as Ticketing, header injection, XSS, SSL, HTTPS, Kerberos, certificates, Active Directory, and LDAP. Knowledge of extranet architectures such as DMZ, Firewalls, Ports, Vlans and Reverse proxies. Demonstrated abilities with SSO-related software such as ADFS, SiteMinder, OpenSSO, and SAML.
You will thrive if you are
5 years or more experience of software implementation. Preferably a year or more of hands-on experience with Qlik Products, preferably including Qlik Sense and Server/Publisher and Management Console. Qlik implementation or competitor deployment experience highly advantageous.
A passion for Business Discovery and Business Intelligence solutions 5+ years of experience in BI Software Industry preferred.
Hands-on experience with relational databases and data modeling
Experience in establishing Server (Clusters) and Publisher across environments (development, test, acceptance and production).
Experienced in conducting architecture reviews and provide recommended improvements.
Experience developing multi-tiered enterprise QlikView or Qlik Sense applications.
Strong BI background with ability to solve problems in a BI environment
Our way of giving back
To our communities, to the world, and to you is a core part of the culture at Qlik. We encourage our employees to participate in our numerous Corporate Responsibility Program initiatives.
Location/Mobility
The role is located in Singapore. If you think this position is interesting, you are welcome with your complete application in English. Apply as soon as possible as we are working continuously with the applications for this assignment.

Qlik is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Qlik via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Qlik. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Qlik as a result of the referral or through other means.LI-MP
title: Senior Implementation Consultant, ASEAN

description:
The Global Solutions Architect (GSA) will provide technical, customer-facing pre-sales consulting, post-sales technical guidance, and hands-on assistance to a small group of target accounts. This is an exciting role within our organization leveraging your deep enterprise expertise to help account teams be even more successful in strategic Nutanix accounts.
The GSA must be a highly organized, thorough and motivated professional that understands the importance of being a strong team player and leader when it comes to forging a solution and liaising with customers. In addition to assisting sales and delivery teams with advanced architecture designs and services, the GSA will also be a key field partner for Nutanix engineering. Your knowledge and experience will be leveraged as a part of continuous feedback loop to drive architectural best practices and tooling required to increase adoption, retention and overall customer experience.
Key responsibilities of the GSA include:
Articulate the features and benefits of Nutanix solutions and products.
Understand the customer's business drivers and how to map these to a Nutanix solution.
Provide technical leadership in the Requirements Discovery, Solution Development, Solution Proposal, and delivery stages of the sales cycle.
Act as interface to Product Management to monitoring and manage feature requests and product roadmap issues to conclusion, including any required management escalations required to resolve related issues.
Act as interface to the Solutions and Performance team to manage application performance testing, provide Nutanix and application best practices, and assist with customer-required ISV certifications.
Gather requirements, constraints, assumptions, and risks for new Nutanix deployments and author expert-level enterprise architecture documentation packages.
GSAs are assigned a limited number of dedicated and geographically disperse G2K accounts, where the candidate will be a trusted advisor for all technical matters.
Able to help create custom engineered solutions and systems as and when required for a large scale opportunity.
Working with existing account teams, SEs, and global SEs to provide 360-degree technical coverage of G2K accounts.
Assist the Customer with financial (ROI, TCO) and business value modeling of their Nutanix based solution offerings.
Develop and maintain technical and business expertise of cloud industry directions and trends.
The Candidate
The Global Solutions Architect candidate should have proven customer facing skills at both the C-level and line management level. Candidates should be technically strong enough to establish credibility with technical leaders in Global Accounts. Working in tandem with the Nutanix sales teams requires the candidate to have knowledge and experience in sales methodologies and a keen focus on driving positive business outcomes. The Global Solution architect should also have the following:
10+ years experience in a customer facing technical role
Deep enterprise-level architecture expertise or certification (e.g. Nutanix NPX, VMware VCDX, TOGAF etc.)
Technical expertise with virtualization technologies, data center consolidation, and/or server technologies is required
Strong writing skills, including previous experience with delivering comprehensive enterprise architecture documentation packages
Hands-on, and does what it takes attitude to drive success
Strong consulting soft skills and tactful conflict management skills.
Ability to uncover business challenges and develop a custom solution to solve those challenges.
Must be effective in working both independently and in a team setting with other high performing technical architects.
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate professionally with customers, and internal cross-functional teams including Sales and Engineering
A structured thinker with strong presentation and problem solving skills
Ability to manage multiple projects, determine project urgency and execute detailed action plans with minimal oversight
Highest level of personal and professional ethics and integrity.
One or more desired: Enterprise application experience (e.g. SQL, Oracle, Exchange), DevOps, Automation, Nutanix Calm
Ability to travel globally 50-75% of the time
Has the willingness and drive to obtain the Nutanix NPX certification
Direct experience designing and deploying production level large scale integration deployments.
Experienced and credible C-suite advisor with strong customer-facing and relationship-building skills.
Ability to see and present "the big picture" through strong listening and question-based selling skills.
title: Global Solutions Architect

description:
Work on analysis of health care information obtained various source systems.
Provide input to the development, maintenance and promulgation of the blue prints, roadmaps and reference architectures for Data Analytics infrastructure and services.
Perform analysis of new requirements and develop solutions, and manage solution delivery through acquisition or change control
Revise existing design specifications and development of new specifications
Manage the development of queries to satisfy functional requirements
Manage the development of analytical artefacts, including dashboards, reports and graphs as required.
Provide advice on high-level Business Intelligence, Data warehouse or Advanced Analytics solution designs.
Evaluate technologies/services, providing regular reporting on emerging trends, value add information and potential impact to the healthcare landscape.
Proactively achieve the IT strategic, broader business and IT objectives through influencing stakeholder outcomes.
Assist in vendor management to ensure contracted vendors deliver solutions that is architecturally sustainable and scalable


Requirements

Degree/Master in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering or equivalent.
Five years’ experience in providing data warehouse or advanced analytics solutions.
Experience with databases (e.g. Oracle, DB2, MS SQL, MySQL, Teradata, Greenplum)
Data repository design (e.g. operational data stores, dimensional data stores, data marts)
Data interrogation techniques (e.g. SQL, NoSQL)
Structured and unstructured data analytics
Statistical computing programming language (e.g. R)
Data quality tools and processes.
Data transformation and terminology equivalence mapping.
Experience in data modelling for analytics (e.g. star schemas, snowflake schemas).
Experience with data acquisition tools (e.g., ETL, real-time data capture, and change data capture).
Comfortable working independently to carry out data analysis, estimate data quality and sufficiency. Understanding and analysing huge volumes of data drawn from heterogeneous sources / repositories.
Exposure to the development, evolution and adherence to the architectures relevant to the domain.
Experience with Business Intelligence Tools (e.g. SAS, SPSS, Cognos, Microstrategy, Microsoft analysis services, Business Objects).
Ability to work with a wide variety of report generation software (e.g. SSRS, Crystal reports) and generate a wide variety of outputs (dashboards, scheduled reports).


Please contact Shan Chee (Reg No. R1770657) at Evolution Recruitment Solutions Pte Ltd (Licence no. 16S8383)

title: Business Analyst

description:
Overview
Welcome to Allscripts! Our Mission is to be the most trusted provider of innovative solutions that empower all stakeholders across the healthcare continuum to deliver world class outcomes. Our Vision is a Connected Community of Health that spans continents and borders. With the largest community of clients in healthcare, Allscripts is able to deliver an integrated platform of clinical, financial, connectivity and information solutions to facilitate enhanced collaboration and exchange of critical patient information.
The primary purpose of this role is to deliver expert level guidance/recommendations, high quality and high performing solution and/or training to meet customers’ business needs based on Allscripts product set.
Responsibilities
Domain Expertise
Expert level and comprehensive working knowledge of Allscripts solution sets including cross-product integrations.
Expert level and comprehensive working knowledge and understanding of healthcare operational processes and job functions pertaining to assigned Allscripts market segments and solutions
Expert level and comprehensive knowledge of Allscripts methodology
Expert knowledge of third party relationships and partnerships which may be recommended as part of solution set proposals to customers and prospects
Expert knowledge of Allscripts service offerings to support solution design and development for clients and prospects
Expert knowledge of industry trends and initiatives and creatively maximizing the Allscripts solutions and services to support these trends and initiatives; demonstrate initiative in creating/authoring solutions to meet client and market needs
Customer Business Solution Requirements
Expert skills in facilitating client facing and remote solution design programs for the development and delivery of complex multi-product implementations.
Liaise with the clients to align people, process and technology to transform the delivery of healthcare, maximize the return on investment
Liaise with the clients to analyze, determine and document the customer’s business requirements; thereby allowing Allscripts to make recommendations, provide advice & guidance and also challenge our clients in order to help them find a solution to their business needs
Move/Empower clients beyond basic solution usage to become advanced users of Allscripts solutions and services
Identify clients barriers to success and provide strategic, operational, and tactical methods of execution to eliminate the barriers
Product Mapping to clients business requirements
Identify product and customization requirements to effectively address customer product configuration, while working within project scope and time line.
Advice consulting team regarding configuration to meet product and customization requirements as needed.
Identify solution gaps and help Allscripts to specify and develop global complex solutions which will add value to the clients business
Collaborate on design and implementation of cross-product integrations (data and workflow) including acute to ambulatory solution integrations
Advise clients on how to effectively solve business issues by using Allscripts products
Solution Implementation to meet requirements as specified in the project plan
Unparalleled knowledge and execution of Allscripts deployment methodology which includes formalizing project goals, objectives, solutions/products, timelines, resource needs, and services to support the implementation and rollout of Allscripts solutions for both net new customers and existing customers.
Serve as the application lead on the project during the design and implementation of Allscripts applications and designated 3rd party products on assigned customer projects
Lead, coach, and mentor project team; particularly the Implementation Consultant(s) during the system design, build, and configuration.
Provide support to the project team in analyzing, resolving, and escalating complex integration problems encountered by the team during the implementation of Allscripts products.
Lead, coach, and mentor the project team during the testing and go live phases
Work with Allscripts management team to control the scope of the project and identify and quantify the work effort for out of scope requests
Solution Consulting
Collaborate as necessary with management consulting team to execute services to provide:
Current state reviews, future state recommendations, gap analysis, and remediation plans for gaps across the dimensions of people, process and technology and includes measurements and report outs to industry benchmarks
Consultative services which leverage knowledge in industry relevant incentive programs to provide financial (or other benefits) to our customers and the patients they serve
Sales Support
Close collaboration with sales leadership and executives (new and add on/inside) in architecting and delivering comprehensive strategic plans and proposals to customers and prospects
Present seminars, webinars or workshops promoting complex applications of Allscripts solutions and services in forums such as ACE, Executive Summits and other industry related speaking
Best Practices Capture and Adoption
Leverage repeatable models and tools to streamline the design/deployment of Allscripts solutions
Capture and provide feedback on deployment best practices
Capture and share with solutions management and product development emerging/new customer requirements to improve feature, functionality, and market readiness of Allscripts solutionsLI-KH1
Qualifications
Academic and professional qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent Healthcare Industry experience
Experience:
Minimum 10+ years related work experience
Minimum 7-10 years internal Allscripts experience
2+ years Allscripts Architect level preferred
Demonstrated expertise in multi-product integrations
Strong working knowledge of healthcare regulatory requirements
Allscripts Sunrise experience is a must*
Strong technical knowledge
Familiar interfacing with third party solutions (e.g. lab, SAP, etc)
Strong understanding of clinical aspect
Travel requirements:
Ability to travel occasionally as warranted by project work; frequency will vary depending on project requirements
Working arrangements:
Monday through Friday or as defined by assignment requirements
Primarily works in standard office environment or remotely
At Allscripts, our greatest strength comes from bringing together talented people with diverse perspectives to support the technology needs of 180,000 physicians, 1,500 hospitals and 10,000 post-acute organizations across the globe. Allscripts offers a competitive total rewards package, including holidays, vacation, and medical, disability and life insurance.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. No job applicant or employee shall receive less favorable treatment or be disadvantaged because of their gender, marital or family status, color, race, ethnic origin, religion, disability or age; nor be subject to less favorable treatment or be disadvantaged on any other basis prohibited by applicable law.

description:
Senior System Specialist (Wintel Team Lead) - (170001MJ)
Description

About OCBC

Having purpose and making a real impact drives what we do at OCBC, for our customers, colleagues and the community. People count on us to deliver an amazing banking experience, but more importantly one that is uncomplicated and complements their changing lifestyle and business needs. Our employees are the architects that make this all possible; they are high performing individuals and teams, experts in their field and above all believe in our purpose and commitment to customers.

Our community of game changers at OCBC builds for the future; think Ambitious goals, act with a strong Belief and execute with Courage and agility to drive impact. These ABCs sit at the centre of our culture of change and innovation. Be a Senior System Specialist (Wintel Team Lead) at OCBC, and join our community of game changers.
What you'll do:

The Wintel Team Lead is to act as an escalation point for all technical issues; the Wintel Team Lead is required to take ownership of issues through to resolution. Working closely with team members, the role encompasses all areas of Infrastructure. Ensuring other team members are involved and skilled in more technical areas, the Specialist is also expected to provide excellent communication and customer service to all areas of the business.

Collaborate and work with the team to develop technical solutions, plans and configuration, in response to requirements from Business and Application teams. Deliver to the deployment team for execution.

Establish configuration standard and design guideline for Windows and system software, covering availability, performance, resilience, monitoring, backup and recovery functional areas.

Provide technical assistance to development team and operation teams.

Troubleshoot and drive system recovery. Escalate problems with actual or potential major impact to problem management. Perform root cause analysis and ensure planned actions are carried out to prevent recurrence. Must be proactive and possess a sense of urgency during service recovery.

Lead and control the delivery of system & resident engineer.

Ensure the supportability of the OS and system software. Plan and lead upgrade projects.

Review and approve change requests. Supervise execution for major change.

Conduct performance analysis, tuning, automate system operation, capacity planning & performance management.

Track and drive patch management & software upgrades to ensure continuous supportability.

Manage backup and recovery & conduct asset management.

Design and control access plans and matrix for infrastructure services and support personnel. Perform regular access review and validation.

Establish adequate monitoring to ensure efficient and reliable service delivery.

Apply new technology and process to improve system supportability, recoverability, availability and performance.

Provide operational excellence and skills on OS and system software support.

Provide technical guidance and mentoring to help develop less experienced engineers.

Support audit and compliance activities.

Qualifications

What you bring:

Minimum 5 years system support experience on Windows platform.
Hands -on experience on VMWare, Office365 & cloud-based platforms.
Worked in a leadership role for minimum 3 years.
Regional experience is preferred.
Possess good technical knowledge in implementing, troubleshoot, performance tuning of Windows hardware, operating system and system services.
Data communication, network knowledge & Information security knowledge is an added advantage.
Experience in middleware and application execution in the LINUX environment is an added advantage.

description:

Role:
Architect and design custom solutions for clients based on our products, including software modules and deployment architecture, for both cloud or on-premise installations.

Design general and holistic architecture for our suite of products, focusing on modularity, easy integration and re-usability.

Lead on defining and applying architecture standards and practices affecting development of new and existing projects.

Provide technical direction on the development team.

Research new technologies, including hands-on technical evaluation and POCs.

Collaborate closely with product management and tech leads in determining best solutions and aligning technical architecture to product features and roadmaps.

Interface with clients and stakeholders and facilitate communication to ensure successful project execution.

Estimate and assess effort for implementation of solutions and features.

Required

8+ years of experience in software architecture or development.

MSc or BA/BSc in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical discipline (or equivalent), preferred.

Proven track record of successful software products building and delivery.

Sound experience in Java-based enterprise software architecture.

Expertise on architectural design patterns.

Knowledge on microservice / SOA architectures and concepts, such as discovery, orchestration, configuration and messaging.

Command about networking, security, reliability and performance aspects.

Preferred

Skills on Unix/Linux administration.

Knowledge of container-based deployment, e.g. Docker, Kubernetes.

Experience with Agile development methodologies.

description:
The Head of Communications & Analyst Relations, APAC is responsible for developing and leading NetApp’s communications strategy and execution. He or she supports executive leadership as a communications advisor and strategist, working directly with supporting public relations, analyst relations, community relations, investor relations, event strategy, and corporate brand strategy functions.
Key Leadership Attributes:
Essential Functions:
• Develop coordinated, enterprise-wide corporate communications strategy
• Set measurable objectives for the communications function
• Oversee communications measurement, including the design and operation of relevant dashboards and reports
• Support internal communications/internal marketing/ change management through strategy and resource allocation
• Oversee the selection of agencies and manage these critical relationships
• Lead corporate media/public relations and analyst/ influencer relations efforts, and act as centralized resource for product or regional functions
• Curate, architect and promulgate centralized corporate content
• Coordinate corporate/community affairs functions
• Implement protocols and best practices in anticipation of crisis management
• Implement key communications policies, protocols and guidelines
• Work with social operations to develop corporate social media strategy and governance
• Manage the analyst briefing process
• Track analyst coverage in both traditional and social media
• Build an engagement framework that tiers both traditional and social influencers by their level of importance within a marketplace
Organization Interlock:
• Executive leadership
• Global/integrated marketing, demand center
• Product marketing
Technologies supporting the role:
• Social media platform/tools
• Traditional media monitoring tools
• Social media monitoring tools
• Sales content portal
• Graphic design tools
Success Metrics:
• Media reach
• Media frequency
• Number of impressions
• Coverage accuracy
• Share of voice
• Customer/prospect sentiment, awareness, engagement
• Paid vs. earned media placement
• Social media impact (network growth, share of voice, sentiment, influence)
• Impact of outbound communications efforts on subsequent demand creation efforts (both inbound and outbound)
• Sales adoption of enablement materials
• Influencer network growth
• Interaction frequency, responsiveness and reference quality
• Sales utilization/feedback of customer marketing programs/offers
• Advocacy/reference participation
Skills Competencies:
• Project management
• Strong written/oral communications
• Messaging and positioning
• Social media
• Able to synthesize, analyze and summarize data
• Budget management
• Global perspective
Education and Experience Requirements:
• 10 or more years in corporate communications or related experience
• Hands-on corporate public relations experience, ideally within the same or similar industry
• Implementation and management of global brand guidelines
• Management of communications to multiple complex stakeholder groups at a local, regional, national and international scale
• Selection and oversight of traditional and social communications agencies
• Management of budget and resource allocation to support success and efficiency
• Previous demonstrated linkage of communications efforts to an organization’s broader campaign plan
• Previous demonstrated crisis management/avoidance
• Knowledge of Social media tools and sites, Media monitoring best practices, Survey/interview question development best practices, Analyst and vendor briefing best practices, Coaching and Budget allocation principle
• An individual who is,
o Creative
o Detail-oriented
o Collaborative
o Strong relationship builder
o Can thrive in a matrixed organization
o Comfortable interacting with senior executives
o Adaptable; can manage multiple projects at once
• Bachelor’s Degree required. MBA or Master’s degree preferred
• Additional certificates will be an added advantage
title: Head of Communications & Analyst Relations

description:
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers and software infrastructure. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.


Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life.


Responsibilities
Interact with sales/partner leads and technical stakeholders to translate complex customer requirements into recommendations for appropriate solution architectures.
Work with customer technical teams, client executives, and partners to manage and deliver successful migrations to cloud solutions.
Work with channel partners, systems integrators and third-party developers to deliver successful solutions.
Package best practices and 'lessons learned' into thought leadership, methodologies and published assets.
Understand customer needs and help shape Google’s long term product strategy. Act as an advocate for Google’s “product innovation story”.

Qualifications
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a technical or engineering field (e.g. Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, etc) or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of relevant work experience, with 3 years of experience in building Big Data solutions. Experience with computing infrastructure, including virtualization, hosted services, multi-tenant cloud infrastructures, storage systems and content delivery networks.
Experience in reading software code in one or more languages, such as Java, JavaScript or Python. Experience with designing or developing cloud-based solutions, and in deploying web-based geospatial applications.
Ability to travel, both domestically and internationally, up to 40% of the time, as required.

Preferred qualifications:
BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related software engineering field.
Hands-on experience in big data, information retrieval, data mining or machine learning, as well as experiences in building multi-tier high availability applications with modern web technologies (e.g. NoSQL, MongoDB, Spark, SparkML, TensorFlow, etc).
Experience in account management, client service and/or management consulting. Experience in designing and deploying large-scale distributed data processing systems. Experience with MapReduce or Hadoop.
Experience in Banking, Financial Services and Insurance (BFSI). Familiarity with open source server software (e.g. Apache, NGINX, RabbitMQ, Redis, Elasticsearch, Jetty, etc).
Systems design experience, with the ability to architect or explain complex systems interactions, including data flows, common interfaces, APIs, and other methods. Demonstrated knowledge of web development protocols (e.g. HTML5, AJAX, XML, JSON, etc) and geospatial technologies (e.g. KML, GeoRSS, etc).
Effective project management, communication, and stakeholder management skills. Ability to work well with a cross-functional and geographically dispersed team and customer base.
title: Cloud Consultant, Professional Services, Google Cloud

description:
Ambitious growth plans in Asia Pacific

 Value creation focused

 Part of digital transformation journey


This leading regional bank is well-positioned to achieve its growth plans for the region. It is committed in investing its technology platform to realise the vision of a digital bank and has various newly created technology positions for this purpose including investment in their Data analytics team.


Our client is looking for an experienced Big Data Architect to set the vision, strategy, roadmap and principles for data management and architecture. You will work closely with the software and application development teams to recommend database structures based on the data storage and retrieval needs within each department. As a hands-on lead, you are also required to analyse system requirements and implement migration methods for existing data and in turn design conceptual and logical data models and flowcharts. Hands-on experience with SQL and Enterprise Data warehouse (Oracle & Teradata) is also required. Ideally, you are familiar with predictive analysis and data visualization techniques using relevant tools (e.g. Tableau, D3.js and R.)


The candidate should have a proven track record in as a Data architect with an in-depth understanding of database structure principles. The candidate should ideally have experience in Open source development and knowledgeable with server side configurations as well. Strong communication is a must for this role given the level of stakeholder engagement.


Interested candidates, please send your CV to sherry@kerryconsulting.com quoting 13238.Due to the high volume of applications, only shortlisted candidates are notified.

description:
Global Fashion Group (“GFG”) is the #1 online fashion platform for emerging markets. It operates across four continents and 25 countries and employs over 9,000 people via its five brands / ventures: ZALORA in Southeast Asia, THE ICONIC in Australia and New Zealand, NAMSHI in Middle-East, DAFITI in Brazil/Latam and LAMODA in Russia/Ukraine/Kazakhstan/Belarus.
At GFG, Technology is core to long-term success and is a crucial enabler of a great Customer Experience. We’re a mix of experts in fashion, logistics, data analytics, marketing, and design, guided by business consultants and tech geniuses – everyone contributes to the success of GFG and the ventures.
If this sounds like your kind of gig, be part of a creative, passionate and dynamic team that works hard but throws a great party as well!
We are looking for a Full Stack Software Architect with a strong background in designing robust architectures which can still evolve through time and willing to be very hands-on to implement these architectures with the teams in an Agile and DevOps approach (“you build it, you run it”).
You should be proficient in
Data structures & algorithms, Object oriented design, Design patterns
Building reliable, performing and scalable systems managing concurrency: master different architecture patterns, being able to make pragmatic decisions between state of the art architecture and quickwins depending on the situation.
Node.js, React
And some of the following:
Front-end: HTML / CSS technologies, vue.js, angular.js
Back-end: Golang, Java, Python
Learning new development languages
Agile, DevOps, Software Craftsmanship: scrum / kanban, CI / CD, TDD, code optimization for performance and maintenance, bug management in production… you have a strong experience and you’re deeply convinced in these approaches. The architectures you design particularly take into account the impacts on DevOps.
Implement with the team the architecture vision, contribute to user stories to ensure that the recommendations are not just for paper and that they make sense in the real situations.
You should have the following qualifications
BS in Computer Science or related technical discipline or equivalent practical experience
8+ years of experience with high-traffic, high scalable distributed systems (micro-services event driven architectures) and client-server architectures (clustering, partitioning, sharding, etc) in a cloud environment (AWS), first as a software developer and then as an architect or tech lead.
A solid foundation in computer science, with strong competency in data structures, algorithms, software design, and deep understanding of good software design patterns
Solid understanding of systems architecture, high scalable system design patterns, how things work underneath each request or UI layer.
Knowledge of the whole web stack, understand how all the pieces fit together (front-end, web server, load balancer, database, network layer, etc.).
What’s in it for you?
Super fun, vibrant and dynamic environment
Ability to make an impact to the company – we have a startup mindset and your ideas and efforts do matter!
Significant career growth opportunities in a fast-growing and sunrise industry.
Opportunity to work with super smart and talented colleagues
An environment where agile, devops, software craftsmanship are not just buzz words!
How to apply
Please click Apply button. Also, please provide github/stackoverflow account if any. If you have open source work that demonstrates any of the above skills, please do share.
Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
title: Full Stack Architect

description:
Here at Prudential, we understand that success comes from visionaries like you. Your passion and diversity keep us at the forefront of innovation, which is why we are committed to helping you shape your future. We offer a range of career opportunities that span a dozen countries, each providing international perspectives and local reach. Across the broad scope of our operations, Prudential stands united in our dedication to providing protection – for our customers, our communities and our world.
Job Profile Summary:
The Enterprise Architect defines an integrated holistic IT architecture align to vision and business strategy to support the Prudential Singapore to achieve its mission and vision.
Job Description:
Creates robust, extensible enterprise architecture for moderate to high complexity systems.
Partners with project teams/solution architect(s) to ensure application architecture align with enterprise architecture goals and objectives.
Works collaboratively with others to lead the definition of application architecture for technology-based business solutions, by applying industry best practices.
Collaborates with other architects and leads the efforts on: architecture for distributed applications, data analytic solutions, information security and threat modeling.
Interprets and transforms business strategy and process into tactical plans, maps technology to application solutions, and ensures the technical solutions are in alignment with the business and IT strategies. Produces design artifacts that express and justify the architecture solution.
Partners with multiple IT groups to establish and keep relevant multi-year business architecture and related technical roadmaps and architectures that facilitate the achievement of business strategies, objectives, and goals, including delivery of innovative and transformational solutions.
Provides forward thinking, strategic input to business as they refine and refresh multi-year strategic plans.
Maintains an up-to-date perspective of information technology industry including design and architectural patterns, best practices, industry trends and technology trends.
Actively conducts research to ensure the business remains innovative and relevant in the technology space.
Designs and implements standards, tools and methodologies to ensure the overall IT Portfolio’s architecture is maintained in a coherent manner.
Establishes practical design approaches and standards through product research, evaluation, and proof-of-concept activities and ensures product quality through design and code review.
Who we are looking for:
Competencies & Personal Traits
Must have in-depth experience with Java, J2EE, .NET, JSON, SOAP/Restful APIs, web services, XML, Windows/Linux environments, Services Oriented Architecture, Online Transaction Processing, batch processing/scheduling, and enterprise service buses.
In-depth experience of utilizing secure architecture design patterns, principles and standards.
Experience in information security vulnerability management and/or software design, including distributed web applications.
In-depth experience in at least one of the following relational databases: Oracle or MS SQL Server.
In-depth experience with designing highly scalable cross-platform database solutions with comprehensive understanding of both Operational and Analytical Data Architecture, Security, Performance, Scalability, and Reliability for enterprise systems.
Hands-on experience with big data applications, data staging and preparation, and data analytics platforms and technologies.
In-depth experience with security concepts and standards, such as, OAuth, SAML, JWT, PCI DSS, PII, encryption, tokenization.
Proven track record to drive rapid prototyping and design for new projects and analytic R&D environments.
Must have experience creating project solution blueprints, technical specifications, and high level design documents.
Knowledge of network architecture principles and concepts, including tiering, segmentation, DMZs, firewalls, load-balancing, throttling, failover, and disaster recovery.
Working knowledge of security technologies and considerations, including SAML 2.0, SSO, oAuth, JWT etc
Certified EA – TOGAF 9.1/EACOE is preferred.
Working Experience
6-7 years’ experience in serving as an architect within a medium to large company or consulting organization including at least recent 3 years in an enterprise architect role.
title: Enterprise Architect

description:
Job Category
Customer Success Group
Job Details
The Technical Architect will be responsible for successfully creating custom enterprise applications using Force.com and integrating salesforce.com with other enterprise systems. In this capacity, the Technical Architect will be applying the enterprise architect skills and be an expert in implementing large scale enterprise applications, utilising web-based technologies and applying enterprise system integration and security architectures. Ideally, the candidate has a CRM implementation background. Salesforce.com experience and certification is advantageous. However, candidates with a solid technical architecture and development background in Java, .Net and integration will also be considered. The candidate must be able to lead a technical requirements gathering sessions, produce requirements and technical architecture documents, manage the developer resources and be hands-on implementing where required. The candidate must also be able to manage client expectations and scope by working closely with the project manager. Responsibilities: - Lead technical requirements gathering sessions and producing technical requirements and design documents. - Manage the technical delivery of integrations, security, single-sign-on and application customizations. - Manage technical scope and client expectation. - Provide hands-on expert level assistance to developers for technical issues. - Design and implement the development and release process. - Design and manage the execution of test plans and ensuring a quality solution is delivered. Minimum Qualifications: - Bachelors Degree, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, MIS or equivalent - 8+ years of experience implementing and integrating enterprise systems, preferably CRM or ERP with increasing complexity and responsibility. ( We are not expecting you to have Salesforce experience, we can train that) - Strong CRM (Or similar) consulting experience. - Ability to deliver integration projects using established integration technologies and EAI-tools. - Proven ability to design and optimize business processes and to integrate business processes across disparate systems. - Experience with web and/or cloud application development Force.com, Heroku, SpringSource, Amazon RDS, Azure, J2EE or .Net, - A thorough understanding of XML, SQL, and Object Oriented Design Patterns. - Travel regularly with an average of 50% but may be higher as required by client engagements. Preferred Qualifications: - Experience working in enterprise architect roles - Ability to define and deliver custom Force.com enterprise applications. - Hands-on development experience with Apex, Visualforce and/or salesforce.com API. - Works experience with a professional consulting organization (e.g., Big 5 consulting) a plus. - Completion of several salesforce.com projects in development and lead technical roles. - Extensive experience with data extraction, transformation, and load tools. - Expertise in Single Sign On, Master Data Management, Social Enterprise Technologies or Data Warehousing. - A detail-oriented and motivated individual with the ability to rapidly learn and take advantage of new concepts, business models, and technologies. - Confident leader and communicator; Intensity, drive and the desire to succeed; Resourceful and creative problem-solving skills; Excellent analytical skills and the ability to develop processes and methodologies - Team player with strong communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills About Salesforce Salesforce is the global leader in customer relationship management (CRM) software. We pioneered the shift to cloud computing, and today we're delivering the next generation of social, mobile and cloud technologies that help companies revolutionize the way they sell, service, market and innovate-and become customer companies. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World's Most Innovative Company according to Forbes and one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For. Our "more human, less corporate" culture is built around doing work that matters, winning as a team and celebrating success Aloha-style. Ready to find your #dreamjob? *LI-Y
Posting Statement

title: Technical Architect

description:
We are seeking a passionate, style-engaged, analytical, and developmental leader with a significant track record of success to be our Country Sales Manager based in Singapore.
In this role, you will be responsible for crafting and executing a vision for Singapore operations. Key responsibilities will include developing the long-term strategic roadmap for the business, managing different departments to meet KPIs, maximizing sales opportunities and profitability. This highly data-driven and analytical manager will lead an awesome local team and have full responsibility for the P&L growth of the country.
Reporting directly to the Executives, our ideal candidate will be a self-starter and creative problem solver with a passion for data and all things home. You’ll know your competitors inside and out. You’ll be responsible for recruiting, managing, coaching and developing your team. You’ll be dynamic and analytical—as comfortable leading a senior business review as you are analyzing large data sets to develop impactful insights. You will be able to define overarching goals and strategy, articulate and execute plans, and monitor and manage key business metrics. You will lead operational process improvements as well as drive efficiency gains with a continuous focus on deploying technology to enable business results.

This is a unique general management role for a highly motivated and energetic individual looking to join a high growth company and make a significant business impact.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

Be responsible to lead all retail stores to meet periodical KPIs from Marketing, Sales, Operations, Customer Relationship
Develop and execute business vision, synthesizing data-driven insights with market feedback
P&L oversight for the entire country
Maximize sales opportunities and profitability
Expanding sales channels i.e working with turnkey private and government projects, architects, real estate developers and interior designers.
Management, motivation and coaching of managers to achieve KPIs
Employ data-driven decision making to drive the categories. Assist the HQ team to provide insight to the wider team. Work closely with marketing and purchasing team to help forecast demand and ensure consistent supply amidst seasonal trends.
Partner with marketing and warehousing team to manage inventory health by ensuring efficient inventory flows (including the forecasting, purchasing, and return of new and catalogue products). Involves in determining and executing exit strategies for unproductive inventory.
Work cross functionally with Technology, Operations, Finance and Marketing to deliver strategic projects allowing Castlery to offer the best customer experience.
Engage regularly with Castlery executives to ensure continued alignment between brands and functions
Build staff plan to fully execute vision – hire team and partner cross-functionally to resource appropriately
Travel 3-6 times annually

Requirements:

Top-tier university qualifications or professional equivalent
Track-record of successfully leading cross-functional teams in complex projects
At least 5 years of experience in similar industry
Very strong traditional leadership/management skills, the highest business standards and ethics
Evidence of “scrappy startup execution”, and leading teams of junior and senior staff in day-to-day execution activities. Knowledge of how to ‘get it done’ no matter what when time is tight and stakes are high.
Ability to manage through ambiguity, stress, adversity and conflict to establish focus and deliver against business goals
Understanding/passion for home and technology

Benefits:

Make an impact by making great designs affordable to everyone
Be a key member of a high growth startup
Join a multi-talented, close-knit team of motivated and smart members
Enjoy flexible work hours, a cubicle-free office, and a degree of autonomy you’d be hard-pressed to find in the corporate world
Remuneration: Annually 65k to 95k depending experience
Location: Base Singapore

description:
(Job Number: 01ULX)
As a member of Solution Architect Practice Group, you will be responsible for the end-to-end architecture for a system and ensures the detailed design and development is aligned with the Enterprise Architecture of the Agency. Success in this role will be demonstrated by your strong technical aptitude and ability to communicate in an effective and efficient manner.

What to Expect:

Provides technical leadership and is responsible for establishing the direction for the IT architecture, standards, design and implementation approaches for the agency systems
Demonstrate leadership in IT management by producing strategic and innovative concept proposals, papers, and speaking at conferences
Translate business requirements, including application resiliency requirements, into application architectural specifications
Creates, evaluates and implements plans and design proposals for high impact IT solutions, involving leading edge technologies and methods considering key factors such as its long-term effectiveness, practicality, technical limitations and criticality
Design the architecture blueprint of the organisation's business, information and ICT assets, by using multiple architectural models. Use, govern and enhance the architecture blueprint to ensure that the business and ICT are in alignment.
Manage technical project delivery; perform code reviews and make recommendations of code changes; collaborate with vendor development staff to resolve technical challenges; help to analyze and determine performance tuning and scalability improvements of code and queries
Provide architecture and technical support during production incidents
Possesses broad and deep skills across disciplines, ability and interest in mentoring technical staff and raising our collective technical competencies
How to Succeed:
Graduate Degree in any discipline
Minimum 7 years of design/implementation/consulting experience with distributed applications - must have a minimum of 3 years hands-on experience as a technical lead and system architect (i.e. system design, performance tuning, and system prototyping & maintenance)
A solid software development background and multiple industry certifications
Experience in designing and implementing .Net and/or J2EE applications with excellent data modelling and SQL skills.
Solid understanding of Server-side, .Net and/or Java development, Service Oriented Architectures (SOA), web services and public web sites / digital services development
Extensive experience in designing, developing and deploying large, scalable production applications on cloud/PaaS platforms and Containers, such as AWS, Azure and OpenShift
Working knowledge of DevOps software development tools and methodologies
Able to independently analyze and identify comprehensive solutions considering all functional implications while developing a workable solution
Results and customer oriented
Team player with strong organization and interpersonal skills
Strong written, presentation and stakeholder management skills

Employee Status - Permanent

description:
Salary:
Competitive

Singapore

Job Type:
Permanent, Full time

At Bank of Singapore, we are constantly on the lookout for exceptional individuals to join our team. We promote a culture of openness, teamwork and fairness. Most importantly, we invest in our people through our programmes that develop them on both professional and personal levels. Besides attractive remuneration packages, we offer non-financial benefits and opportunities to develop your potential within OCBC Group’s global network of subsidiaries and offices. If you have passion, drive and the will to succeed, rise to the challenge today!

Bank of Singapore opens doors to new opportunities.
Start your career with Bank of Singapore as a Technical Lead in the IT Credit/Market Risk team! !

The incumbent will play a crucial role in spearheading techno functional analysis, design, development and application support around the bank's specific technology streams and its sub-system.

The incumbent is required to articulate/interlock with key business users, manage third party vendors, internal developers, other IT teams and relevant business stakeholders in a professional manner. In addition, the incumbent will lead the team to carry out development leading to implementation.

He/She will manage the application life cycle management, application support and overall technical governance. The main business domain areas are credit and market risk in a wealth management environment.

Responsibilities

Provide technical and functional leadership to various areas including projects, enhancements, application support and other application lifecycle management activities - software upgrades/patching, technical risk assessment reporting, application audits, vendor management, contracts management, demand management and capacity management.
Manage the roadmap for the bank's credit application platform.
Work with the architects, solution managers, project managers to provide inputs, and effort estimates to the development of the various project artifacts namely logical design, functional design, technical design, project initiation document.
Act as a direct point of escalation with key stakeholders from the business area on application support matters including IT service management, production incident management, complaints and complex service requests.
To carry out development as well as supervise peer developer(s) or engaged development services, System Integrator or vendor to deliver required software application change enhancements (CRs), bug fixes, and change for risk remediation.
To deliver prototypes (when relevant) based on high level business and functional requirements.
Ensure all development have been unit tested in compliance to design and functional specifications and provide support to downstream testing such as SIT and UAT.
Provide 3rd Level Application Support for analysis and issue resolution; assist team lead in technical problem root cause analysis and see to delivering solution to eliminate or fix root cause in production problems.
Maintain a working knowledge of business processes and solution design.
Provide and demonstrate technical leadership to junior team member(s).

Qualifications

Degree or equivalent in an IT related discipline.
Financial technology experience (Wealth Management, Investment Management, Asset Management, Investment Banking preferred). Experience in credit and market risk related application development and support will be a plus.
Experience in the discipline of System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) process, especially in the solution, analysis, testing and implementation phases of the SDLC processes.
At least 6-8 years of experience developing with technologies such as .NET, C#, SQL, Web Development (MVC) preferably in a financial institution.
Strong skills in database technologies including physical data model design, stored procedures, functions, indexes, performance tuning and understanding execution plans.
Strong experience in the field of Data Management, Data Warehousing and ETL.
Knowledge on various asset classes such as equities, fixed income, loans, deposits, FX, Options will be a plus.
Previous experience with platforms such as TEMENOS T24 or Triple A will be considered an advantage.
Excellent communication skills, able to handle multiple projects and priorities concurrently and manage business expectations accordingly.
Experience in Java, Web Services (REST and SOAP) and middleware technologies is required.
Experience in creating and documenting design, technical specification, test cases and unit test scripts.
Experience in software engineering governance disciplines like SEI-CMMi, Agile development is an advantage.
title: Technical Lead, IT Credit/Market Risk (Associate Director / Director)

title: Technology Architect

description:
About Us

Founded in Singapore in 2015, TenX is developing applications to make digital currency spendable anytime anywhere by offering a debit card payment system.

TenX is driven by a talented team of developers, marketers, community, customer support, designers, lawyers, cryptography and security specialists, TenX even have bankers and accountants on their team ready to create the foundation for exponential growth within the digital currency space.

We are looking for an experienced Operational Risk & Control Lead responsible for overseeing the execution, and compliance of processes. This is especially crucial towards trading and hot/cold wallet management, where operational risks are high and directions are easily understood and measured. The Operational Risk & Control team receives feedback from other teams and is also responsible for communicating these to the Process Architects who then re-evaluate accordingly. Software engineers are also welcomed to apply and be a part of this team in order to ensure consistency between manual and automated processes, as manual processes have a high risk of corrupting data and state.

Key responsibilities:
Manage operational risk & control activities

Processes review

Implement risk & control architecture

Breaches identification and testing

Feedback collection and escalation

Settlement of transactions and balances across risk and trading executions and limits

Your skills:
Operational risk management education/experience/certifications

Skilled in ensuring processes are respected, weaknesses identified, reported and solved

Consistent and efficient communication skills to both business users and stakeholders

Experience in growth-stage startups and/or an interest in virtual-currency preferred

Professional, results-driven, collaborative mindset

Possible backgrounds: financial controlling, audit firms

Our offer in return:
Excellent team full of go-getters

Fun environment

Revolutionary, well-funded company

Please have a look at our core values and team culture:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PszTYgOUs3w

title: Network Specialist

description:
Amazon Web Service (AWS) operates 44 Availability Zones (AZs) within 16 geographic Regions around the world, with announced plans for 17 more AZs and six more Regions in 2017, making AWS one of the fastest growing enterprise tech companies ever. Amazon’s AWS Data Centers (DC) are a major component of worldwide cloud-computing infrastructure and are industry leading examples of mission critical facilities.


Engineers in AWS work to design resilient, cost effective DC facilities. We are responsible for achieving a world class uptime for our customers and drive to develop a fleet of buildings emphasizing security, safety, and efficiency, while finding new ways to meet AWS’s growing demand. We justify and communicate the technical decisions we make directly to AWS leadership and work hard to drive continuous advancements in our designs. As an Engineer at AWS you will have the opportunity to impact changes in our current design, as well as establish design procedures and protocols for future systems.


AWS Engineering is responsible for the design of all electrical and mechanical systems within all of Amazon DCs world-wide. The team works directly with operations, security teams, field engineering, and construction management to implement designs that are functional, practical and innovative.


The team is seeking a Senior DC Infrastructure Engineering Manager, with hands-on mission critical equipment/system design and implementation experience, to become part of our global engineering team. As a Senior Engineering Manager you will be part of a highly creative and effective leadership team comprised of Architects, Mechanical Engineers, Electrical Engineers, and Control Engineers, tasked with developing regional strategies for capacity delivery and challenging the status quo. You will be responsible for delivery of projects, applying design quality controls, and providing technical guidance to team members. As a subject matter expert, you will be responsible for the design of prototypical DC facilities, localization of conceptual innovations, solve large scale implementation issues, and build a strong relationships with the regional industry.


Anticipated travel not to exceed 25%


Responsibilities of the Senior DC Infrastructure Engineering Manager

The Senior DC Infrastructure Engineering Manager will be responsible for the following:

Develop strategic solutions which meet or exceed our quality requirements and fall within our budgetary and redundancy requirements.
Conceives, initiates, and leads projects with widespread impact on infrastructure design, innovation, and implementation.
Sets the standard for engineering, test, and best practices. Drives process improvements across the organization.
Decompose complex problems into straightforward and actionable solutions.
Be a leader within the group as well as within internal and external teams that support our data centers.
Provide technical oversight of the Regional Electrical and Mechanical Basis of Design (BOD).
Serve as a technical advisor for AWS datacenter electrical and mechanical designs.
Work with internal teams to understand user requirements.
Work with local agencies having jurisdiction and certification agencies to ensure compliance with federal, state and municipal requirements and building codes.
Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in engineering.
Cumulative 10+ years of experience with mission critical facilities.
Cumulative 3+ years managing engineering teams working on facilities outside the US.
Understanding of uninterruptible power sources, diesel generators, electrical switchgear, power distribution units, and automatic/static transfer switches.
Understanding of chillers, cooling towers, direct and indirect evaporative cooing, variable speed drives, and fan systems.
Knowledge of building codes and regulations including Life Safety, IBC, NFPA, NEC, NESC and OSHA.
Direct experience with the design, construction, operation, or maintenance of data centers.
Ability to research new designs, technologies, and construction methods of data center equipment and facilities.
Ability to carry new design concepts through exploration, development, and into deployment/construction.
Ability and willingness to think outside of the box to find creative and innovative solutions to reduce costs with no impact on quality, reliability, or maintainability.
Ability to perform complex business case analysis to justify technical decisions and present the justification to management in a high level review.
Possess excellent communication skills, attention to detail, maintain high quality standards.
Preferred Qualifications:

10+ years of experience directly related to data center or mission critical facility design.
Professional Engineering License or Master Degree in Engineering
Direct experience with high voltage distribution systems design.
Direct experience with chiller systems, cooling towers and factory testing protocals
Managing experience with the design, construction, operation, or maintenance of data centers.
Previous consultant and jurisdiction negotiation skills associated with design, construction and project execution.
Experience with large scale technical operations or large-scale compute farms.
