To architect automation and integration of manufacturing processes & machinery to achieve production efficiency & productivity improvements at optimal cost.
To define, specify, procure solution, implement, validate automated processes to be integrated with shop floor systems for monitoring, control & data collection for continuous improvements leading to preventive and predictive measures in meeting factory needs.
To conceptualize automated solutions, with ability to draw sketches to accurate scale, showing relation of proposed installation to existing facilities with exact specifications & dimension to facilitate automated process.
Research & implement new technologies, innovate process/design/machine/tooling that can help to save cost & time to achieve optimization.
To work closely with team members, stakeholders ,process owners and /or system integrators/vendors in providing feasibility studies on automation proposals and support the deployment of automated solution to meet deliverables.
To support buy-off , installation , validation qualification & training of automated solutions , complete with proper documentations as part of hand over to factory.
Has global site support responsibilities depending on location where automated solution is deployed.
Degree/Diploma in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering | Mechatronics - Modules covering automation Engineering, robotics, statistics, controls and database.
Minimum 5 years’ relevant automation experience in manufacturing or process industry, preferably in EMS back end processes.
Industry Engineering knowledge will be an added advantage.
Well versed in Mechanical Design with good knowledge on Electro-Pneumatic circuit control, PLC programming, electrical wiring and robot application.
Sound knowledge on various kinds of sensors used in automation and its characteristics, machine to machine interface.
Added advantage for candidates with knowledge in scripting, asp.net, html, Java, Eclipse, VS.net, MS SQL, Oracle , Vertica.
Knowledge of Lean concept, ISO Quality system, ESD standards & Safety Compliance.
Team player, able to work well with all levels and under pressure.
Independent, resourceful and self-driven with strong analytical ,troubleshooting & time management skills.
Detail-oriented personality with creative thinking skills.
Excellent interpersonal & cross cultural communication skills.
Able to travel for site support.
title: Senior Engineers (Automation)

description:
Our Company:


Founded in 2014, Keyteo Consulting is a company specialized in organization and information system management in financial and banking environments that work with its clients as they outsource their projects in innovation, as well as research and development. Our purpose is to improve the innovation, competitiveness and performances of our clients. We contribute to all the key steps in our clients’ project lifecycles, from an analysis of the needs through implementation and industrialization.

Keyteo Consulting offers strategic, operational and technological solutions intended to accompany clients as they carry out their projects, by providing complete expertise. Keyteo Consulting is strongly dedicated to sustain the strong growth of companies specializing in key sectors such as banking/finance and others.
Job Description
The client looking for a talented and experienced Microsoft .NET/C# Architect/Senior Developer to join a new project. This smart engineer will be working in a dynamic and international team. Experience in security, code efficiency, performance, resilient code and robustness is mandatory.
You have strong convictions, but you are also pragmatic.
Your fields of responsibilities/expertise in Architecture or developments may include:
Definition of documentation standards & processes

Definition of development & quality standards (best practices, coding rules, development processes…)

Conception of state-of-the-art architectures

Ability to justify, communicate and evangelize your ideas.

Experience in web & cloud developments will be highly appreciated, and this can include: web applications, Office 365, REST APis, Security Protocols such as OpenID Connect or OAuth2, …
Experience in big data & analysis will be highly appreciated, and this can include : IOT, Cosmos DB, Power BI …
Main Responsibilities & Duties
· You will report directly to the R&D Manager

· You will contribute in our efforts of standardization in development, processes, quality, documentation

· You will design our solutions in collaboration with our international team of developers located in Singapore and France

· You will bring ideas to the team and contribute on designing smart technical choices that help achieve goals and objectives in time and with the proper quality

· You show a positive and friendly spirit, working cooperatively and professionally with team members.

· You apply rigorously coding standards defined by the company

· You use VSTS to organize your work and report your progress clearly and on a periodic basis

· You follow an agile development cycle

· You ensure that your products’ architecture and design is aligned to the requirement expressed by the senior leadership team.

· You perform other duties as assigned by your management

Qualifications
· Bachelor in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of education

· Minimum 5 years of C# software development

· Understanding of software development cycles, tests methodologies, debugging strategies and risk management is mandatory

· A minimum of 2 years of development experience with Azure is a plus

· Experience with VSTS is a plus

· Experience in IOT is a plus

· Experience in Power BI is a plus

· As per Singapore law you need to be authorized to work in Singapore.
title: .NET/C# Architect/Senior Developer

description:
The Infrastructure Solution Architect’s role is to prepare architectural analysis of projects including preliminary design, calculation, lifecycle costs and equipment selection. The architect must ensure that designs are aligned with the reference standards and framework used to properly deploy infrastructure technology solutions.
Job Responsibilities
Take responsibility for IT infrastructure architecture for projects and assignments
Develop high level infrastructure design artefacts, diagram and documentation and maintain alignment with enterprise architecture as well as application and business strategy
Research, evaluate, test and implement new technology platforms
Analyse business and technical requirements to determine systems design, potential issues and related cost for each project
Apply expert level knowledge to assist customers in architecting, planning, testing and deploying technology solutions
Provide the framework to ensure system designs and best practices are in line with all audit and security requirements
Bachelor’s degree in related discipline and/or demonstrated capability to perform job responsibilities through previous experience and education
5 years of experience in server and datacentre technologies
Experience in Wireless and Wireless location-based system specifically focusing on Cisco solutions
Demonstrated proficiency in IT Infrastructure, network IT security, server types, virtualization, storage area network, processes and software
Deep understanding in Infrastructure internetworking
Designing application infrastructure for private and public cloud environments
Deep understanding in Public/Private/Hybrid (Azura, AWS, Google) cloud solutions and experienced in integrating public cloud into traditional hosting/delivery mode with a specific focus on AWS
Experience in virtualization technologies such as VMWare, Citrix, KVM
Strong understanding of DR and HA solutions
Server and application deployment via automation and configuration management tools
Deep understanding in Big Data technologies and tools such as Hive, Spark, Hbase, Sqoop, Impala, Kafka, Oozie, Map Reduce, etc will be an added advantage
title: Infrastructure Solution Architect

description:
Join Accenture and help transform leading organizations and communities around the world. The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. Choose Accenture, and make delivering innovative work part of your extraordinary career.
Job Description
Data and Analytics professionals define strategies, develop and deliver solutions that enable the collection, processing and management of information from one or more sources, and the subsequent delivery of information to audiences in support of key business processes.
Big Data professionals use Big Data methodologies, solutions and tools to help organizations optimize their business performance by managing, sorting and filtering volumes of data as well as extracting meaningful value from these large volumes of data.
Typical responsibilities include:
Working in highly client-facing roles to contribute throughout the end-to-end delivery lifecycle of complex and large-scale Big Data solutions
Use case and business case development
Vendor landscape and technology assessment (covering for example Hadoop, MapReduce, NoSQL etc)
Solution Architecture formulation (including role of conventional information management platforms)
Proof of concept execution to prove the value of Big Data use cases
Full lifecycle implementation from requirements analysis, platform selection, technical architecture design, application design and development, testing, and deployment
Assess emerging trends in storage access which includes the application of existing high performance distributed file system storage technologies for use by applications in lieu to traditional relational database storage methods Essential Qualifications
Deep experience across systems integration, information management, data management and architecture, and business analytics
Experience with large-scale, multi-release information centric projects , especially on Datawarehouse, BI transformation initiatives
Delivery experience leveraging multiple delivery locations (onshore + nearshore/offshore)
Experience with waterfall and agile delivery approaches
End to end implementation of at least 1 2-3 big data project using at least 1 of Hadoop, Map Reduce or NoSQL platforms/ distributions
Hands on experience with streaming technologies – Storm, Nifi, Kafka, Spark
Hands-on experience with ETL technologies – Talend, Pentaho, Informatica
Solution architecture development encompassing Hadoop distribution file system, data integration tools, data federation and preparation tools, data visualization solutions
Vendor assessment, especially on Hadoop distributions, data integration
TCO assessment for big data platform versus using conventional IM platforms
Experience with ideate-prove-industrialise delivery approach
Deep design experience with programming on high-scale or distributed systems (such as Hadoop)
Design experience of data modeling in Hadoop ecosystem
Experience on sizing Hadoop clusters
Implementation expertise with high performance distributed parallel file system storage technology such as GPFS, GFS, CloudStore, HDFS or similar.
Implementation expertise with a distributed structured storage technology such as BigTable, Cassandra, • Dynamo, Mongo or similar NoSQL solution.
Implementation experience of coarse grain and fine grain security on data layer – both for structured and unstructured data
Ability to support business development activities to articulate Accenture's Data Platform technical capabilities and help shape and communicate proposed solutions to client executives and architects
Bachelor’s degree
Preferred Skills:
Hands-on experience with other technologies in the Hadoop eco-system (e.g. Sqoop, Pig, Hive, Hbase, Flume)
Experience with related/complementary open source software platforms and languages (e.g. Java, Linux, Apache, Perl/Python/PHP, Chef)
Previous ETL development experience with tools such as Datastage, Talend, Pentaho etc
Business Intelligence and reporting software experience (e.g. Microstrategy, Cognos, Qlik, Tableau Pentaho)
Previous experience with data federation and data preparation tools
Hands-on experience with analytical tools, languages, or libraries (e.g. SAS, SPSS, R, Mahout)
Experience "productionalizing" Hadoop applications (e.g. administration, configuration management, monitoring, debugging, and performance tuning)
Previous experience with high-scale or distributed RDBMS (Teradata, Netezza, Greenplum, Aster Data, Vertica)
Knowledge of cloud computing infrastructure (e.g. Amazon Web Services EC2, Elastic MapReduce) and considerations for scalable, distributed systems.
Professional Skills Requirements:
Proven ability to build, manage and foster a team-oriented environment
Demonstrated ability to work with distributed (onshore-offshore) teams
Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment
Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills
Excellent leadership and management skills
All of our consulting professionals receive comprehensive training covering business acumen, technical and professional skills development. You’ll also have opportunities to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of specialization. We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. The sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career.
Accenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

description:

Develop and enhance data infrastructure using frameworks such as Hadoop, SPARK and Flume
Design and build new data models and architects that will provide intuitive analytics
Design and build reliable data pipelines that will efficiently move data to our Data Warehouse
Design and develop new systems and tools that will enable teams to utilise, understand and process data at faster speeds

title: Senior Consultant, Application (Pega)

description:
Active8me is an exciting startup with a digital fitness and health platform built for Asia. We are in the business of building lives.

We provide:
(1) a convenient, all-in-one mobile solution for people wanting to get fit and healthy. Like a PT, dietician and life coach in your pocket!
(2) a digital preventative health solution for tackling chronic diseases like diabetes and obesity

Our aim - transforming lives and making a difference through digital health.
Responsibilities

We are looking for an amazing CTO to lead our mobile application development and technology efforts.
This role is one of the key roles in the company. We want you to be a leader and grow and expand with us as we grow.
This role is/will be a combination of hands on application development; hiring / mentoring / training; and team leadership / project management.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Build innovative, exceptional and well-engineered mobile applications with intuitive, well-designed user interfaces that satisfy both internal and external customer requirements.
Lead and manage internal and external development resources for assigned projects.
Responsible for the overall development of mobile applications.
Train and mentor the team.
You will likely help to hire, build and coach an internal team of mobile developers.
Participate in the organization and planning of development resources and schedules.
Organize and facilitate daily stand-up meetings, reviews, retrospectives, sprint and release planning, demos, and other related meetings with stakeholders.
Adapt plans, schedules, and resource assignments as required to respond to emerging requirements and risks.
Participate proactively in developing and maintaining team standards, documentation, tools, and best practices.
Appetite for learning new things and improving existing ones, and cultivating that same appetite in the development team.
Requirements

REQUIREMENTS
Minimum 6 years experience in Software Development and 3-4 years of native/hybrid mobile application development.
Experience leading or managing a team of developers (involved both technically and in project management / resource management)
Proven expertise in iOS and Android application programming (Objective-C, Cocoa Touch, xCode, interface builder, Java, Android SDK). Our current app is built using Ionic, with AWS back-end.
Published examples of mobile applications on the App store and the Android market.
You must have a deep understanding of traditional relational database and how to architect a structure that can scale. Knowledge of non-relational database is also a plus.
Proven expertise in developing rich web applications using Javascript and other web technologies, including HTML5 and CSS3.
Experience with Server side technologies (Ruby, PHP, ASP, etc) is essential, as well as integration with 3rd party Apps/platforms/Services etc
Expertise in mobile video delivery and playback.
Experience with Agile development projects.
Proven results oriented person with good communication skills and a delivery and quality focus.
Expertise working with Amazon Web Services.
Experience managing projects using Jira and Github.
Experience in developments with high traffic and high data usage is a plus.
Experience with Zendesk, Stripe is a plus.
ABOUT YOU
World class - for our company to be the best, we want to employ the best. We want you to be excellent at what you do.
Team Player - we want someone who can work within a team environment well. Someone that truly believes the best outcome comes from the sum of many parts.
Doer – we believe talk is cheap. We want people of action who just get the job done. Someone who takes responsibility, finds a solution, helps solve the problem and who gets things done with a minimum of fuss.
BS cutter - you know what we mean. We’re not into politics or games at Active8me. We’re into honest communication, integrity and saying it how it is.
Passion – we believe that to do something great you need to be passionate about what you do and passionate about why you’re doing it.
LOCATION
Singapore
PLEASE NOTE: YOU NEED TO BE CURRENTLY LIVING IN SINGAPORE OR ABLE TO EASILY RE-LOCATE.
MORE INFORMATION / APPLY
If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you and see what you’ve got. Please get in contact and send across a CV to the details below.
Please note only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.
Jeremy Rolleston
Founder & CEO
jeremy.rolleston@active8me.com
www.active8me.com
Salary
5000 - 8000 SGD

description:
To plan, architect, lead and manage the delivery of IT services related to Data Centre, Platform Systems Management and Infrastructure Management NIE’s vision and mission.
To plan, budget, procure and implement infrastructure systems and solutions.
To effectively and efficiently provide overall technical and operational support across the ICT division.

To plan, architect, lead and manage the delivery of IT services to support NIE Research community.
Degree holder in information technology, computer science or related fields
Minimum 12 years of working experience in infrastructure & systems implementations and administration, with at least 5 years’ experience in managing and supervising both in/outsourced staff.
At least 4 years’ experience in Data Centre build, management and operations. Working knowledge of Data Centre supporting compartments (UPS, CRAC, Fire Suppression System, Structured Cabling)
Working experience in handling Disaster Recovery Centre, backup and recovery, system and network capacity planning, enhancement of IT infrastructure.
Working knowledge of Data Centre and Infrastructure Monitoring solutions and tools.

Working knowledge of HDS, EMC NAS & SAN products, CommVault Enterprise Backup Solution.
Working knowledge of server platform, virtualization and cloud technologies.
Working knowledge of Linux, Microsoft Windows, Exchange, IIS, Active Directory, system security, TCP/IP and syslogs.
Good knowledge of security products/solutions available in the industry.

Experience working in a Research environment and knowledge of Research processes will be an advantage.

description:
Join Accenture and help transform leading organizations and communities around the world. Optimize marketing processes and integrate across the enterprise in order to maximize the opportunities of data, analytics and marketing outcomes.

Partner and team with technology solution providers and marketing agencies to deliver the best solution meeting the needs of our clients.
Offer our clients end to end solutions and services in Customer Data Management and Analytics, Customer Experience Management, Content Services, Digital Analytics, eCommerce, Marketing and Media Optimization, Marketing Operations, Marketing Strategy, Marketing Technology Services, Marketing Transformation and Merchandising Analytics and Optimization.
Roles and responsibilities
Competent / technical subject matter expert (SME) in either the digital marketing and content management domain or the digital commerce domain. Experience across both will be a huge plus.

Must possess excellent verbal / written communication. Must be able to build relationships and communicate effectively to management and developers. Must be able to summarize complex concepts into understandable concepts and actions.

title: Digital Solution Architect

description:
Project Delivery

Analyse and document requirements by liaising with a range of people including users and managers, drawing together information needs across a distributed organisation
Establish and prepare project plans, risk management plans, project milestones and deliverables in consultation with business users and architect/designer
Manage the implementation of the project on a daily basis with regard to schedules, budget, manpower and quality
Manage the scope definition and change control mechanism
Escalate and discuss project overrun issues, scope creep, integration issues, resource requirements with Project Director
Manage integration of various components of the project including hardware, software installation, testing, business process review, redesign, application development, migration and data conversion etc.
Manage project activities to ensure timely delivery, including identification of critical path, monitoring and driving completion of interdependent activities and adjustment to project schedules to achieve overall completion deadline

description:
Reporting to the Manager, Content Management Systems, INSEAD are looking for an experienced Drupal System Analyst to join our growing team.
The purpose of this role is to Improve INSEAD public facing website using the latest CMS solutions such as migrating the sites from Drupal 7 to Drupal 8. Responsible for designing and implementing new features and functionality, establishing and guiding the website’s architecture and managing all technical aspects of the CMS mainly using Drupal. Enable website a high degree of interoperability with adjacent technologies such as Oracle Eloqua, web analytics, Tealium tracking; the ability to integrate well with delivery platforms such as e-commerce, social media and portal software, besides content creation functions such as templating, workflow, change management, and security; and content deployment functions that deliver prepackaged or on-demand content to web servers.
To be successful in this role, you will have the following experience:
Min.1+ project migration from Drupal 7 to Drupal 8

Min.1+ projects/year dedicated using Drupal 8

Min.6+ years of related experience in full cycle web development with demonstrated achievements and progressive responsibilities.

Min.2+ years of Google Analytic/Tealium Tagging ability and technical SEO ability on Drupal

Min. 3+ years in PHP, Symfony, HTML 5, CSS3, Javascript and JQuery

AngularJS, ReactJs, Vue Js experience is a plus
The main responsibilities of this role include:
Acting as a technical lead directing the work of vendors
Working with up to 100+ Drupal admin users and millions of site visitors from different countries of the world.
Handles up to 75 Development request per year and 1000+ incidents or change requests.
Lead the migration from Drupal 7 to Drupal 8 for INSEAD websites
Main accountabilities of the role include:
Architect enterprise Drupal solutions including data, display, and information architecture. As a Technical Lead, directs the development of web solutions in Drupal and PHP, HTML5/XHTML and CSS implementations. Together with partners develops Drupal themes, custom modules, Administrative views and RESTful services.
Migrates websites from Drupal 7 to Drupal 8. Research and learn industry trends of content management systems and acquire new skills through independent study. Participate actively to the on-going discussion about transversal technology practice and implementation, arm INSEAD websites with the latest technologies.
Responsible to continuously polish and nourish the continuous integration such as Eloqua / Tealium / PeopleSoft / AD / Akdmia database, Magento, web analytics, and so on, as integration becoming part of the architecture framework at INSEAD and in the web industry. Ensure the best technical practice of SEO for the search engines as well.
Works with Architectural Review Meeting and Blue/Red teams to flag critical and impactful technical aspects for all development of the project they are in charge. Draw, or to help other project team member to draw, the technical but audience-friendly technical presentation, with a thorough discussion with line manager(s) prior the decision meeting.
Works with test manager to ensures a smooth transfer from development to production phase in respect of methodology; provides technical and procedural documentation, test cases and protocols, training material, installation procedures, security concept and role assignment of customers.
Collaborate and facilitate the work of security manager. Reactivity is imperative in case of security breach and need immediate action. Responsible for ensuring no new security breach are created during development and deployment.
Informs about all known risks and problems concerning timing and resources. Reports on a regular basis the progress of the development to respective Team-Manager and team-members. Keeps a clear communication channel with Project manager, Data Management in the case of project/planned activities or direct communication with customers. Compiles minutes and protocols about all customer meetings concerning the development. Takes care about the version control in the development.
If you are interested, please send your cover letter and CV to: recrut.sg@insead.edu quoting job number HR2

description:
Job Duties:
You work closely with product, brand, support, and community teams to identify research topics.
You are an advocate for users within the company. You design studies that make sense of user behavior and attitudes. You conduct research using a variety of methods, using remote and in-person techniques, combining qualitative and quantitative methodologies.
You communicate insights and suggestions in a structured and actionable manner. You participate in regular design reviews and other team-wide design efforts. You collaborate directly with brand designers, UX architects, UI designers, product managers, and front-end engineers, to help user insights.
Your Skills/Experiences:
You are a systematic and formally-trained user researcher or information architect with 3+ years of practical experience in conducting applied ethnographic research for digital products, preferably with a familiarity with financial products
You have a B.A/B.S. in a human behavior related field (Human-Computer Interaction, Psychology, Social Science, Library Science, or Information Science), or equivalent work experience. You have an intuitive sense of what makes a digital product beautiful, accessible, and performant.
You are fluent in user-centred research methods, including but not restricted to, mental model interviews, user-centered research, card sorting, diary studies, contextual inquiry, usability testing, and multivariate testing. You have experience moderating in-person and remote user studies. You have experience setting up remote user tests, using tools such as usertesting.com or Optimal Workshop.
You have a basic understanding of behavioral analysis and statistical concepts such as game theory and behavioral economics. You have the ability to moderate internal workshops to achieve internal and external alignment within cross-functional teams. You ask and answer meaningful and impactful questions to elicit useful insights from stakeholders and users. You have a fluent command of English and possess stellar communication skills, both conversationally and in writing.
You have worked with recruiters to screen and recruit users for large-scale user studies across international markets. You have conducted user studies in international markets. You have experience in synthesising research into meaningful and actionable user stories.
You have experience wireframing and prototyping for mobile apps. Working experience with Sketch.app, Invision, and Framer Studio is ideal. You possess deep technical knowledge of information architecture and are able to work with engineers to structure semantic data (in relational or document-based databases) for user-facing interfaces.
You like to experiment and are constantly learning new tools and techniques. You have a quick learning ability and structured way of thinking. You have a hands-on mindset and a willingness to take an active role in our company.
What we are looking for:
You should be inquisitive, and have people skills, analysis skills, and design skills.
title: Senior Product Designer

description:
Admissions Administrator


Full-time 

(40 hours/week)

Immediate

The GESS has strong European foundations and believes in developing confident, forward-looking students through a celebration of respect, openness and inclusiveness. GESS is recognised for its languages and offers a choice between two main curricula: the German Abitur or the English-speaking International Baccalaureate (IB) programme. The school caters to students of all ages, starting from 18 months to graduation at 18 years. GESS is a private school association led by an elected committee and the school management. Currently, more than 300 full and part-time staff are employed at the school. A new purpose-built campus with brand new facilities will open in August, 2018 at Dairy Farm Road.


Role: A key administrative position managing and processing new student applications
This will involve a mixture of email / telephone and face-to-face communication with parents and liaising with Academic departments.
You will work independently to manage student applications and ensure that applications are processed in a timely manner.
Responsibilities:
Manage new student applications
Complete student applications within stipulated timeframes
Contact parents in a timely and professional manner
Student enrolment follow up with families
Answer admissions hotline
Administer student database
Assist with school promotional events
Provide cover within the Admissions department
Requirements:
Previous administration experience ideally with customer facing experience
Proficient in German spoken and written language
Good command of English language, both written and spoken
Ability to converse in third language is desirable
Excellent computer skills (MS Word, Excel, Outlook, Database/CRM systems)
Meticulous, highly organized with pro-active attitude
Experience in handling and liaising with parents and/or children
Able to work during school holidays
We offer an exciting working environment in an international and cooperative team. Your application should include a letter of application, your complete resume, salary expectations and a recent photo.

Please indicate your reasons for applying for the position. Please note, that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. The School reserves the right to appoint prior to the application deadline.


Our students are our most valuable assets. As any professional international school, GESS has a Child Protection Policy. Our recruitment process reflects this policy in that we ask for a police clearance check and further background checks for shortlisted candidates.

title: SAP BASIS HANA ADMINISTRATOR

description:
Overview
Global Technology Infrastructure (GTI) is the technology infrastructure organization for the firm, delivering a wide range of products and services, and partnering with all lines of business (LOB) to provide high quality service delivery, exceptional project execution, and financially disciplined approaches and processes in the most cost effective manner. The objective of GTI is to balance both business alignment and the centralized delivery of core products and services. GTI is designed to address the unique infrastructure needs of specific lines of business and the demand to leverage economies of scale across the firm.
Responsibilities
GTI Service Operations (SO) is responsible for service support and delivery for JPMorgan Chase's (JPMC) Global Technology Infrastructure. Through its Global Service Desk and Infrastructure Operations Centers, Global Service Operations (GSO) provides global, coordinated diagnostic and support services, while Production Assurance and Support functions leverage and execute industry leading infrastructure management and support processes that are designed to minimize customer outages and impacts. Primary responsibilities include building, monitoring and maintaining Exadata / engineered systems and databases as well as providing performance diagnostic expertise, best practice reviews and troubleshooting production issues, both at the database and operating system levels. In this position, candidates will be resolving complex issues involving database performance, database capacity, replication, and other key aspects of distributed database technology. The most successful candidates will combine extremely deep, low-level database systems management capabilities with native coding/scripting skills to contribute to initiatives that reduce operational effort through infrastructure software development. The role requires staff to have on-call availability to respond to major database incidents
Job description
Exceptional experience administering various multi-Terabyte, 24x7 uptime Oracle databases as a Systems/Infrastructure Database Administrator required
Strong experience working with Oracle versions 11gR1/2, 12c in a Linux environment required
Experience with Exadata and / or Zero Data Loss Recovery Appliance is a plus
Strong, proven Oracle Database Performance Diagnostic skills (at both the SQL and system levels) required
Strong programming experience in PL/SQL and UNIX Shell Scripting and Python required
Experience with features such as Oracle Real Application Clusters (RAC), Automatic Storage Management (ASM), Active Data Guard , Oracle Enterprise Manager (OEM) and Golden Gate replication.
Extensive experience with Backup and Recovery using Oracle Recovery Manager (RMAN).
Experience with data encryption, data security, PCI and SOX audit / compliance preferred.
Self-starter capability, ability to acquire new skills autonomously.
Demonstrably solid written and verbal communication skills to drive projects to successful conclusion.

This position requires a Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field of study plus three (3) years of experience in the job offered or three (3) years of experience as Oracle Database Administrator. The employer will alternatively accept a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field of study plus five (5) years of experience in the job offered or five (5) years of experience as Oracle Database Administrator or related occupation in lieu of a Master's degree plus three (3) years of experience. Oracle certifications preferred.
Our Global Technology Infrastructure Group is filled with innovators who love technology as much as you do. Together, you’ll use a disciplined, innovative and cost-effective approach to deliver a wide variety of high-quality products and services. You’ll work in a stable, resilient and secure operating environment where you—and the products you deliver—will thrive.
When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000+ technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cyber security, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world.
J.P. Morgan is a place for talented people from all backgrounds and perspectives because our clients come from all backgrounds and perspectives. We encourage a culture of inclusion, where everyone's opinion counts and all employees have the freedom to deliver their absolute best. This is why we work hard and invest in attracting and developing a diverse workforce. Learn more about our Business Resource Groups in how they help our employees build successful careers and reach their greatest potential.

title: Oracle Senior Database Administrator

description:
Salary:
Competitive
Singapore
Singapore
Singapore
SG
Job Type:
Permanent, Full time

Role Overview


As the Database Administrator at Schroders, you will work closely with the platform heads and engineers across the Wintel, Unix, Storage and Database functions to ensure infrastructure provides the best service possible. You will design, build, test and deliver the strategy provided by the technical authority for this vertical. The database platform underpins our global applications and as such requires high availability, consistently high performance and effective monitoring. We run SQL in all our global data centres, and Oracle in Singapore and London. Working with the global team, ensuring the best standards are adopted by all globally is fundamental to making this a successful platform. The estate requires significant redesign to in order to optimise, standardise and simplify both the technology and operational processes to facilitate a move towards automation and self-service. We utilise both physical and virtual servers to host our estate and are looking to implement an automation platform.


Key Responsibilities:

Design, build and test the global SQL database platform.
Work closely with the support functions, the Storage and Unix engineers to ensure all designs & deployments are globally consistent, scalable and supportable.
Establish and document global standards for hardware & configuration.
Maintain high-levels of uptime across the estate.
Build a platform, capable of delivering automation at every opportunity.
To be successful in this role, you should possess the following requisites:

Degree graduate with at least 5-7 years of relevant work experience in a financial services or similar regulated industry.
Experienced in converged datacentre design & next gen storage.
Understand the importance of metrics & statistics when measuring the performance & capacity.
In-depth knowledge of SQL server 2012 and 2016
Knowledge of Oracle 11 and 12c preferred
High Availability using SQL AlwaysOn, clustering and Windows Operating systems. Oracle Dataguard preferred.
Experience of delivering improvement through debugging code and optimising queries.
Creation and development of scheduled database maintenance routines.
In-depth knowledge of Active Directory, Power shell scripting and automation, volume management, storage backup, monitoring and configuration management software.
Detailed knowledge and experience of building capacity planning and capacity management processes.
In-depth knowledge of security and vulnerability based approach to security hardening.
A good communicator and able to work collaboratively in a global team.
Strong organisational and time management skills.
Someone who is capable of ‘green-field’ thinking, able to imagine how the global platform could look and to create a strategy to get us there.
The ability to work as part of a team across time zones and to share information with the wider team.

description:
Description:

The
Senior Database Administrator (SQL)
will be part of the Global Database Engineering team, which is responsible for installation and maintenance of databases in production environments for our managed hosting customers.

Position Objectives:
Maintain 99.99% availability for all our Hosting products and infrastructure and make sure all the DB related SLAs are met for uptime and support.
Technical point-of-escalation for the DBA team.
Interface with other central organizations to improve and implement process, procedures and automation.
Pro-active and reactive performance analysis, monitoring, troubleshooting and resolution of issues.
Design, implement, and document complex database solutions for customers
Regular database capacity planning related to database growth and system utilization, trend analysis and predicting future database resource requirements.
Technical interface between the DBA team and customers

Responsibilities:

Installation, configuration, design and maintenance of database infrastructure and customer environments as part of a managed hosting solution
Providing Tier 4 escalation support for our Hosting Operations Engineers and customers in their MS-SQL environment
Incident and change management for clients, installation, implementing High availability database environments, troubleshooting of highly critical production environment with 99.99% uptime and meeting service level objectives
Work closely with other DBAs in a global team as well as application, systems operations and engineering teams
Mainly supports in majority with Microsoft SQL Server 2005, 2008, 2012 and 2014 in a Microsoft Windows environment
Thorough knowledge of SQL Server 2005, 2008, 2012 and 2014 environments
Minimum 5 years of experience in SQL Server database administration/support of SQL Server production environments.
Minimum 3+ years of parallel experience installing, configuring and supporting mission critical SQL Server failover cluster environments
Setting up and maintaining database backups on SQL Server 2005, 2008, 2012 and 2014
Strong database and clustering implementation experience and troubleshooting skills in mission critical environments.
Demonstrated, in-depth knowledge of database internals, data structures, T-SQL DTS/SSIS
3+ years of experience in setting up and supporting database mirroring, transactional replication, log shipping and SQL Server failover clustering
Good understanding of ITIL methodologies for change, incident and problem management
Good knowledge of all the Microsoft Office tools, including Excel charts
Strong communication skills and customer-support focused attitude
Self-starter who can work in mission critical environments without any supervision
May require working either Mon-Fri, Tue-Sat or Sun-Thu schedules
Desired Skills:
Implementing and supporting transparent data encryption (TDE) and secure socket layer (SSL)
Implementing and supporting peer-to-peer transactional replication
Basic Microsoft Windows Server 2003, 2008 and 2012 administration experience
Understanding of various 3rd party database monitoring and administration tools
Microsoft SQL Server certification
SQL Server Business Intelligence and OLAP
Experience with third-party backup and HA tools (SQLSafe, LiteSpeed, DoubleTake, WanSync)

Familiarity with virtualization (VMware ESX, Microsoft Hyper-V)
Education or Equivalent Experience:
Graduate in IT or related discipline/ Postgraduate
Strong experience in operations and systems administration
title: Senior Database Administrator - SQL

description:
Role and Responsibilities

A database administrator's responsibilities can include the following tasks:

Installing and upgrading the Oracle server and application tools
Allocating system storage and planning future storage requirements for the database system
Creating primary database storage structures (tablespaces) after application developers have designed an application
Creating primary objects (tables, views, indexes) once application developers have designed an application
Modifying the database structure, as necessary, from information given by application developers
Enrolling users and maintaining system security
Ensuring compliance with your Oracle license agreement
Controlling and monitoring user access to the database
Monitoring and optimizing the performance of the database
Planning for backup and recovery of database information
Maintaining archived data on tape
Backing up and restoring the database
Contacting Oracle Corporation for technical support

Qualifications and Education Requirements


· Degree/Diploma in IT/Computer Science
Preferred Skills


5+ years of production support experience as Oracle DBA

Solid Oracle 11gR1/R2 RAC experience including build, general administration, troubleshooting (Break/Fix) and performance tuning skills
Experience in Clusterware (GRID Infrastructure) - CRS management and configuration
Skilled in Oracle ASM and Dataguard administration
SQL & Database Level performance tuning skills
Demonstrable experience of managing high-performance, high-capacity databases in a critical production environment.
Expertise in backup and recovery and migration using RMAN, datapump and export/import.
Experience in maintenance and management of databases using Oracle Enterprise Manager Grid Control.
24*7 Support

description:
Do you like to work and explore multiple, complex IT technologies? Are you a customer-focused team player, who would like to become part of a large global organization? Would you like to take an opportunity to drive your career? We are looking for someone like that who can help us with the following key tasks:

• A WEB & Content Systems Administrator is required to work within the global Middleware services organization to provide all levels of support to number of Web Hosting technologies like Apache, Tomcat, IBM Websphere, Wily/APM, IIS & Documentum for day to day support of production and UAT/development environments.

• The successful applicant will be part of Global Middlware Service Delivery team and support day to day operations through monitoring, Chat, incidents, SR & Change requests.

• A fixed 24/7 shirt rota and weekend working as required, compliance with operational / change management etc. Collaboration with the INFRA teams & engineering/product management to ensure timely delivery of product updates/upgrades, cert renewals related to Apache, Tomcat, IBM Websphere & Documentum

• The role includes Installation & Fix Pack Upgrades of WebSphere Application Server instances, Administration & Troubleshooting Issues with the WebSphere Application Servers Instances, Setting up & configuring webservers (IHS, Apache), Configuring Performance Monitoring Tools (Wily Introscope / IBM Tivoli), Use of Common WebSphere Command Line tools for administration, generation of heap dumps, thread dumps, Installation, migration , decommission of documentum instances, Administration & Troubleshooting Issues with the Documentum Infrastructure.

• Providing advice on client related escalations/issues/queries on best knowledge basis and promptly escalate to the INFRA teams & engineering when requiring their intervention.Planning and coordination application/infra failover during the major events like Infra weekend, BCM tests and power down activities.

• The successful candidate must have an excellent track record on Solaris/Redhat, Oracle and associated network and client/server technologies.
The role is based in Singapore but you will work as part of a global team based with major footprint in Pune.

The team provides global Web Hosting & Content management support for the bank globally. The team integrates closely with other partner teams such as unix, networks, wintel, Database and storage. The teams goal is to ensure operational stability in a global environment while maintaining leading edge Web hosting technologies & Documentum Support.

• Security principals, encryption standards and ability to follow process

Corporate Technology is looking for a Big-Data expert. Specially worked in Hadoop clustering environments. Below are job responsibilities in this role:
Outlining the job flows.
Handling Hadoop Log Files
Supervising Hadoop jobs using scheduler.
Performing cluster coordination services via Zookeeper.

Pre-processing using Hive and Pig.
Decipher intricate technical requirements.

High-speed querying.

Investigate new prototypes and be in charge of it until it is handed over to the operational teams.
Come up with best practices.
Responsible for troubleshooting and development on Hadoop technologies like HDFS, Hive, Pig, Flume, MongoDB, Accumulo, Sqoop, Zookeeper, Spark, MapReduce2, YARN, HBase, Tez, Kafka, and Storm.
Translate, load and exhibit unrelated data sets in various formats and sources like JSON, text files, Kafka queues, and log data.
Fine tune applications and systems for high performance and higher volume throughput
General operational expertise such as good troubleshooting skills, understanding of system’s capacity, bottlenecks, basics of memory, CPU, OS, storage, and networks.
Additional Responsibilities for the admin:
Excellent knowledge of Linux as Hadoop runs on Linux.
Responsible for implementation and support of the Enterprise Hadoop environment.
Involves designing, capacity arrangement, cluster set up, performance fine-tuning, monitoring, structure planning, scaling and administration.
The administrator consultant will work closely with infrastructure, network, database, business intelligence and application teams to ensure business applications are highly available and performing within agreed on service levels.
Need to implement concepts of Hadoop eco system such as YARN, MapReduce, HDFS, HBase, Zookeeper, Pig and Hive.
In charge of installing, administering, and supporting Windows and Linux operating systems in an enterprise environment.
Accountable for storage, performance tuning and volume management of Hadoop clusters and MapReduce routines.
In command of setup, configuration and security for Hadoop clusters using Kerberos.
Monitor Hadoop cluster connectivity and performance.
Manage and analyze Hadoop log files.
File system management and monitoring.
Develop and document best practices
HDFS support and maintenance.
Setting up new Hadoop users.
Responsible for the new and existing administration of Hadoop infrastructure.
Knowledge of Troubleshooting Core Java Applications is a plus.
Include DBA Responsibilities like data modeling, design and implementation, software installation and configuration, database backup and recovery, database connectivity and security.
Requirements
Having Rich Hands On experience in maintain the Hadoop clusters
Having over 5 years of experience
Certified Hadoop expert
Performance tuning and troubleshooting
Ability to support environments while executing projects deliverables
 Responsible for production and non-production database application support.
Primary contact for projects within the team, interfacing with project managers, application development staff and executive management and infrastructure teams.
Day-to-day production support (incident coordination, changes, service requests, vulnerability management, performance tuning).
Customer support & communications.
 Good communication skills for providing documentation to support personnel, customers, and managers
Our Corporate Technology team relies on smart, driven people like you to develop applications and provide tech support for all our corporate functions across our network. Your efforts will touch lives all over the financial spectrum and across all our divisions: Global Finance, Corporate Treasury, Risk Management, Human Resources, Compliance, Legal, and within the Corporate Administrative Office. You’ll be part of a team specifically built to meet and exceed our evolving technology needs, as well as our technology controls agenda.
When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000+ technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cyber security, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world.
J.P. Morgan is a place for talented people from all backgrounds and perspectives because our clients come from all backgrounds and perspectives. We encourage a culture of inclusion, where everyone's opinion counts and all employees have the freedom to deliver their absolute best. This is why we work hard and invest in attracting and developing a diverse workforce. Learn more about our Business Resource Groups in how they help our employees build successful careers and reach their greatest potential.

We are about 60,000 employees in all major financial centers, in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?
Together. That’s how we do things. We offer people around the world a supportive, challenging and diverse working environment. We value your passion and commitment, and reward your performance.

Keen to achieve the work-life agility that you desire? We're open to discussing how this could work for you (and us).

Why UBS? Video
Are you truly collaborative? Succeeding at UBS means respecting, understanding and trusting colleagues and clients. Challenging others and being challenged in return. Being passionate about what you do. Driving yourself forward, always wanting to do things the right way. Does that sound like you? Then you have the right stuff to join us. Apply now.
UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

description:
HRIS Administator The Opportunity

Adecco is partnering with a German MNC in the construction and engineering industry.

Looking for candidate with short notice

Attractive Annual Package ( AWS+ VB)

The Talent

At least a Diploma in Business or equivalent (preferably with specialisation in HRM)

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills

Self-driven and able to work under pressure

The Job

Participate in setting up and developing the global employee database from Singapore. This includes understanding the countries local requirements, system setup, data conversion, cleansing and migration from legacy systems to the global system. Assist with creating training guides and process manuals.

Train and provide troubleshooting tips to end-users on features and functionality of HR system as needed. Escalate complex issues to SAP HR team and liaise with the team to resolve these issues.

Generate and maintain effective HR reporting, including turnover, headcount, and other key metrics to drive organizational effectiveness.

Update and maintain all appropriate SOPs and workflows to ensure compliance and updated documentation.

Any other duties as assigned.

Next Steps

Prepare your updated resume (please include your current salary package with full breakdown such as base, incentives, annual wage supplement, etc.) and expected package.

description:
Group Infrastructure transformation manager responsible for the conceptualisation, solutioning, formulation of business case and implementation of infrastructure technologies to transform Singtel IT infrastructure through the exploitation of IT technologies in order to meet current and future business demands. Group infrastructure transformation manager will assist the director and work across the different technology domains, namely the End User Technology (EUT) and Network infrastructure domain to drive transformational changes to Singtel IT infrastructure in order to bring about cost efficiencies and optimisations of resources to achieve business and Group IT KPIs.

EUT is the primary interface between the users and the business systems and applications. It is the primary enabler of communications, collaboration and access to business applications across the region. The EUT systems are critical not only because they are the technology that enables the access to the systems, but also are perceived as personal devices that individual users interact with. Therefore, the EUT platform has significant influence over the Customer Experience of internal Singtel staff.

As a result, the performance of the EUT reflects the user community’s perception of the performance of the business systems and the overall IT department.

In addition, the underlying network infrastructure in which the EUT systems ride on is also critical to the overall accessibility of business systems as well as EUT backend systems. Without this underlying key infrastructure piece, the entire EUT and Customer Experience will be severely impacted from performance & speed of access perspective.

The EUT and network infrastructure teams consists of about 60 permanent staff across Singapore and Australia, with involvement of over 20 infrastructure vendors. The role is responsible to oversee the quality of the EUT and network delivery of the $1-2 million annual capital plan.

Strategic

Alignment of the EUT and Network strategy and planning with Singtel’s business goals;

Optimisation of EUT and Network infrastructure through an understanding of evolving business needs and technology capabilities

Support the director in the long-term strategic planning of EUT and network architecting and technology adoption;

Governance

Ensure that projects do not duplicate functionalities or diverge from each other or from business and IT strategies;

Responsible to ensure that all projects that have an EUT and/or network deliverables are in alignment with the overall Group IT strategies and architecture blueprint;

Responsible for the management of risks associated with EUT and network domains through appropriate standards and policies;

Direct and/or indirect involvement and oversight of the development of policies, standards and guidelines that influence the selection, development, implementation and guides the selection, development, implementation and use of EUT and network infrastructure within Singtel Group

Direct contribution and maintenance of EUT and network architecture standards, policies and guidelines that are applicable to Singtel EUT and network infrastructure including onshore and offshore call centres;

Architecture & Solutioning

Responsible to create EUT and network solutions that are scalable, adaptable and support the ever changing business needs;

Responsible for the formulation of the technology roadmap for EUT and network domains including the evaluation of emerging technologies for strategic fit within Singtel business objectives;

Responsible for the capacity, supportability and lifecycle of the EUT and network infrastructure.

Project delivery

Direct oversight and management of project deliverables from technical solutioning, adherence with standards and policies as well as to drive the project from technical perspective;

Work closely with assigned project managers to ensure that timeline and budget are adhered to;

Ensure the complete delivery of the required projects from technical perspective including the need to ensure that the impact to existing operations and systems are minimised;

Develop all necessary technical requirements and inputs necessary to ensure the successful completion of the projects;

Stakeholder management

To provide ongoing advice, consultancy and influence to the Business and Group IT on the most optimal EUT and network technologies to achieve service differentiation through innovation thereby unlocking competitive advantage for Singtel Group;

People Development

Guides and mentors junior staff in order to build internal IPs in the EUT and network infrastructure areas.

As a key member of the Group Infrastructure Technology team, the manager will have to contribute to the creation of processes and procedures to maximise the business value of the infrastructure team. The Group Transformation manager has to be able to work across cultural boundaries supporting a hybrid on-shore/off-shore delivery model.

Requirement:
Degree in Computer Science, Computer, Information Technology, Electronics Engineering or equivalent

IT professional with more than 10 years of experience in a competitive IT environment, including at least 5 years at a management level

Proven ability to manage and motivate a mixed workforce of internal and outsourced contractors to achieve maximum efficiency and results

Must have strong relationship building and management skills

Must have exposure to outsourcing management

Must have basic commercial background understanding such as Total Cost of Ownership, CAPEX & OPEX.

Must have strong team building skills

Must have strong communication skills, articulate and passionate to liaise across the different departments and to drive policy, governance, processes throughout the organisation

Ability to influence senior stakeholders by demonstrating the value of technologies;

Quality oriented with total commitment to continuous improvements

Excellent understanding of technology trends in the EUT and Networking space

Excellent presentation skills

ITIL Foundation v3 certification

Knowledge on

Microsoft Server 2008 / 2012R2

Microsoft Sharepoint

Microsoft SCCM 2012R2

Software Packaging

Exchange 2013

Lync 2013

Wide Area Network

Local Area Network

Network Security

Network-based systems (eg. DHCP, DNS, IPTel system)

Good to have:
Some commercial experience in telecommunication industry

Relevant experience in professional service organisation

High-level knowledge of industry standard application architecture and development lifecycles

Working knowledge of commercial networks (OSS, mobile and fix lines)

Microsoft Certified IT Professional – Enterprise Desktop Administrator on Windows 7

Cisco CCDA / CCDP certified

Data Centre facilities & operations

Structured cabling infrastructure

Database technology

Business Continuity planning

by maintaining a highly reusable, agile and manageable development lab
to support multiple projects which are taking place concurrently. This will involve setting up and allocating the necessary lab resource (e.g. RAM, disk space & CPU for VM) to simulate the required scenarios (e.g. to simulate a customer environment which use Microsoft Domain Controller and has a 3-tier design, namely database, presentation and business logic) and reconfiguring the virtual infrastructure along the way if there is any change in R&D approach. All unused or underused resources shall be revoked to allow reassignment to other projects.
Carry out
installation of new software
required to support daily operation or for projects
Carry out
proper asset tracking
and
configuration management
Generate
ad-hoc reports
about the usage, performance and security of the IT infrastructure upon request when it is necessary for audit, utilization monitoring, budget planning or other reasons.
Carry out
regular review of logs
and carry out basic incident respond if necessary
Identify and recommend suitable commercial or open source solutions
to fulfill any unique project requirements
The personnel will need to have the different skillsets and experience to properly design, deploy and support IT infrastructure with focus on security and high availability.

At least 2 year of work experience as an IT administrator
Good experience with virtualization technologies (e.g. VMware vSphere and Microsoft Hyper-V) and its important feature (e.g. DRS for VMware)
Good experience with configuring and managing Microsoft cluster and SAN storage
Good experience with configuring and managing rules for security appliances such as firewall, IPS, etc
Good experience with administering Microsoft domain controller & GPO, MS Exchange, MS DNS, MS Server 2013 OS and MS client OS, MS SharePoint
Good knowledge of TCP/IP and experience with configuring and managing CISCO switch (e.g. configure VLAN)
Good working experience with configuring and managing web server, database and application server
Good working experience with hardening IT infrastructure
Experience with managing a corporate environment with DMZ (advantage)
Experience with Hadoop or other big data platform (advantage)
Experience with administering LINUX system (advantage)
Experience with rightsizing of the IT infrastructure (advantage)
Knowledge in Business Continuity Planning (advantage)
Experience in the cyber security industry (advantage)
Good documentation and communication skills
title: IT security administrator

description:
The Network Administrator installs and manages network and computer resources to ensure the provision of services in line with enterprise service level requirements. He/She monitors network performance for reliability to ensure minimum interruption in network service. He/She identifies, analyses and resolves hardware, software and network problems to improve levels of service. He/She creates a secure networking environment by planning and implementing security measures to protect the data, software and hardware on the network. He/She monitors and reports security breaches and any unauthorised data access. He/She schedules and performs software installations and upgrades to operating systems and software packages in accordance with established IT policies and procedures. He/She also implements a schedule of system and database backups.

Setting up, configuring and maintenance of
LAN / WAN network
Install, configure and troubleshoot
IP Phone, Cisco routes / switches
Provide support for
Windows system and Linux system for servers
Manage Networks Security and administration of firewalls
Software programming in
JAVA

description:
Regional role

Attractive salary package

About Our Client

Our client is a leading multinational professional service provider and consulting firm with a strong presence in APAC with Singapore being their regional headquarters. They are setting up they regional shared service centre for Technology operations in Singapore and are looking experienced SQL or Sybase Database Administrator to join them.

Job Description

As a Lead Database Administrator, you will be responsible for :

Providing both 2nd and 3rd line support to approximately 7,000 users across 34 countries on a 24/6 basis.

Providing SME guidance and technical resource while performing a crucial role in the delivery of global IT projects to implement upgrades, enhancements and new systems/technologies, in line with the Page Business Technology Strategy.

Installing, upgrading and maintaining Database server in production, QA and development environments.

Monitoring and tuning database servers and databases to ensure optimal performance and availability

Advising on database physical and logical design and SQL Coding while providing technical support for production systems and to Application and Infrastructure support teams.

Ensuring batch tasks are completed successfully while overseeing Data extraction, transformation and load (ETL)

The Successful Applicant

As a successful applicant you will have 5-8 years industry experience in a Sybase or MS SQL Server DBA role supporting both production and development environments (versions 2000, 2005, 2008, 2012 & 2014). You will have thorough understanding of database design and administration.

You will have strong hands on SQL / T-SQL scripting skills, including stored procedures / scheduled tasks, triggers functions and querying of the system catalogue.

You will have experience in SQL performance optimisation, Database server monitoring, SQL Server Agent job creation and scheduling.

A problem-solver and possess excellent interpersonal skills.

title: Lead Database Administrator (DB2)

description:
JPMC & Emerging Services:
Integrated Compute Services organization, within Global Technology Infrastructure (GTI), manages compute and storage services, core web products and services as well as evaluates and develops new technologies, and applies them to the needs of business services. The solutions developed within Emerging Services are aimed at keeping JP Morgan Chase on the leading edge of technological development to give the company a competitive advantage by supplying high quality firm wide solutions to complex problems.
GTI Emerging Services and Web Engineering is the core technology organization that designs, builds and provides support for the firm wide web/middleware products and services.
Position Summary:
As an Infrastructure Developer / Application Developer working in Web Engineering, you will be helping deliver major deliverables and being involved in aspects of the software development lifecycle including: design, testing and implementation. You will also be responsible for working with application teams and other firm wide technology teams to understand functional and technical requirements and partnering to develop successful solutions leveraging the team’s portfolio of services. Specifically you will be a development resource and will partner with other key technical leaders to build key applications that support the automation of web and infrastructure that are manually accomplished today. Additionally, the qualified candidate would be expected to contribute to the offering directly by working with other developers on the team and working to improve the services and applications that already exist and participating in testing/QA and code reviews.
Responsibilities:
Design and build systems that are scalable, robust, automatic, with least human touch to support and operate
Supports technical solutions with detailed business cases based on thorough the gathering and interpretation of business, technical and functional requirements
Participates on efforts around application and platform stability, resiliency, performance and enhancements to provide world class service to internal clients
Identify and implement areas for improvement within operational and technical processes/ implementations and maintain related documentation on a continuous basis
Provides technical assistance with the most challenging issues that span multiple systems, or show recurring trends that have not been successfully resolved
Create, implement, and adhere to operational and technical standards, best practices, processes and procedures (problem/change/release/request/procurement management; incident/service/time reporting)
Consult with internal clients on their technology risk and control environments to adhere to industry IT Risk and Cyber Security best practices
Ensure that solutions and services adhere to compliance standards (SOX, PCI DSS, OWASP, RBAC, Third Party Oversight, Control Assessments, Vulnerability Management, Access Administration).
Lead medium scale projects and deliver presentations to senior management with minimal supervision
Qualifications
Experience doing senior level programming with Java and/or Python, or .NET with a strong base in object-oriented and/or functional design and development.
Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations
Knowledge of management and development of platform services (PaaS) preferably large scale distributed production environments.
Understanding of data structures, algorithms and their performance
Knowledge of basic relational and/or non-relational database concepts
Experience with distributed systems and databases
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Understanding of Agile and Scrum development concepts.
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field
Preferred Qualifications:
Strong Linux skills – Administrator Level understanding including OS configuration, shell scripting, PXE and DHCP
Experience operating and developing in JVM-based environments
Experience working with Q/A automation tools like FitNesse and Selenium.
Familiar working with Jenkins and other CI/CD tools including the Atlassian suite including JIRA, Confluence or HipChat.
Experience working with or delivering cloud or other platform level technology or service (Cloud Foundry, Mesos, etc.) preferably in large and/or complex environments.
Configuration Management tool experience (Ansible, Saltstack, Puppet or CFEngine)
Knowledge of both commercial (Splunk, Elk, ElasticSearch, etc.) and open source log analytics tools and stacks would be a distinct advantage
Familiarity with the Python / Django framework.
Knowledge of management and development of PaaS environments
Experience working in a regulated Industry (Financial Services, Healthcare, etc.)
Someone who reads a lot of tech blogs and have formulated opinions on the use of technology
Our Global Technology Infrastructure Group is filled with innovators who love technology as much as you do. Together, you’ll use a disciplined, innovative and cost-effective approach to deliver a wide variety of high-quality products and services. You’ll work in a stable, resilient and secure operating environment where you—and the products you deliver—will thrive.
When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000+ technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world.
At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.
We strongly encourage all applicants to apply via our careers website where you are able join our Talent Network to receive customized vacancy notifications and ensure that your details are accessible by our global recruiting team - www.jpmorganchase.com/careers .
A quick link to this particular job posting can be found in this URL: http://jobs.jpmorganchase.com/ListJobs/ByKeyword/180010285/


Please note that only short-listed candidates will be notified. We thank you for your interest and wish you all the best in your career.


Yours Sincerely,

Human Resources

JPMorgan
title: Infrastructure Developer, Associate

description:
Ensure efficient smooth operations of all server and storage infrastructure across Asia Pacific systems with a team of specialist server administrators.
Manage lifecycle of equipment and systems by deploying, securing, migrating, patching, upgrading, troubleshooting, decommissioning and removal of system
Research, evaluate and adhere to best practices as recommended by principal vendor in architecture, design, topology, efficiency and security while ensuring compliance to SOX and audit requirements.
Participate as the lead subject matter expert and represent server operations team in projects or operational meetings.

Seven years experience in infrastructure role with 3 years as a full time systems administrator in large MNC with complex server, storage, virtualisation, replication and backup/disaster recovery environments.

Clear understanding of business processes and the impacts of information technology
Expert or very proficient in the following operating systems Microsoft Windows, Linux, Unix (AIX)

Strong in EMC, Hitachi, NetApp storage administration including hardware based replication
CCNA level networking skills in Cisco technology
Great team player who can work independently without guidance and under pressure. Effective communicator who can manage his own time as well as influence team members or peers to achieve desired results.
Database skills (Oracle and Sybase) is not compulsory but is highly valued.

title: IT Administrator / Web Administrator

description:
Your profile & role on the project

YOU:
Thrive on challenge. When was the last time you failed?
Are curious & always learning. What are you up to right now?
Can deal with constant change. When were you last surprised?
Have mastered at least one skill of your trade but you’re not defined by it. What can you teach us? Can you wear many hats?
YOU AGAIN:

The DevOps Architect will install, maintain, and support an on-premises cloud infrastructure

and apply DevOps practices and solutions. The person will also implement cloud-related and

DevOps technologies such as AWS/Puppet/Chef/Elk/Azure/Openstack. Other infrastructure related activities such as maintaining the company internal server infrastructure and respond

to consultant requests when required will be expected.
Install, maintain, and support on-premises and off-premises cloud stack.
Configure, maintain, and support the cloud-related infrastructures.
Act as a system administrator on different OSes (e.g. RHEL, Opensolaris, Ubuntu, etc.) and help teams deploy their application and automate their development and releases on the cloud.
Ability to develop solutions and self-learn new tools and technologies.
Document, and share knowledge on developed DevOps solutions.
STILL YOU:
Unix / Linux / Bash knowledge
Very good understanding of cloud computing (e.g. Technologies, Deployment, costing, HA/DR, etc.)
Good understanding of DevOps principles (e.g. testing automation, BDD, TDD, Release automation, CI/CD, etc.)
2 years experience with cloud deployment (e.g. Openstack, VMWare, AWS, Azure, Terraform, etc.)
1 year experience with testing automation (e.g. Maven, Selenium, HP QC, LoadRunner)
1 year experience with release automation process (e.g. CA-RA, Jenkins, etc.)
1 year experience with Configuration Management (e.g. Ansible, SaltStack, Puppet/Chef, etc.)
1 year experience with monitoring tools (e.g. ELK, Prometheus, Grafana and Splunk)
Experience with developing and implementing processes to handle releases from
Development to Operations while respecting internal rules, and offering solutions for rollback)
Experience with designing an architecture to implement development-to-production workflows.
Knowledge of SRE, Containers, Kubernetes, Openshift is a plus.
Good understanding of microservice architecture and DevOps practices that support.
Strong RDMS and NoSQL skill in deploying and fine tuning such as MySQL, Oracle, Elasticsearch.
Your role at PALO IT

You will be invited to take part in R&D works done within our Practices. You will have the

chance to assist or be a speaker at must-attend international IT conferences. You will have the

opportunity to write articles for our Blog or specialized press. Genuine ambassador of PALO IT,

you will present our offers and take an active role in the development of the company.


Your technical environment

# Cloud and DevOps based technologies (AWS/Puppet/Chef/Elk/Azure/Opencloud)

# DevOps practices

# Linux OS, Shell Scripting, SQL

# Agile and scrum environment
✔ You hold a Bachelor, Master or PhD degree in IT, Information Management and/or Computer Science
✔ You are just graduated or have less than 3 years of working experience
✔ Good knowledge of big data technology landscape and concepts related to distributed storage / computing
✔ Experience with big data frameworks (e.g. Hadoop, Spark) and distributions (Cloudera, Hortonworks, MapR)
✔ Experience with batch & ETL jobs to ingest and process data from multiple data sources
✔ Experience with NoSQL databases (e.g. Cassandra, MongoDB, Neo4J, ElasticSearch)
✔ Experience with querying tools (e.g Hive, Spark SQL, Impala)
✔ Experience or willingness to go in real-time stream processing, using solutions such as Kafka, Flume and/or Spark Streaming
✔ You are passionate about technology and continuous learning comes naturally to you
